name: alaska
sentence: Alaska is an American state located at the northwest end of the western coast of the country, just off Bering Strait.

name: alaska
sentence: Semi-exclusive from the United States, it borders the Canadian province of British Columbia and the Yukon Territory to the east and south-east and has a maritime boundary with the Russian Autonomous Okrug Chukotka to the west.

name: alaska
sentence: To the north are the seas of Chukchi and Beaufort of the Arctic Ocean, while the Pacific Ocean is to the south and southwest.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska is by far the largest state in the United States by region, comprising more total area than the other three states of Texas, California and Montana combined, and the seventh largest sub-national division in the world.

name: alaska
sentence: It is the third least populated and sparsely populated state, but by far the most populated territory of the continent, located mainly north of the 60th parallel, with an estimated population of 738,432 in 2015, more than the quadruple of the combined populations of northern Canada and Greenland.

name: alaska
sentence: Approximately half of Alaska's residents live in the Anchorage metropolitan area.

name: alaska
sentence: The capital of the state of Juneau is the second largest city in the United States by region, with more territories than the states of Rhode Island and Delaware.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has been occupied by various Aboriginal peoples for thousands of years before the arrival of Europeans.

name: alaska
sentence: The state is considered the point of entry for the colonization of North America by the Bering Land Bridge.

name: alaska
sentence: The Russians were the first Europeans to settle in the region from the 18th century, eventually creating Russian America, which extended over most of the current state.

name: alaska
sentence: The expenses and difficulties associated with maintaining this remote possession led to its sale to the United States in 1867 for US$7.2 million, or about two hundred per acre ($4.74/km2).

name: alaska
sentence: The region underwent several administrative changes before becoming an organized territory on 11 May 1912.

name: alaska
sentence: It was admitted as the 49th State of the United States on January 3, 1959.

name: alaska
sentence: Although it has one of the country's smallest state economies, Alaska's per capita income is among the highest, due to a diverse economy dominated by fishing, natural gas and oil, all of which are abundant.

name: alaska
sentence: U.S. military bases and tourism also make up an important part of the economy; more than half of the state is federal government public land, including a multitude of national forests, parks and wildlife refuges.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's Aboriginal population is proportionally the highest in all U.S. states, at more than 15 per cent.

name: alaska
sentence: Almost two dozen Aboriginal languages are spoken, and Alaskan natives exert considerable influence on local and state politics.

sentence: Literally, this means an object to which the action of the sea is directed.

sentence: The territorial waters of Alaska affect the territorial waters of Russia in the Bering Strait, as the Russian Big Diomede Island and the Little Diomede Island of Alaska are only 3 miles (4.8 km) away.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has a longer coastline than all the other American states combined.

sentence: At 663,268 square miles (1,717,856 km2) in the region, Alaska is by far the largest state in the United States and is more than double the size of the second-largest American state, Texas.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska is the seventh largest sub-national division in the world, and if it were an independent nation, it would be the world's 19th largest country.

name: alaska
sentence: The climate in southeastern Alaska is an oceanic climate of medium latitude (Köppen climate classification: Cfb) in southern sections and a subarctic oceanic climate (Köppen Cfc) in the northern parts.

name: alaska
sentence: Each year, the southeast is both the wettest and warmest part of Alaska with milder winter temperatures and high precipitation throughout the year.

name: alaska
sentence: Juneau has an average of more than 50 in (130 cm) precipitation per year and Ketchikan has an average of more than 150 in (380 cm).

name: alaska
sentence: It is also the only region in Alaska where the average temperature of the day is higher than freezing during the winter months.

name: alaska
sentence: The climate of Anchorage and south-central Alaska is mild according to Alaskan standards due to the proximity of the area's maritime coast.

name: alaska
sentence: While the region receives less rain than southeastern Alaska, it receives more snow, and the days tend to be clearer.

name: alaska
sentence: On average, Anchorage receives 16 in (41 cm) precipitation per year, with about 75 in (190 cm) snow, although there are regions in the south-central that receive much more snow.

name: alaska
sentence: It is a subarctic climate (Köppen: Dfc) due to its short and cool summers.

name: alaska
sentence: The climate of western Alaska is largely determined by the Bering Sea and the Gulf of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: It is a subarctic ocean climate to the southwest and a continental subarctic climate to the north.

sentence: The temperature is somewhat moderate given the distance north of the area.

sentence: This area has a wide variety of precipitation.

sentence: An area extending from the north side of the Seward Peninsula to the Kobuk River valley (i.e., the area around Kotzebue Strait) is technically a desert, with portions receiving less than 10 in (25 cm) precipitation per year.

sentence: Alaska's indoor climate is subarctic.

name: alaska
sentence: Summers may have temperatures up to 90°F (30°C low to mid), while in winter temperatures may fall below -60°F (−51°C).

name: alaska
sentence: Precipitation is rare indoors, often less than 10 cm (25 cm) per year, but precipitation that falls in winter tends to remain throughout the winter.

name: alaska
sentence: The highest and lowest temperatures recorded in Alaska are both in the interior.

sentence: The highest is 100°F (38°C) in Fort Yukon (which is only 8 mi or 13 km within the Arctic Circle) on June 27, 1915, making Alaska attached with Hawaii as the state with the lowest temperature in the United States.

sentence: The climate in the extreme north of Alaska is arctic (Köppen: ET) with long, very cold winters and short and cool summers.

sentence: Even in July, the mean low temperature in Utqiagvik is 34 °F (1 °C).

sentence: Precipitation is mild in this part of Alaska, with many locations on average less than 10 cm (25 cm) per year, mostly as snow remaining on the ground almost all year round.

sentence: Many indigenous peoples occupied Alaska for thousands of years before the arrival of the European peoples in the region.

sentence: The baby's DNA showed that it belonged to a population genetically distinct from other indigenous groups present elsewhere in the New World at the end of the Pleistocene.

sentence: The Tlingits have developed a society with a matrilineal system of inheritance of property and ancestry in what is now southeastern Alaska, as well as in parts of British Columbia and the Yukon.

sentence: The Tsimshians came from British Columbia to Alaska in 1887, when President Grover Cleveland and then the U.S. Congress gave them permission to settle on Annette Island and found the city of Metlakatla.

sentence: These three peoples, along with other Aboriginal peoples on the Pacific Northwest Coast, experienced smallpox outbreaks from the late 18th to mid-19th centuries, with the most devastating epidemics occurring in the 1830s and 1860s, resulting in high deaths and social disruptions.

name: alaska
sentence: The Aleutian Islands are still home to the Aleut people's maritime society, although they were the first Alaskan Amerindians to be exploited by the Russians.

name: alaska
sentence: West and southwestern Alaska are home to the Yup'ik, while their cousins the Alutiiq ~ Sugpiaq lived in what is now south-central Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The Gwich'in in the northern interior are Athabaskans, most of whom are known today for their dependence on caribou in the highly contested Arctic National Wildlife Refuge.

name: alaska
sentence: The north slope and Little Diomede Island are occupied by the widespread inupiat people.

name: alaska
sentence: Some researchers believe that the first Russian colony in Alaska was established in the seventeenth century.

name: alaska
sentence: According to this hypothesis, in 1648 several koches of the expedition of Semyon Dejnyov arrived to land in Alaska by storm and founded this colony.

name: alaska
sentence: This hypothesis is based on the testimony of the geographer of Chukchi Nikolai Daurkin, who had visited Alaska in 1764–65 and who had reported on a village on the Kheuveren River, populated by "bearded men" who "pray to icons".

name: alaska
sentence: Some modern researchers associate Kheuveren with Koyuk River.

name: alaska
sentence: The first European ship to reach Alaska was generally considered to be the Saint Gabriel under the authority of the surveyor M. S. Gvozdev and the deputy navigator I. Fyodorov, on 21 Aug. 1732, during an expedition of the Siberian Cossack A. F. Shestakov and the Russian explorer Dmitry Pavlutsky (1729–135).

name: alaska
sentence: Another European contact with Alaska took place in 1741, when Vitus Bering led an expedition for the Russian navy aboard the St. Peter's.

name: alaska
sentence: After the return of his crew to Russia with sea otter skins deemed to be the most beautiful furs in the world, small associations of fur traders began sailing from the shores of Siberia to the Aleutian islands.

name: alaska
sentence: The first permanent European establishment was established in 1784.

name: alaska
sentence: Between 1774 and 1800, Spain sent several expeditions to Alaska to assert its claim over the Pacific Northwest.

name: alaska
sentence: In 1789, a Spanish colony and a fort were built in the Strait of Nootka.

name: alaska
sentence: These expeditions gave names to places like Valdez, Bucareli Sound and Cordova.

name: alaska
sentence: Later, the Russian-American Company completed an expanded colonization program from the beginning to the mid-19th century.

name: alaska
sentence: Sitka, renamed New Archangel from 1804 to 1867, on Baranof Island in Alexander Archipelago, in what is now southeastern Alaska, became the capital of Russian America.

name: alaska
sentence: It remained the capital after the transfer of the colony to the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: The Russians have never completely colonized Alaska, and the colony has never been very profitable.

name: alaska
sentence: Evidence of Russian settlement in names and churches survive throughout southeastern Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: William H. Seward, US Secretary of State, negotiated the purchase of Alaska (also known as the Seward Folly) with the Russians in 1867 for $7.2 million.

name: alaska
sentence: The contemporary leader of Russia, Tsar Alexander II, Emperor of the Russian Empire, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Finland, also planned the sale; the purchase was made on 30 March 1867.

name: alaska
sentence: Six months later, the commissioners arrived in Sitka and the official transfer was arranged; the official raising of the flag took place at Fort Sitka on 18 October 1867.

name: alaska
sentence: At the ceremony, 250 American soldiers in uniform walked to the governor's house in "Castle Hill", where Russian troops lowered the Russian flag and the American flag was lifted.

name: alaska
sentence: This event is celebrated as Alaska Day, a holiday on October 18.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska was initially little governed by the army and was administered as a district from 1884, with a governor appointed by the President of the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: A Federal District Court had its seat in Sitka.

name: alaska
sentence: For most of the first decade of Alaska under the American flag, Sitka was the only community inhabited by American settlers.

sentence: They organized a "temporary municipal government", which was Alaska's first municipal government, but not in a legal sense.

sentence: The Alaska Heritage Resources Survey (AHRS) is a small inventory of all historical and prehistoric sites reported in the state of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: As of 31 January 2012, more than 35,000 sites have been reported.

sentence: According to statistics collected by the Association of Religion Data Archives in 2010, approximately 34% of Alaskans were members of religious congregations.

name: alaska
sentence: 100,960 people were identified as evangelical Protestants, 50,866 as Roman Catholics and 32,550 as frontline Protestants.

name: alaska
sentence: Approximately 4% are Mormons, 0.5% Jews, 1% Muslims, 0.5% Buddhists, 0.2% Bahá'ís and 0.5% Hindus.

name: alaska
sentence: The largest religious denominations in Alaska in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 50,866 adherents, non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 38,070 adherents, the Church of Jesus Christ of last-day saints with 32,170 adherents, and the Southern Baptist Convention with 19,891 adherents.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has been identified, along with the Pacific Northwest States Washington and Oregon, as the least religious states in the United States, in terms of church membership,

name: alaska
sentence: In 1795, the first Russian Orthodox Church was established in Kodiak.

name: alaska
sentence: Marriage to Alaska Native Americans helped Russian immigrants integrate into society.

name: alaska
sentence: As a result, an increasing number of Russian Orthodox churches have gradually established themselves in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska also has the largest population of Quaker (in percent) in any state.

name: alaska
sentence: In 2009, there were 6,000 Jews in Alaska (for which the observance of the halakha could pose particular problems).

name: alaska
sentence: Alaskan Hindus often share places and celebrations with members of other Asian religious communities, including Sikhs and Jains.

name: alaska
sentence: In 2010, the Hindus of Alaska established the Sri Gansha temple of Alaska, making it the first Hindu temple in Alaska and the most northern Hindu temple in the world.

name: alaska
sentence: It is estimated that there are between 2,000 and 3,000 Hindus in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The great majority of Hindus live in Anchorage or Fairbanks.

name: alaska
sentence: Estimates of the number of Muslims in Alaska range from 2,000 to 5,000.

sentence: In the late 1990s, the Islamic Community Centre in Anchorage began building a mosque in Anchorage.

sentence: Once completed, the mosque will be the first of the state and one of the most northerly mosques in the world.

sentence: The 2018 gross national product was $55 billion, the country's 48th largest.

sentence: Her per capita personal income for 2018 was $73,000, ranking 7th in the country.

name: alaska
sentence: According to a 2013 study by Phoenix Marketing International, Alaska had the fifth largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 6.75 percent.

name: alaska
sentence: The oil and gas industry dominates the Alaskan economy, with over 80% of the government's revenues from oil extraction.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's main export product (excluding oil and natural gas) is sea fish, mainly salmon, cod, Pollock and crab.

name: alaska
sentence: Agriculture represents a tiny fraction of Alaska's economy.

name: alaska
sentence: Agricultural production is mainly intended for consumption in the state and includes nurseries, dairy products, vegetables and livestock.

name: alaska
sentence: Manufacturing is limited, with most food and general goods imported elsewhere.

name: alaska
sentence: Employment primarily affects government and industries such as natural resource extraction, marine transportation and transportation.

name: alaska
sentence: Military bases are an important component of the economy of Fairbanks North Star, Anchorage and Kodiak Island, and Kodiak.

name: alaska
sentence: Federal subsidies are also an important part of the economy, enabling the state to keep taxes low.

name: alaska
sentence: Its industrial products include crude oil, natural gas, coal, gold, precious metals, zinc and other extractive industries, seafood processing, wood and wood products.

name: alaska
sentence: There is also a growing services and tourism sector.

name: alaska
sentence: Tourists contributed to the economy by supporting local accommodation.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has significant energy resources, although its oil reserves have been extensively depleted.

name: alaska
sentence: Significant oil and gas reserves were found in the Alaska North Slope (ANS) and Cook Inlet basins, but according to the Energy Information Administration, in February 2014, Alaska had fallen to fourth place in crude oil production after Texas, North Dakota and California.

name: alaska
sentence: Prudhoe Bay on the northern slope of Alaska is still the second-high-yielding oil field in the United States, usually producing about 400,000 barrels per day (64,000 m3/d), although at the beginning of 2014, the North Dakota Bakken Formation produced more than 900,000 barrels per day (140,000 m3/d).

name: alaska
sentence: Prudhoe Bay was the largest conventional oil deposit ever discovered in North America, but was much smaller than the huge Athabasca oil sands deposit in Canada, which in 2014 produced approximately 1,500 000 barrels per day (240,000 m3/d) of unconventional oil, and had hundreds of years of productive reserves at that rate.

name: alaska
sentence: The Trans-Alaska Pipeline can carry and pump up to 2.1 million barrels (330,000 m3) of crude oil per day, more than any other crude oil pipeline in the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: In addition, large deposits of coal are found in Alaska's bituminous, subbituminous, and lignite basins.

name: alaska
sentence: The U.S. Geological Survey estimates that there are 85.4 trillion cubic feet (2,420 km3) of undiscovered gas technically recoverable from natural gas hydrates on the northern slope of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska also offers some of the country's highest hydroelectric potential from its many rivers.

name: alaska
sentence: Large sections of the Alaskan coast also have potential for wind and geothermal energy.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's economy relies heavily on increasingly expensive diesel fuel for heating, transportation, electrical energy and light.

name: alaska
sentence: Although wind and hydroelectric power is abundant and underdeveloped, proposals for state-wide energy systems (e.g.:

name: alaska
sentence: It was found not to be cost-effective (at the time of reporting, 2001) due to low fuel prices (less than 50¢/gal), long distances, and low population.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of one gallon of gas in urban Alaska is generally thirty to sixty cents higher than the national average; prices in rural areas are generally much higher, but vary greatly depending on transportation costs, seasonal peaks of use, nearby oil development infrastructure and many other factors.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaska Permanent Fund is an appropriation authorized by the Constitution of Oil Revenues, established by voters in 1976 to manage the surplus of the state's oil revenues, largely in anticipation of the recently built trans-alaska pipeline network.

name: alaska
sentence: The fund was originally proposed by Governor Keith Miller on the eve of the sale of the Prudhoe Bay lease in 1969, for fear that legislators would spend all the proceeds of the sale (i.e. $900 million) at the same time.

name: alaska
sentence: It was then defended by Governor Jay Hammond and State representative Kenai Hugh Malone.

name: alaska
sentence: This is an attractive political perspective since then, diverting revenues that would normally be deposited into the general fund.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaskan Constitution was drafted to discourage the allocation of public funds for a particular purpose.

name: alaska
sentence: The Permanent Fund has become the rare exception to this, mainly because of the political climate of mistrust that prevails at the time of its creation.

name: alaska
sentence: From its initial capital of $734,000, the fund has increased to $50 billion through oil royalties and capital investment programs.

name: alaska
sentence: Most if not all of the capital is invested conservatively outside Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: This has led to frequent calls from Alaskan politicians for the Fund to make investments in Alaska, although such a position has never gained momentum.

name: alaska
sentence: Beginning in 1982, dividends from the annual growth of the fund were paid each year to eligible Alaskans, ranging from an initial amount of $1,000 in 1982 (equal to three years of payment, since the distribution of payments was retained in a distribution plan proceeding) to $3,269 in 2008 (which included a one-time amount of $1,200 "Resource Rebate").

name: alaska
sentence: Each year, the state legislature withdraws 8% of the earnings, gives 3% to the capital for proof of inflation, and the remaining 5% is distributed to all eligible Alaskans.

name: alaska
sentence: To be eligible for the Permanent Fund dividend, one must have lived in the State for at least 12 months, keep his permanent residence subject to authorized absences and not be subject to judicial judgements or criminal convictions that fall within various categories of exclusion or may subject the amount of the payment to civil arrest.

name: alaska
sentence: The Permanent Fund is often seen as one of the main examples of a "core income" policy around the world.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of goods in Alaska has long been higher than in the 48 contiguous states.

name: alaska
sentence: Federal public servants, particularly employees of the United States Postal Service (USPS) and members on active duty, receive a subsistence allowance usually set at 25% of basic pay because, although the cost of living has decreased, it remains one of the highest in the country.

name: alaska
sentence: Rural Alaska is experiencing extremely high prices for food and consumer goods compared to the rest of the country, due to relatively limited transportation infrastructure.

name: alaska
sentence: Because of the northern climate and the short growing season, there are relatively few farms in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Most of the farms are located either in the Matanuska Valley, about 64 km northeast of Anchorage, or on the Kenai Peninsula, about 97 km southwest of Anchorage.

name: alaska
sentence: The short 100-day growing season limits crops that can be grown, but the long sunny summer days make growing seasons productive.

name: alaska
sentence: Primary crops include potatoes, carrots, lettuce and cabbage.

name: alaska
sentence: The Tanana Valley is another notable agricultural site, particularly the Delta Junction area, about 160 kilometres south-east of Fairbanks, with a significant concentration of farms growing agronomic crops, mainly to the north and east of Fort Greely.

name: alaska
sentence: This region was largely set aside and developed as part of a state programme led by Hammond during his second term as governor.

name: alaska
sentence: Crops in the delta region are mainly made up of barley and hay.

name: alaska
sentence: To the west of Fairbanks is another concentration of small farms that deal with restaurants, the hotel and tourism industry, and community farming.

name: alaska
sentence: In recent years, Alaskan agriculture has seen strong growth in market gardeners, small farms and agricultural markets, with the largest percentage increase (46%) in agricultural market growth in the country in 2011, compared to 17% nationally.

name: alaska
sentence: The peony industry has also taken off, as the growing season allows farmers to harvest during a supply gap elsewhere in the world, thus filling a niche in the flower market.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska, with no counties, lacks county fairs.

name: alaska
sentence: However, a small assortment of state and local fairs (with Alaska's largest state fair in Palmer) take place mainly in late summer.

name: alaska
sentence: Fairs are primarily located in communities with historical or current agricultural activity, and feature local farmers who exhibit products in addition to more publicized commercial activities such as carnival walks, concerts and food.

name: alaska
sentence: "Alaska Grown" is used as an agricultural slogan.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has an abundance of seafood, with the major Bering Sea and North Pacific fisheries.

name: alaska
sentence: Seafood is one of the few foods that are often cheaper within the state than outside.

name: alaska
sentence: Many Alaskans take advantage of salmon seasons to harvest portions of their domestic diet while fishing for subsistence, as well as for sport.

name: alaska
sentence: This includes fish caught by hook, net, or wheel.

name: alaska
sentence: Subsistence hunting, mainly caribou, moose and Dall's sheep, is still common in the state, particularly in the remote communities of Bush.

name: alaska
sentence: An example of traditional indigenous food is Akutaq, the Eskimo Ice Cream, which may consist of reindeer fat, seal oil, dried fish meat and local berries.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska reindeer farming is concentrated on the Seward Peninsula, where wild caribou can be prevented from mixing and migrating with domestic reindeer.

name: alaska
sentence: Most food in Alaska is transported to the state from the outside, and shipping costs make food relatively expensive in cities.

name: alaska
sentence: In rural areas, hunting and subsistence gathering are essential activities because imported food is prohibitive.

name: alaska
sentence: Although most of the small towns and villages in Alaska are along the coast, the cost of importing food into remote villages can be high, due to the terrain and difficult road conditions, which are changing considerably due to changes in climate and precipitation.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of transportation can be up to 50¢ per pound ($1.10/kg) or more in some remote areas, during the most difficult periods, if these locations can be reached at all during these adverse weather conditions and terrain conditions.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of delivering an American gallon of milk (3.8 L) is approximately $3.50 in many villages where per capita income can be $20,000 or less.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of fuel per gallon is consistently twenty to thirty cents above the contiguous U.S. average, with only Hawaii having higher prices.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has few road links compared to the rest of the United States

name: alaska
sentence: The state's road network covers a relatively small area of the state, linking the central population centres and the Alaska Highway, the main exit route from the state across Canada.

name: alaska
sentence: The state capital, Juneau, is not accessible by road, only a motor ferry; this has led for decades to the debate about moving the capital to a city on the road network, or the construction of a road link from Haines.

name: alaska
sentence: The western part of Alaska does not have a road network linking the communities to the rest of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The interstate highways in Alaska comprise a total of 1082 miles.

name: alaska
sentence: One of the unique features of the Alaska Highway system is the Anton Anderson Memorial Tunnel, an Alaskan railway tunnel in operation recently renovated to provide an asphalt road link with the isolated community of Whittier, on Prince William Strait, to Seward Road, approximately 80 kilometres southeast of Anchorage, Portage.

name: alaska
sentence: At 4.0 km, the tunnel was the longest road tunnel in North America until 2007.

name: alaska
sentence: The tunnel is North America's longest road and rail tunnel.

name: alaska
sentence: Built around 1915, the Alaskan Railway (ARR) played a key role in the development of Alaska until the 20th century.

name: alaska
sentence: It connects North Pacific navigation by providing critical infrastructure with routes from Seward to the interior of Alaska through south-central Alaska, through Anchorage, Eklutna, Wasilla, Talkeetna, Denali and Fairbanks, with spurs to Whittier, Palmer and the North Pole.

name: alaska
sentence: Cities, villages and the area served by the ARR are known throughout the State as "The Railway Belt".

name: alaska
sentence: In recent years, the continuous improvement of the asphalt road network has begun to overshadow the importance of the railway to the Alaskan economy.

name: alaska
sentence: The railway played a key role in Alaska's development, moving freight to Alaska while transporting natural resources south, such as coal from the Usibelli coal mine near Healy at Seward and gravel from the Matanuska Valley to Anchorage.

name: alaska
sentence: It is well known for its summer tourism service.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaskan Railway was one of the last railways in North America to use caboos in regular service and still use them on some gravel trains.

name: alaska
sentence: It continues to offer one of the last flag stopping roads in the country.

name: alaska
sentence: A section of about 100 km of track along an area north of Talkeetna remains inaccessible by road

name: alaska
sentence: Until the construction of the park road in the 1970s, the railway provided the only land access to most of the area along its entire route.

name: alaska
sentence: In northeastern Alaska, White Pass and the Yukon Highway also partly cross the state from Skagway north to Canada (British Columbia and Yukon), crossing the border at the White Pass Summit.

name: alaska
sentence: This line is now mainly used by tourists, often arriving by cruise ship to Skagway.

name: alaska
sentence: It was featured in the 1983 BBC TV series Great Little Railways.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaska Railway network is not externally connected.

name: alaska
sentence: (The closest link to the North American rail system is the northwestern terminus of Canada's National Railway at Prince Rupert, British Columbia, several hundred miles southeast.)

name: alaska
sentence: In 2000, the U.S. Congress authorized $6 million to study the feasibility of a rail link between Alaska and Canada, and the 48 less.

name: alaska
sentence: Some private companies provide a float service between Whittier and Seattle.

name: alaska
sentence: Many towns and villages in the State do not have access to the road or highway; the only modes of access are air, river or sea travel.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's well-developed ferry network (known as the Alaska Highway) serves the cities of the southeast, the Gulf Coast and the Alaska Peninsula.

name: alaska
sentence: Ferries carry vehicles as well as passengers.

name: alaska
sentence: The network also operates a ferry service from Bellingham, Washington, and Prince Rupert, British Columbia, in Canada, through the inland passage to Skagway.

name: alaska

sentence: What is now known as the State of Arizona was initially administered by the United States Government in the territory of New Mexico until the southern part of that region separated from the Union to form the territory of Arizona.

sentence: This newly created territory was officially organized by the federal government of the Confederate States on Saturday, January 18, 1862, when President Jefferson Davis approved and signed a law to organize the territory of Arizona, marking the first official use of the name "Territory of Arizona".

name: arizona
sentence: The southern territory provided the Confederate government with men, horses and equipment.

name: arizona
sentence: Formed in 1862, the Arizona Scout Companies served with the Army of Confederate States during the American Civil War.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona has the westernmost military engagement recorded during the Civil War with the Battle of Picacho Pass (1862).

name: arizona
sentence: The federal government declared a new U.S. territory of Arizona, consisting of the western half of the former territory of New Mexico, in Washington, D.C., on February 24, 1863.

name: arizona
sentence: These new limits would later form the basis of the state.

name: arizona
sentence: The first territorial capital, Prescott, was founded in 1864 following a gold rush to central Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The capital was then moved to Tucson, back to Prescott, and then to its final location in Phoenix in a series of controversial movements that different parts of the territory gained and lost political influence with the growth and development of the territory.

name: arizona
sentence: Although names including "Gadsonia", "Pimeria", "Montezuma" and "Arizuma" were considered for the territory, when 16th President Abraham Lincoln signed the final bill, he read "Arizona", and that name was adopted.

name: arizona
sentence: (Montezuma was not derived from Emperor Aztec, but was the sacred name of a divine hero for the Pima people of the Gila River valley.

name: arizona
sentence: It was probably considered – and rejected – for its sentimental value before Congress ruled on the name "Arizona".

name: arizona
sentence: Brigham Young, patriarchal leader of the Church of Jesus Christ of Last-Day Saints in Salt Lake City, Utah, sent Mormons to Arizona in the middle and late nineteenth century.

name: arizona
sentence: They founded Mesa, Snowflake, Heber, Safford and other cities.

name: arizona
sentence: They also settled in the Valley of the Sun, Tempe, Prescott and other areas.

name: arizona
sentence: The Mormons have established what became northern Arizona and northern New Mexico.

name: arizona
sentence: At the time, these areas were located in part of the former territory of New Mexico.

name: arizona
sentence: During the 19th century, a series of gold and silver rushes occurred in the territory, the most famous being the 1870s punched at the silver Bonanzas of Tombstone, Arizona in southeastern Arizona, also known for its legendary outlaws and lawmakers.

name: arizona
sentence: In the late 1880s, copper production overshadowed precious metals with the rise of copper camps such as Bisbee, Arizona and Jerome, Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The boom and collapse of the mining economy also left hundreds of ghost cities across the territory, but copper mining continued to thrive with the territory producing more copper than any other state in 1907, which won Arizona the nickname "the state of copper" at the time of the state.

name: arizona
sentence: During the first years of the state, the industry experienced increasing pains and labour disputes with the deportation of Bisbee from 1917 the result of a strike by copper miners.

name: arizona
sentence: The state continues to produce half of the newly extracted copper from the nation.

name: arizona
sentence: During the Mexican Revolution from 1910 to 1920, several battles were waged in Mexican cities just across the border of the Arizona colonies.

name: arizona
sentence: Throughout the revolution, many Arizonans joined one of the several fighting armies in Mexico.

name: arizona
sentence: Only two major engagements took place on American soil between American and Mexican forces: the Columbus raid of Pancho Villa in 1916 in New Mexico, and the Battle of Ambos Nogales in 1918 in Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The Mexicans won the first battle, and the Americans won it.

name: arizona
sentence: After Mexican federal troops fired at U.S. soldiers, the U.S. garrison launched an attack on Nogales in Mexico.

name: arizona
sentence: The Mexicans finally surrendered after the two sides suffered heavy losses.

name: arizona
sentence: A few months earlier, just west of Nogales, an Indian war battle had taken place, considered the last engagement in American Indian wars, which lasted from 1775 to 1918.

name: arizona
sentence: American soldiers stationed at the border faced Yaqui Indians who used Arizona as a base to attack neighbouring Mexican colonies in their wars against Mexico.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona became an American state on February 14, 1912, that is to say, Valentine's Day.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona was the 48th admitted state in the United States and the last of the contiguous states to be admitted.

name: arizona
sentence: Cotton farming and copper extraction, two of Arizona's largest state-wide industries, suffered greatly during the Great Depression.

name: arizona
sentence: But in the 1920s and even in the 1930s, tourism began to grow as the important Arizona industry it is today.

name: arizona
sentence: Dudes ranches, such as the K L Bar and Remuda in Wickenburg, as well as the Flying V and Tanque Verde in Tucson, gave tourists the opportunity to take part in the taste and activities of the "Old West".

name: arizona
sentence: Several high-end hotels and resorts have opened during this period, some of which are still major tourist attractions.

name: arizona
sentence: They include the Arizona Biltmore Hotel in central Phoenix (opened in 1929) and the Wigwam Resort on the west side of the Phoenix area (opened in 1936).

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona was the site of the German prisoners of war camps during the Second World War and the American Japanese internment camps.

name: arizona
sentence: Because of the fear of a Japanese invasion of the west coast of the United States (which, in fact, materialized in the Aleutian Islands campaign in June 1942), the government authorized the removal of all American Japanese residents from the entire territory of Alaska and California, the western half of Washington and Oregon, and southern Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: From 1942 to 1945 they were forced to reside in internment camps built inside the country.

name: arizona
sentence: Many lost their homes and businesses.

name: arizona
sentence: The camps were abolished after the Second World War.

name: arizona
sentence: The German P.O.W. in the Phoenix region.

name: arizona
sentence: The site was purchased after the war by the Maytag family (known for household appliances).

name: arizona
sentence: It was designed as the site of the Phoenix Zoo.

name: arizona
sentence: A Japanese-American internment camp was located on Mount Lemmon, just outside the southeastern city of Tucson.

name: arizona
sentence: Another prisoner of war camp was located near the Gila River in eastern Yuma County.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is also home to the Phoenix Indian School, one of many federal Indian boarding schools designed to assimilate Amerindian children into European-American culture.

name: arizona
sentence: Children were often enrolled in such schools against the will of their parents and families.

name: arizona
sentence: Attempts to remove Aboriginal identities include forcing children to cut their hairs, take and use English names, speak only English, and practise Christianity rather than their Aboriginal religions.

name: arizona
sentence: Many Arizona Native Americans fought for the United States during World War II.

name: arizona
sentence: Their experiences led to an increasing activism in the post-war years to obtain better treatment and civil rights after their return to the state.

name: arizona
sentence: After Maricopa County did not allow them to register to vote in 1948, veteran Frank Harrison and Harry Austin of the Mojave-Apache tribe of Fort McDowell Indian Reservation filed a lawsuit, Harrison and Austin v. Laveen, challenging this exclusion.

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona Supreme Court ruled in their favor.

name: arizona
sentence: The population of Arizona increased dramatically with residential and commercial development after the Second World War, helped by the widespread use of air conditioning, which made summers intensely warmer.

name: arizona
sentence: According to the Arizona Blue Book (published annually by the Arizona Secretary of State's office), the state population in 1910 was 294,353.

name: arizona
sentence: The percentage of growth per decade has averaged about 20 per cent in the previous decades and about 60 per cent in each decade thereafter.

name: arizona
sentence: In the 1960s, retirement communities were established.

name: arizona
sentence: These age-limited subdivisions catered exclusively to the needs of the elderly and attracted many pensioners who wanted to escape the harsh winters of the Midwest and Northeast.

name: arizona
sentence: Sun City, founded by developer Del Webb and inaugurated in 1960, was one of the first communities of this type.

name: arizona
sentence: Green Valley, south of Tucson, was another community of this type, conceived as a retirement subdivision for Arizona teachers.

name: arizona
sentence: Many seniors from the United States and Canada come to Arizona every winter and only stay during the winter months.

name: arizona
sentence: In March 2000, Arizona was the site of the first legally binding election ever held on the Internet to nominate a candidate to a public service.

name: arizona
sentence: In Arizona Democratic Primary 2000, under worldwide attention, Al Gore beat Bill Bradley.

name: arizona
sentence: Electoral participation in primary education in that State has increased by more than 500 per cent compared to primary education in 1996.

name: arizona
sentence: Three ships called USArizona were baptized in honor of the state, although only USArizona (BB-39) was named after the state was reached.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is in the southwest of the United States as one of Four Corners' states.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is the sixth largest state in the region, ranked after New Mexico and before Nevada.

name: arizona
sentence: Of the 295,000 square kilometres of the State, about 15 per cent are privately owned.

name: arizona
sentence: The rest consist of forests and public parks, state lands and Indian reserves.

name: arizona
sentence: There are 24 national parks maintained in Arizona, including the three Grand Canyon National Parks, Saguaro National Park and Petrified Forest National Park.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is well known for its desert region of the basin and range in the southern parts of the state, which is rich in a landscape of xerophytic plants such as cactus.

name: arizona
sentence: The topography of this area was shaped by prehistoric volcanism, followed by cooling and related subsidence.

name: arizona
sentence: Its climate has exceptionally hot summers and mild winters.

name: arizona
sentence: The state is less known for its north-central part covered with pines from the highland of the Colorado Plateau (see Arizona Mountains forests).

name: arizona
sentence: Like other states in the southwest of the United States, Arizona has an abundance of mountains and plateaus.

name: arizona
sentence: Despite the state's aridity, 27% of Arizona is a forest, a percentage comparable to Romania or Greece today.

name: arizona
sentence: The world's largest ponderosa pine stand is in Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: Mogollon Rim, a 609-metre escarpment, crosses the central section of the state and marks the southwest boundary of the Colorado plateau.

name: arizona
sentence: In 2002, it was an area of the late Rodeo-Chediski, the worst fire in the history of the State until 2011.

name: arizona
sentence: Located in northern Arizona, the Grand Canyon is a colorful, deep and steep gorge carved by the Colorado River.

name: arizona
sentence: The canyon is one of the seven natural wonders of the world and is largely found in Grand Canyon National Park, one of the first national parks in the United States.

name: arizona
sentence: President Theodore Roosevelt was one of the main supporters of the designation of the Grand Canyon as a national park, often visiting to hunt the mountain lion and enjoy the landscape.

name: arizona
sentence: The canyon was created by Colorado to cut a channel over millions of years, and is about 277 miles (446 km) long, ranging from 4 to 18 miles (9 to 29 km) and reaching a depth of more than one mile (1.6 km).

name: arizona
sentence: Nearly two billion years of Earth's history were exposed when the Colorado River and its tributaries crossed sediment layers after the Colorado plateau rose.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is home to one of the world's most well-preserved meteorite impact sites.

name: arizona
sentence: Created about 50,000 years ago, the Barringer Meteorite Crater (more known as the Meteor Crater) is a huge hole in the middle of the high plains of the Colorado Plateau, about 40 kilometres west of Winslow.

name: arizona
sentence: A ledge of broken and paired blocks, some of which are small houses, is 46 metres above the level of the surrounding plain.

name: arizona
sentence: The crater itself measures nearly a mile (1.6 km) wide and 570 feet (170 m) deep.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona is one of the two American states (Hawaii being the other) that do not observe Daylight Saving Time.

name: arizona

name: arizona
sentence: In general, Arizona is at low risk of earthquakes, with the exception of the southwestern part, which is at moderate risk because of its proximity to southern California.

name: arizona
sentence: On the other hand, northern Arizona is at moderate risk due to numerous faults in the region.

name: arizona
sentence: Areas near and west of Phoenix are at the lowest risk.

name: arizona
sentence: The first earthquakes in Arizona were recorded in Fort Yuma on the California side of the Colorado River.

name: arizona
sentence: They were centered near the imperial valley, or Mexico, in the 1800s.

name: arizona
sentence: Douglas residents experienced the Sonora earthquake of 1887 with an epicentre of 64 km to the south in the Mexican state of Sonora.

name: arizona
sentence: The first harmful earthquake known to be centered in Arizona occurred on January 25, 1906, including a series of other centered earthquakes near Socorro, New Mexico.

name: arizona
sentence: The shock was violent at Flagstaff.

name: arizona
sentence: In September 1910, a series of 52 earthquakes led to the departure of a construction team near Flagstaff.

name: arizona
sentence: In 1912, when Arizona reached state status on August 18, an earthquake caused a 50-mile crack in the San Francisco chain.

name: arizona
sentence: In early January 1935, the state experienced a series of earthquakes in the Yuma area and near the Grand Canyon.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona experienced its largest earthquake in 1959, with a tremor of magnitude 5.6.

name: arizona
sentence: It was centered near Fredonia, in the northwest of the state near the Utah border.

name: arizona
sentence: The earthquake was felt across the border in Nevada and Utah.

name: arizona
sentence: Due to its large size and variations in altitude, the state has a wide variety of localized climatic conditions.

name: arizona
sentence: At low altitudes, the climate is mostly desert, with mild winters and extremely warm summers.

name: arizona
sentence: Usually, from late autumn to early spring, the weather is mild, on average a minimum of 60°F (16°C).

name: arizona
sentence: November to February are the coldest months, with temperatures generally ranging from 40 to 75°F (4 to 24°C), with occasional frosts.

name: arizona
sentence: By mid-February, temperatures began to rise, with warm days, and cool, chaotic nights.

name: arizona
sentence: The summer months of June to September bring dry heat of 90 to 120 °F (32 to 49 °C), with sometimes high temperatures above 125 °F (52 °C) observed in the desert.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona's historical record is 128°F (53°C) recorded at Havasu City Lake on June 29, 1994 and July 5, 2007; the record record of −40°F (−40°C) was recorded at Hawley Lake on January 7, 1971.

name: arizona
sentence: Due to mainly dry weather, large variations in daytime temperature occur in less developed desert areas above 2,500 feet (760 m).

name: arizona
sentence: The swings can reach 83°F (46°C) in summer.

name: arizona
sentence: In urban centres of the State, the effects of local warming lead to much higher nightfalls than in the recent past.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona has an average annual rainfall of 12.7 in (323 mm), which occurs during two rainy seasons, with cold fronts coming from the Pacific Ocean during the winter and a monsoon in the summer.

name: arizona
sentence: The monsoon season takes place around the end of the summer.

name: arizona
sentence: In July or August, the dew point increases significantly for a short period of time.

name: arizona
sentence: During this period, the air contains large quantities of water vapour.

name: arizona
sentence: Dew points to 81°F (27°C) were recorded during the Phoenix monsoon season.

name: arizona
sentence: This warm humidity brings lightning, thunderstorms, wind and torrential rain, if they are usually brief.

name: arizona
sentence: These showers often cause sudden flooding, which can become fatal.

name: arizona
sentence: To deter drivers from crossing flooded rivers, the Arizona Legislative Assembly enacted the Stupid Motorists Act.

name: arizona
sentence: It is rare that tornadoes or hurricanes occur in Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The northern third of Arizona is a plateau at much higher altitudes than the lower desert, and has a significantly cooler climate, with cold winters and mild summers, although the climate remains semi-arid to arid.

name: arizona
sentence: Extremely cold temperatures are not unknown; cold air systems in northern states and Canada sometimes grow in the state, bringing temperatures below 0°F (−18°C) to the northern parts of the state.

name: arizona
sentence: Indicative of climate variation, Arizona is the state that has both the metropolitan area with the most days more than 100°F (38°C) (Phoenix), and the metropolitan area in the 48 lower states with the most days with a low temperature under frost (Flagstaff).

name: arizona

sentence: Airports with scheduled commercial flights include: Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport (IATA: PHX, ICAO: KPHX) in Phoenix (the largest airport in the State and the largest international airport); Tucson International Airport (IATA: TUS, ICAO: KTUS) in Tucson; Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport (IATA: AZA, ICAO: KIWA) in Mesa; Yuma International Airport (IATA: NYL, ICAO: KNYL) in Yuma; Prescott Municipal Airport (PRC) in Prescott; Flagstaff Pulliam Airport (IATA: FLG, ICAO: KFLG) in Flagstaff and Grand Canyon National Park Airport (IATA: GCN, ICAO: KGCN, FAA: GCN), a small but busy facility offering tourist flights, mainly from Las Vegas.

name: arizona
sentence: Phoenix is the capital city of Arizona.

name: arizona
sentence: The Arizona Legislature is bicameral (like the Legislature of all other states except Nebraska) and consists of a thirty-member senator and a 60-member House of Representatives.

sentence: Each legislature is for a period of two years.

name: arizona
sentence: The first session after the general election is known as the first regular session, and the second year is known as the second regular session.

name: arizona
sentence: Each ordinary session shall begin on the second Monday in January and shall adjourn sine die (ending for the year) no later than the Saturday of the week in which the hundredth day of the beginning of the ordinary session falls.

name: arizona
sentence: The Speaker of the Senate and Speaker of the House may, by regulation, extend the sitting for a further seven days.

name: arizona
sentence: Thereafter, the session may only be extended by a majority vote of the members present in each chamber.

name: arizona
sentence: Senators and representatives of Arizona States are elected for a two-year term and are limited to four consecutive terms in a House, although there is no limit to the total number of terms.

sentence: After the men were denied the opportunity to register in Maricopa County, they filed an action against the Registrar.

name: arizona

name: arizona
sentence: They were the only two States that had continued to prohibit the Amerindians from voting.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado (other variants) is a state in the western United States that encompasses most of the southern Rocky Mountains, as well as the northeastern part of the Colorado Plateau and the western edge of the Great Plains.

name: colorado

sentence: With rising temperatures and reduced water availability, Colorado's agricultural, forestry and tourism economies are expected to be severely affected by climate change.

name: colorado
