sentence: This railway also provides tracks for the Amtrak Zephyr California passenger train, which crosses the Rocky Mountains between Denver and Grand Junction by a route on which there are no continuous roads.

name: colorado
sentence: The western slope includes several notable destinations in the Colorado Rocky Mountains, including Glenwood Springs, with its ski resort thermal springs, and the Aspen, Breckenridge, Vail, Crested Butte, Steamboat Springs and Telluride ski resorts.

name: colorado
sentence: Graduate studies are available at Colorado Mesa University, Grand Junction, Western Colorado University, Gunnison, Fort Lewis College, Durango, Colorado Mountain College, Glenwood Springs, and Steamboat Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners Monument, located in the southwest corner of Colorado, marks the common border of Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona and Utah, the only place of its kind in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's climate is more complex than states outside of the mountain states region.

name: colorado
sentence: In contrast to most other states, southern Colorado is not always warmer than northern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of Colorado consists of mountains, foothills, high plains and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: The surrounding mountains and valleys significantly affect the local climate.

name: colorado
sentence: As a rule, with an increase in altitude comes a decrease in temperature and an increase in precipitation.

name: colorado
sentence: Northeastern, eastern and southeastern Colorado are mainly the high plains, while northern Colorado is a mixture of high plains, foothills and mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Northwestern and western Colorado are mostly mountainous, with some desert lands mixed.

name: colorado
sentence: Southwestern and southern Colorado are a complex mix of desert regions and mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of the eastern plains is semi-arid (Köppen climate classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually from 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 millimetres) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: The region is known for its abundant sun and cool and light nights, which gives this region a large range of average daytime temperature.

name: colorado
sentence: The difference between the highs of the days and the lows of the nights can be considerable because the heat dissipates in the space during the clear nights, since thermal radiation is not trapped by the clouds.

name: colorado
sentence: The Front Range urban corridor, home to most of Colorado's population, is in a shade of precipitation due to its presence on the lee side of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In summer, this zone may have several days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).

name: colorado
sentence: In the plains, winter lows typically range from 25 to -10°F (−4 to -23°C).

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 75% of precipitation occurs during the growing season, from April to September, but this region is highly drought-prone.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the precipitation comes from thunderstorms, which can be severe, and from severe snowstorms that occur in winter and early spring.

name: colorado
sentence: Otherwise, winters tend to be usually dry and cold.

name: colorado
sentence: In much of the region, the month of March is the most snowy month.

name: colorado
sentence: April and May are usually the wettest months, while April is the wettest month in total.

name: colorado
sentence: The cities of Front Range closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter due to Chinook winds that warm the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The average July temperature is 55°F (13°C) in the morning and 90°F (32°C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean January temperature is 18 °F (−8 °C) in the morning and 48 °F (9 °C) in the afternoon, although the variation between consecutive days may be 40 °F (20 °C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and in the foothills, there are a wide variety of climatic types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations within a few kilometres of distance can experience a completely different time depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate that is no different from the eastern plains, which moves to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: Microclimates also exist in local areas that cover almost the full spectrum of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although a significant portion of extreme climate change occurs in the less populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Storms are common east of the continental ditch in the spring and summer, but are usually short.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is a common view in the mountains east of the Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most commonly reported serious weather hazard for the warm season, and occasionally causes human injuries as well as significant damage to property.

name: colorado
sentence: The Eastern Plains are subject to some of the largest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: Examples include the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most costly in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some of the harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town in 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, whether from mesocyclones in storms of supercells or less intense lands, such as in the Denver convergence vorticity zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods caused by both thunderstorms and the rapid melting of snow in the mountains during warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable examples include the Denver flood in 1965, the Big Thompson flood in 1976, and the Colorado flood in 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common during the summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's 1901 record for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days exceeded the previous record of almost a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of Colorado is very dry, with the average condition of only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year at the state level.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely experiences a time when a part is not in a certain degree of drought.

name: colorado
sentence: Lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the Hayman fire in 2002.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire, and the June 2012 High Park Fire, and the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, the Cameron Peak fire, and the Eastern Troublefire in 2020, all of the largest fires in Colorado history (see Colorado Forest Fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some mountainous areas of Colorado receive a high amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: Spring melting of these snows often causes high water flows in the Yampa River, Colorado River, Rio Grande, Arkansas, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, towns and cities in southwestern New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A large amount of water is also diverted for use in California; occasionally (formerly naturally and regularly) water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 in Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous terrain, Colorado is relatively calm from a seismic point of view.

name: colorado
sentence: The National Earthquake Information Centre in the United States is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On 22 August 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 kilometres west-southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small number of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second largest earthquake in Colorado's history.

name: colorado
sentence: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 was registered in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: In the early morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes caught up with the state of Colorado, ranging from magnitude 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, including a majority of 2 to 3.5 earthquakes across Richter.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for over 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site in Larimer County contains artifacts from approximately 11200 B.C. to 3000 B.C.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern edge of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The ancient Pueblo peoples lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation has inhabited the valleys of the Rocky Mountains of the South and the Rocky Mountains of the West, even to the east of the Front Chain these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and Comanches also lived in the eastern and southeastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved westward to hunt across the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its New Mexico province before the United States took part in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim east of the Rocky Mountains with the purchase of Louisiana of France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim runs counter to Spain's claim to the upper Arkansas basin as the exclusive commercial zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led a US Army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish riders in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua, and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States abandoned its lands to the south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel to the north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain under the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The Treaty entered into force on February 22, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: After establishing its border with Spain, the United States admitted the southeastern part of the territory of Missouri to the Union as the state of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of Missouri's territory, including what would become northeastern Colorado, became unorganized territory and remained so for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the Treaty of Cordoba signed on 24 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico finally ratified the Treaty of Adams-Onís in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texian revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico that eventually broke out in the war between Mexico and America in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico surrendered its northern territory to the United States with the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo at the end of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the American settlers traveling west of Oregon, the new California gold fields, or the new Mormon colonies of Deseret State in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and the Sweetwater River to the South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extra-legal state of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the claims of northwestern Texas into a new state and two new territories, the State of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On 9 April 1851, Mexican settlers from the Taos region established the village of San Luis and then in the New Mexico Territory, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the American Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, Kansas Territory and Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise only fueled animosity between the free ground and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: The gold researchers organized the Provisional Government of Jefferson's Territory on 24 August 1859, but the new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on 6 November 1860 led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, the Congress, dominated by the Republican Party, quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory, and its gold mining areas, as an unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, the outgoing president of the United States, James Buchanan, signed an act of convention organizing the free territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The original Colorado boundaries remain unchanged, with the exception of changes in government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was generally believed that the Colorado River originated in the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the area knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river carried mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the U.S. Army led by Captain John Macorb located the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macob party has designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to begin the American Civil War.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold seekers appreciated Confederation, the vast majority remained fiercely faithful to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a Texas cavalry force invaded the territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on March 10.

name: colorado
sentence: The goal of this Western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize the ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A force hastily organized by Colorado volunteers moved from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Glorieta Pass, New Mexico Territory, to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 28, New Mexico's Coloradans and local volunteers arrested the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and supply cars, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to retire to Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the supplies for their campaign and found little support for New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation made no other attempt to seize the southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, the Governor of the Territory John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington as Colonel of Colorado Volunteers with orders to protect white settlers of the Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of cattle theft.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho camped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops killed over 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the deaths were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action, and new President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans to resign, but none of the perpetrators have ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek Massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some remained and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near the col d'Argentine, the first of a multitude of silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific railway laid its tracks westward to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pacific Union established a link with the Central Pacific Railway at the summit of Promontory, Utah, on 10 May 1869, to form the first transcontinental railway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific Railway reached Denver in June of the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872 rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute people were withdrawn from San Juan the following year.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation setting out the conditions for the territory of Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysses S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th State and earned it the name "State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a major silver lode near Leadville in 1878 sparked the Colorado Silver Boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and Colorado's last gold strike, but the largest one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold seekers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women obtained the right to vote on November 7, 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by popular vote (men of Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Purchase Act in 1893 resulted in a dramatic collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, Denver's floriculture industry became a major industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period was known locally as the Golden Rush of Carnations.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners led to several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors of 1903-1904 and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: The 1913-1914 coal war and the 1920 Denver tramway strike led to the intervention of federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in the deaths of six strikers following a confrontation with Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since records were formally collected following an accident in Crested Butte that killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host a major political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population was first over one million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly from the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a major wave of immigration after the Second World War stimulated Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the state economy and high technology has become an important economic engine.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Office estimated that the population of Colorado exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Navy warships have been named the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the civil war and later in the Asian squadron, where it was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honor of the state, including the USColorado warship that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base of San Diego, Calif.

name: colorado
sentence: On 11 September 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in significant plutonium contamination in the surrounding inhabited areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Grey Wolf (Canis lupus) of Colorado in the 1930s, a group of wolves have recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Colorado's population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51% compared to the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous city and capital in Colorado, is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered to be the largest metropolitan area in the state and lies within the Front Range urban corridor, which has about five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, especially in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The most vibrant counties in the state are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado population centre is located just north of the village of Crichell in Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Colorado's population was 5,029,196.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the State population was as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples, regardless of their race, make up 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, Colorado's largest ancestry groups are German (22%), including Swiss and Austrian, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%) and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: People of German origin are particularly numerous in the Front Range, the Rocky Mountains (central-west counties) and the eastern/high plains.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexican-American, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the smaller towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado have a large number of Hispanos, descendants of the first settlers of Spanish colonial origin.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Colorado was 8.2% Hispanic and 90.3% non-Hispanic white.

name: colorado
sentence: The Hispanic population of Colorado has continued to grow rapidly in recent decades.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22% of Colorado's population and non-Hispanic whites for 70%.

name: colorado
sentence: English spoken in Colorado has a lot of Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities in Denver, Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other parts of East Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has a considerable number of Asian Americans of Mongolian origin, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, Southeast Asian and Japanese.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest population of Asian Americans is on the south and south-east sides of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is considered to be more liberal and diverse than most of the state in terms of political and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: There were a total of 70,331 births in Colorado in 2006.

name: colorado
sentence: (birth rate of 14.6 per thousand)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007 non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1% of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and someone of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth in which at least one Hispanic person was involved accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado has the seventh percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899 inhabitants, or about 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona, and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: As a percentage, Colorado is the sixth highest among Mexicans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population under one year of age were minorities, meaning that there was at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

sentence: Note: Births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, resulting in a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado recorded the second lowest fertility rate in the United States outside of New England, after Oregon, with 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and a Warren Buffett intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the decrease in the number of pregnancies.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second language spoken in Colorado after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is a coloradan Indian language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic (Ute).

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the Colorado population are 64% Christians, including 44% Protestants, 16% Catholic, 3% Mormon and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breaks are: 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Unaffiliated individuals account for 29% of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations according to the number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630; non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981; and the Church of Jesus Christ of last-day saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest rates of obesity in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it were the lowest in the country, it had dropped from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, Colorado residents had a life expectancy of 80.21 years in 2014, the longest of all American states.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have been shot on site in Colorado, particularly in prominent westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in operation, phantom mining cities have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of scenic highways and mountain passes that have helped to highlight the open road in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some Colorado monuments have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was scheduled to film driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Good Luck Charlie television series was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Office of Film and Television noted that more than 400 films were shot in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of movie festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its southwestern and Rocky cuisine.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants are prominent throughout the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named America's Foodest Town 2010 by Bon Appétit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, leading restaurants, and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more master sommeliers per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held every June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountains region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for steak, but now has a varied culinary scene with numerous restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varieties that have attracted a positive opinion from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines as well as cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won national and international prizes for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine regions contain the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate ensures hot summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two U.S. wine-growing areas in the Grand Valley AVA and the West Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, a growing number of wineries are located along the Front chain.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Grand Valley AVA of Colorado in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally recognized microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company, and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region, located close to and between the cities of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins, is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" because of its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open for cannabis tourism (marijuana).

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the Union to legalize the medicinal, industrial and recreational use of marijuana (2000).

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a state in the northeastern part of the United States of America.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of the 2010 census, it had the highest per capita income, the Human Development Index (0.962) and the median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island to the east, Massachusetts to the north, New York to the west, and Long Island Sound to the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford and its most populous town is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically, the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history comes from the region, in the modern era, large sections of it are increasingly linked to the three-state region with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River that approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of "Quononoquett (Conanicut)," a word Mohegan-Pequot for "long tidal river".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European settlers in Connecticut were Dutch, who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop in Hartford at the confluence of the Park and Connecticut rivers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was originally part of the Dutch colony New Netherlands, which included much of the land between the Connecticut and Delaware rivers, although the first large colonies were established by the English in the 1630s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a group of disciples from the Massachusetts Bay colony and founded the Connecticut colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonies of Connecticut and New Haven have established basic documents, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 the three colonies were merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a colony of the crown.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was one of the Thirteen Colonies that rejected British rule in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state per zone, the 29th most populated, and the fourth most densely populated of the fifty states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "State of the Constitution", the "State of Nutmeg", the "State of Supply" and the "State of Steady Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: He played an important role in the development of the US federal government (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, the Thames River and ports along Long Island Strait have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition that continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The government also has a long history of hosting the financial services industry, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered to the south by Long Island Sound, to the west by New York, to the north by Massachusetts, and to the east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state capital and the fourth largest city are Hartford, and other large cities (by population) include Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a little larger than Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 cities incorporated in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak of Connecticut is Bear Mountain in Salisbury, in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W), on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, which peaks near Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the extreme opposite, many coastal cities have areas less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on this history, but the state does not have a direct seafront (technically speaking).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut Coast is located on Long Island Strait, which is an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state's access to the Atlantic Ocean is both west (to the city of New York) and east (to the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbours against ocean storms, and many transatlantic ships seek anchor within Long Island Strait when tropical cyclones pass off the upper east coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River crosses the central part of the state and flows through Long Island Strait.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populous metropolitan area in the state is located in the Connecticut River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite the relatively small size of Connecticut, it has wide regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwest Litchfield Hills it includes mountains and horse farms, while in areas east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape includes coastal marshes, beaches and large-scale marine activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rural areas and small towns of Connecticut in the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast strongly with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven, located along the coastal highways of the New York border to New London, then north to the Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many towns in the northeast and northwest of Connecticut center around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green are usually historical visual symbols of New England cities, such as a white church, colonial meeting house, colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, etc., establishing a picturesque historical appearance maintained for historical preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the southern and coastal parts of Connecticut have been built and rebuilt over the years, and are less like traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern boundary of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, a square detour of approximately 4.0 km in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long series of disputes and temporary agreements that were finally concluded in 1804, when the residents of southern Southwick sought to leave Massachusetts, and the city was divided into two.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut, with the exception of New York, is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, containing the cities of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien, and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the border is the result of territorial disputes at the end of the 17th century, culminating with New York abandoning its claim to the region, which residents considered to be part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending north of Ridgefield on the Massachusetts border, as well as the undisputed claim in Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Parks Service include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, the National Heritage Corridor of the Quinebaug and Shetucket Rivers Valley and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is located in the rough transition zone between the southern tip of the humid continental climate and the northern part of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: The north of Connecticut generally has a climate with cold winters with moderate snowfalls and warm and humid summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extreme south and the coast of Connecticut have a climate with cool winters with a mixture of rain and rare snow, and long warm and humid summers typical of the middle and low East coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly uniform pattern of precipitation, with precipitation and snowfall spreading throughout the 12 months.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut represents an average of 56% of the possible sunshine (higher than the U.S. national average), an average of 2400 hours of sunshine per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: Early spring (April) may vary slightly cool (40s to 50s F) warm (65 to 70 F), while mid and late spring (late April/May) are warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: In late May, the Bermuda High Building created a southern flow of warm, humid tropical air, bringing warm weather conditions throughout the state, with medium peaks in New London of 81°F (27°C) and 85°F (29°C) in Windsor Locks at the top of the summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally, heat waves from 90 to 100°F (38°C) occur throughout Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, fast-moving summer thunderstorms can cause brief flooding with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sometimes, these thunderstorms can be severe, and the condition on average one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the hurricane season, remnants of tropical cyclones sometimes affect the region, although a direct impact is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: The time usually associated with the fall season generally begins in October and lasts until the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: The daily temperatures in October and November vary between the 1950s and 1960s (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 1940s and 1930s.

name: connecticut
sentence: In early October, coloured foliage began in the northern parts of the state and moved south and east to the southeast of Connecticut in early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, coastal and southern areas have more oaks and hickory trees (and fewer maples) and are often less colourful than northern areas.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December, the highs of day are in 40°F for much of the state, and the lows of night are under freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (from December to mid-March) are generally cold from south to north of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has high mean temperatures ranging from 38°F (3°C) in the coastal lowlands to 33°F (1°C) in the interior and northern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Average annual snowfall ranges from approximately 60 inches (1,500 mm) at high elevations in the northern part of the state to only 20-25 inches (510-640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: Generally, any community north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow during a storm and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow usually falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the State, and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the State.

name: connecticut
sentence: The record temperature of Connecticut is 106°F (41°C) which occurred in Danbury on 15 July 1995; the record low is -32°F (−36°C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on 16 February 1943, and Coventry on 22 January 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: The forests consist of a mixture of coastal forests from the northeast of Oak in the southern regions of the state, up to the high forests of New England and Acadia in the north-western parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the flower of the state and is native to low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (maximum Rhododendron) is also native to the eastern Connecticut Highlands and the Pachaug State Forest houses the Rhododendron Sanctuary Trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides) is found in wetlands in the south of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a native cactus (Opuntia humifusa), which is found in sandy coastal areas and low hills.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many types of beach grasses and wildflowers are also native to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut covers the hardiness areas of USDA plants 5b to 7a.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal Connecticut is the vast transition area where more southern and subtropical plants are grown.

name: connecticut
sentence: In some coastal communities, Magnolia grandiflora (southern magnolia), Crape Myrtles, palm scrub (Sabal minor), Needle Palms (Rhapidophyllum hystrix) and other broad-leaved hardwoods are cultivated in small numbers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name Connecticut is derived from the word Mohegan-Pequot which has been translated as "long tidal river" and "long river", referring to the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Evidence of human presence in the Connecticut area dates from up to 10,000 years ago.

name: connecticut
sentence: Stone tools were used for hunting, fishing, and woodworking.

name: connecticut
sentence: Semi-nomads in the way of life, these peoples moved seasonally to take advantage of various resources in the region.

name: connecticut
sentence: They shared languages based on algonquian.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut region was inhabited by several Amerindian tribes that can be grouped in the Nipmuc, the Sequins or the "River Indians" (which included the Tunxis, Schaghticoke, Podunk, Wangunk, Hammonasset and Quinnipiac), the Mattabesec or the "Wolf Confederation" and the Pequot-Mohegan.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these groups continue to remain in Connecticut, including the Mohegans, Pequots and Paugusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European explorer of Connecticut was Dutchman Adriaen Block, who explored the region in 1614.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Dutch fur traders then sailed on the Connecticut River, which they called Versche Rivier ("Fresh River"), and built a fort at Dutch Point in Hartford which they called "House of Hope" (Dutch: Huis van Hoop).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut colony was originally a number of small separate colonies in Windsor, Wethersfield, Saybrook, Hartford, and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first English settlers arrived in 1633 and moved to Windsor and Wethersfield the following year.

name: connecticut
sentence: John Winthrop the Massachusetts youth received a commission to create the Saybrook settlement at the mouth of the Connecticut River in 1635.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main body of settlers came to a large group in 1636.

name: connecticut
sentence: They were Puritans of the Massachusetts Bay colony, led by Thomas Hooker, who established the Connecticut colony at Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Quinnipiack colony was founded by John Davenport, Theophilus Eaton and others at New Haven in March 1638.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colony of New Haven had its own constitution called the "Basic Agreement of the New Haven Colony", signed on 4 June 1639.

name: connecticut
sentence: The regulations were established without the official sanction of the English Crown, and each was an independent political entity.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 Winthrop went to England and obtained a charter from Charles II, which united the colonies of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colonial colonies of historical significance included Windsor (1633), Wethersfield (1634), Saybrook (1635), Hartford (1636), New Haven (1638), Fairfield (1639), Guilford (1639), Milford (1639), Stratford (1639), Farmington (1640), Stamford (1641) and New London (1646).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequot War marked the first great conflict between settlers and Amerindians in New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequots have reacted with increasing aggression against colonial colonies on their territory, while simultaneously taking land from the Narragansett and Mohegan tribes.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers responded to a murder in 1636 by raiding a village of Pequot on Block Island; the Pequots besieged the Saybrook Colony garrison that fall and then attacked Wethersfield in the spring of 1637.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers declared war on the Pequots, organized a group of militias and allies of the Mohegan and Narragansett tribes, and attacked a village of Pequot on the Mystic River, with estimates of deaths ranging from 300 to 700 Pequots.

name: connecticut
sentence: After another major loss in a battle at Fairfield, the Pequots called for a truce and conditions of peace.

name: connecticut
sentence: The western borders of Connecticut have been subject to change over time.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford Treaty with the Dutch was signed on 19 Sept. 1650, but it was never ratified by the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to her, the western boundary of Connecticut extended north of Greenwich Bay over a distance of 32 km, provided that the line was not less than 10 miles from the Hudson River.

name: connecticut
sentence: This agreement was observed by both parties until the outbreak of the war between England and the Netherlands in 1652.

name: connecticut
sentence: The conflict continued over colonial boundaries until the Duke of York captured New Netherlands in 1664.

name: connecticut
sentence: On the other hand, the original charter of Connecticut in 1662 granted it all the land to the "South Sea", that is to say to the Pacific Ocean.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of the royal colonial concessions were for long east-west bands.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut takes its grant seriously and establishes a ninth county between the Susquehanna River and the Delaware River, Westmoreland County.

name: connecticut
sentence: This gave rise to brief Pennamite wars with Pennsylvania.

name: connecticut
sentence: Yale College was established in 1701, providing Connecticut with an important institution to educate the clergy and civilian leaders.

name: connecticut
sentence: The congregational church dominated religious life in the colony and, by extension, municipal affairs in many parts.

name: connecticut
sentence: With more than 600 miles of coastline, including along its navigable rivers, during the colonial years, Connecticut developed a history of a maritime tradition that would later produce booms in shipbuilding, shipping, naval support, seafood production and boating.

name: connecticut
sentence: Historical records indicate that the Tryall was the first ship built in the Connecticut settlement in 1649 at a site on the Connecticut River in the present Wethersfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the two decades preceding 1776 and the American Revolution, the shipyards of Connecticut launched about 100 sloops, schooners and brigs according to a US customs database maintained online by the Mystic Seaport Museum, the most important being the 180-ton Patient Mary launched in New Haven in 1763.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first Connecticut lighthouse was built in 1760 at the mouth of the Thames River with the New London Harbor Lighthouse.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has appointed four delegates to the Second Continental Congress who signed the Declaration of Independence: Samuel Huntington, Roger Sherman, William Williams and Oliver Wolcott.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Legislative Assembly of Connecticut authorized the formation of six new regiments in 1775, following clashes between British regulars and the Massachusetts militia in Lexington and Concord.

name: connecticut
sentence: There were approximately 1,200 soldiers from Connecticut at the Battle of Bunker Hill in June 1775.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1775 David Bushnell invented the Turtle, which, the following year, launched the first underwater attack in history, without success against a British warship at anchor in the port of New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1777, the British received news of supplies from the Continental Army in Danbury and landed an expeditionary force of some 2,000 soldiers in Westport.

name: connecticut
sentence: This force then walked to Danbury and destroyed houses and much of the depot.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mainland Army troops and militias led by General David Wooster and General Benedict Arnold hired them to march back to Ridgefield in 1777.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the winter of 1778–79, General George Washington decided to divide the Continental Army into three divisions surrounding New York, where British General Sir Henry Clinton had taken over his winter quarters.

name: connecticut
sentence: Major General Israel Putnam chose Redding as the winter camp area for some 3,000 regular members and militia under his command.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Redding camp allowed Putnam soldiers to keep the reconstituted supply depot at Danbury and to support any operation along Long Island Strait and the Hudson River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these men were veterans of the winter camp at Valley Forge, Pennsylvania, the previous winter.

name: connecticut
sentence: Soldiers at the Redding camp suffered shortages of supplies, cold temperatures and heavy snow, with some historians doubling the Conncticut's Valley Forge camp.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was also the site of a number of raids against Long Island orchestrated by Samuel Holden Parsons and Benjamin Tallmadge, and provided men and equipment for the war effort, particularly to the Washington Army outside New York City.

name: connecticut
sentence: General William Tryon made a descent on the coast of Connecticut in July 1779, with a focus on New Haven, Norwalk and Fairfield.

name: connecticut
sentence: New London and Groton Heights were plundered in September 1781 by Benedict Arnold, who had betrayed the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the beginning of the American Revolution, the Continental Congress designated Nathaniel Shaw Jr. of New London as its naval agent in charge of recruiting privateers to seize British ships as opportunities presented, with almost 50 operations outside the Thames River that eventually fired reprisals from the British force led by Arnold.

name: connecticut
sentence: On 9 January 1788 Connecticut ratified the American Constitution, becoming the fifth state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state flourished during the period following the American Revolution, as mills and textile factories were built and seaports flourished from trade and fishing.

name: connecticut
sentence: After Congress established in 1790 the predecessor of the US Revenue Cutter Service that would evolve in the US Coast Guard, President Washington assigned Jonathan Maltbie as one of the seven masters to enforce customs regulations, with Maltbie monitoring the south coast of New England with a 48-foot sloop named Argus.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1786, Connecticut transferred territory to the American government, which was part of the Northwest Territory.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state retained land that extended into the northern part of present-day Ohio, known as the Connecticut Western Reserve.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Western Reserve section was largely established by people from Connecticut, and they brought site names from Connecticut to Ohio.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has entered into agreements with Pennsylvania and New York, which have extinguished land claims within those states and created the Connecticut Panhandle.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state then ceded the Western Reserve in 1800 to the federal government, which brought it to its current limits (except minor adjustments with Massachusetts).

name: connecticut
sentence: For the first time in 1800, the shipowners of Connecticut launched more than 100 ships in a single year.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the following decade, at the door of the resumption of hostilities with Great Britain that triggered the War of 1812, the shipyards in Connecticut built nearly 1,000 ships, the most productive stretch of a decade in the 19th century.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the war, the British raided Stonington and Essex and blocked ships in the Thames River.

name: connecticut
sentence: Isaac Hull, from Derby, became the most famous naval figure in Connecticut to win a reputation during the conflict as captain of the USConstitution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The British blockade during the War of 1812 harmed exports and strengthened the influence of federalists who opposed the war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The cessation of imports from Great Britain has stimulated the construction of textile and machinery factories.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has come to be recognized as a major manufacturing centre, partly because of Eli Whitney's inventions and other early innovators of the industrial revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: The war led to the development of fast clippers that helped extend the reach of New England merchants to the Pacific and Indian oceans.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first half of the 19th century also experienced a rapid increase in whaling, with New London appearing as one of the three largest home ports in the New England industry after Nantucket and New Bedford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state was known for its political conservatism, characterized by its federalist party and Yale College of Timothy Dwight.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most important intellectuals were Dwight and Noah Webster, who compiled his great dictionary into New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: Religious tensions polarize the state, while the Congregational Church struggles to maintain traditional points of view, in alliance with the federalists.

name: connecticut
sentence: The failure of the Hartford Convention in 1814 adversely affected the federalist cause, with the Republican Democratic Party taking control in 1817.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut had been governed by the "Fondamental Orders" since 1639, but the state adopted a new constitution in 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: The manufacturers of Connecticut played a major role in supplying EU forces with weapons and supplies during the civil war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state provided 55,000 men, trained in thirty full infantry regiments, including two in the United States

name: connecticut
sentence: Coloured troops, with several Connecticut men becoming generals.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Navy attracted 250 officers and 2,100 men, and Gideon Welles, from Glastonbury, was Secretary of the Navy.

name: connecticut
sentence: James H. Ward from Hartford was the first

name: connecticut
sentence: Naval officer killed in the civil war.

name: connecticut
sentence: Of the victims of Connecticut, 2,088 were killed in combat, 2,801 died of illness and 689 died in confederate prison camps.

name: connecticut
sentence: A wave of national unity in 1861 brought thousands of tributaries to the colors of each city and city.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, as the war became a crusade to put an end to slavery, many democrats (especially Irish Catholics) declined.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Democrats have taken a position favourable to slavery and have included many Copperheads ready to leave the secession of the South.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Republicans fought intensely in 1863 for the governor's election.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extensive Connecticut industry, its dense population, flat land and wealth encouraged the construction of railways from 1839.

name: connecticut
sentence: By 1840, 102 miles (164 km) of the line were in service, reaching 402 miles (647 km) in 1850 and 601 miles (967 km) in 1860.

name: connecticut
sentence: New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad, known as the New Haven or The Consolidated, became the dominant Connecticut railway company after 1872.

name: connecticut
sentence: J. P. Morgan began financing New England's major railways in the 1890s, dividing the territory so that they would not compete.

name: connecticut
sentence: The New Haven purchased 50 small businesses, including steamship lines, and built a network of light rails (electrified carriages) that provided long distance transportation for the entire southern part of New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1912, the New Haven operated over 3,200 km of track with 120,000 employees.

name: connecticut
sentence: As steam ships proliferated after the civil war, Noank produced the two largest ships built in Connecticut during the 19th century, with the 332-foot wooden steam wheel Rhode Island launched in 1882 and the 345-foot pallet wheel Connecticut seven years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 19th century, Connecticut shipyards would launch more than 165 steam vessels.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1875, the world's first telephone exchange was established in New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: When World War I broke out in 1914, Connecticut became a major supplier of weapons to the U.S. Army; in 1918, 80% of the state's industries produced goods for the war effort.

name: connecticut
sentence: Remington Arms in Bridgeport produced half of the U.S. Army's small arms cartridges, along with other major suppliers, including Winchester in New Haven and Colt in Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut was also a major supplier of the U.S. Navy, with electrical boat orders for 85 submarines, the construction of Torpedo Lake boats over 20 submarines and the cargo ships of the Groton Iron Works building.

name: connecticut
sentence: On 21 June 1916, the Navy made Groton the site of its base and submarine school on the East Coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state enthusiastically supported the American war effort in 1917 and 1918 with large purchases of war bonds, a new expansion of industry and an emphasis on increasing food production on farms.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thousands of state, local and volunteer groups mobilized for the war effort and were coordinated by the State Defense Council of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Manufacturers faced labour shortages; the American Brass and Manufacturing Company in Waterbury operated at half its capacity, so the federal government agreed to force soldiers to work there.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1919, J. Henry Roraback began the Connecticut Light & Power Co. which became the dominant electrical utility of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1925, Frederick Rentschler encouraged the creation of Pratt & Whitney in Hartford to develop engines for aircraft; the company became a major military supplier during the Second World War and one of the three largest manufacturers of jet engines in the world.

name: connecticut
sentence: On September 21, 1938, the most destructive storm in New England's history struck eastern Connecticut, killing hundreds of people.

name: connecticut
sentence: The eye of the "Long Island Express" passed just west of New Haven and devastated the coast of Connecticut between Old Saybrook and Stonington with the full force of wind and waves, even though they enjoyed partial protection from Long Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The hurricane has caused considerable damage to infrastructure, homes and businesses.

name: connecticut
sentence: In New London, a 150-metre-long sailboat was taken to a warehouse, causing a major fire.

name: connecticut
sentence: High rainfall caused flooding of the Connecticut River in downtown Hartford and East Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Approximately 50,000 trees fell on the roads.

name: connecticut
sentence: The advent of the lease in support of Britain helped raise the Connecticut of the Great Depression, with the State a major centre for the production of weapons and supplies used during the Second World War.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut manufactured 4.1% of the total U.S. military armaments produced during the war, ranking ninth among the 48 states, with major factories including Colt for firearms, Pratt & Whitney for aircraft engines, Chance Vought for fighter aircraft, Hamilton Standard for propellers, and Electric Boat for submarines and PT boats.

name: connecticut
sentence: In Bridgeport, General Electric produced a new important weapon to fight tanks: the bazooka.

name: connecticut
sentence: On 13 May 1940, Igor Sikorsky made a free flight of the first practical helicopter.

name: connecticut
sentence: The helicopter was poorly used during the Second World War, but future military production made the Stratford Sikorsky Aircraft plant the largest manufacturing site in Connecticut in the early 21st century.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut lost a few factories in wartime after the end of hostilities, but the state participated in a general post-war expansion that included the construction of roads and led to the growth of the middle class in the suburbs.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prescott Bush represented Connecticut in the US Senate from 1952 to 1963

name: connecticut
sentence: Bush and his grandson George W. Bush have both become presidents of the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1965, Connecticut ratified its current constitution, replacing the document that had been used since 1818.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1968, the Connecticut Yankee nuclear power plant began operating at East Haddam; in 1970, the Millstone nuclear power plant began operating at Waterford.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1974, Connecticut elected democratic governor Ella T. Grasso, who became the first woman in any state to be elected governor without being the wife or widow of a previous governor.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's dependence on the defence industry poses an economic challenge at the end of the cold war.

name: connecticut
sentence: The resulting budgetary crisis led to Lowell Weicker's election as governor on a third-party note in 1990.

name: connecticut
sentence: Weicker's remedy was a state income tax that proved effective in balancing the budget, but only in the short term.

name: connecticut
sentence: He did not run for a second term, in part because of this politically unpopular movement.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1992, the initial construction was completed at Foxwoods Casino at the Mashantucket Pequots Reserve in Eastern Connecticut, which became the largest casino in the Western Hemisphere.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mohegan Sun followed him four years later.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, the presidential candidate Al Gore chose Senator Joe Lieberman as a race companion, marking the first time that a presidential major party ticket included someone of the Jewish faith.

name: connecticut
sentence: Gore and Lieberman lost five votes below George W. Bush and Dick Cheney at the Electoral College.In the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks, 65 state residents were killed, mainly Fairfield County residents who worked at the World Trade Center.In 2004, Republican Governor John G. Rowland resigned during a corruption investigation, later pleading federal charges.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Irene hit Connecticut on August 28 and the damage totalled $235 million.

name: connecticut
sentence: Two months later, the Halloween and the Easter dropped snow on the trees, causing broken branches and trunks that damaged the power lines; some areas were powerless for 11 days.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hurricane Sandy had tropical storm winds when it reached Connecticut on 29 October 2012.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sandy's winds have caused storm surges in the streets and reduced electricity to 98% of homes and businesses, with over $360 million in damage.

name: connecticut
sentence: On December 14, 2012, Adam Lanza shot and killed 26 people at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, and then killed himself.

name: connecticut
sentence: The massacre stimulated the renewed efforts of militants for stricter laws on firearms ownership at the national level.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the summer and fall of 2016, Connecticut experienced drought in many parts of the state, resulting in prohibitions on the use of water.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of November 15, 2016 (2016-11-15), 45% of the state was registered with severe drought by the US Secherry Monitor, including virtually all Hartford and Litchfield counties.

name: connecticut
sentence: All the rest of the state was in the counties of Middlesex, Fairfield, New London, New Haven, Windham and Tolland.

name: connecticut
sentence: This has affected the agricultural economy in the State.

name: connecticut
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Connecticut population was 3,565,287 as of 1 July 2019, a decrease of 0.25 per cent since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, the Connecticut population was estimated at 3,565,287, a decrease of 7,378 (0.25%) from the previous year and a decrease of 8,810 (0.25%) since 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 67,427 (22,222 births minus 154,795 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 41,718 people to the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 75,991 persons and internal migration resulted in a net loss of 34,273.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to 2005 estimates, Connecticut has moved from the 29th most populated state to the 30th.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the 2018 estimates, Connecticut has a population of 3,572,665.

name: connecticut
sentence: 6.6 per cent of the population were under 5 years of age, 24.7 per cent were under 18 years of age and 13.8 per cent were 65 years of age or older.

name: connecticut
sentence: Women make up about 51.6 per cent of the population, with 48.4 per cent men.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1790, 97 per cent of the population of Connecticut was classified as "rural".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first census in which less than half of the population was classified as rural dates from 1890.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2000 census, only 12.3% were considered to be rural areas.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most of the west and south of Connecticut (particularly the Gold Coast) is strongly associated with New York City

name: connecticut
sentence: The population centre of Connecticut is located in the town of Cheshire.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the 2010 U.S. Census, the percentages of race and ethnicity in Connecticut were as follows:

name: connecticut
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos, regardless of race, accounted for 13.4 per cent of the 2010 census population.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populous ethnic group in the state is the non-Hispanic white group, but it increased from 98 per cent in 1940 to 71 per cent in 2010.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2004, 11.4 per cent of the population (400,000) were born abroad.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1870, native Americans accounted for 75 per cent of the state's population, but this proportion had fallen to 35 per cent in 1918.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, 81.69 per cent of Connecticut residents aged 5 years and older spoke English at home and 8.42 per cent spoke Spanish, followed by Italian (1.59%), French (1.31%) and Polish (1.20%).

name: connecticut
sentence: The main groups of European descent are:

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2011, 46.1% of the population of Connecticut under the age of 1 were minorities.

name: connecticut
sentence: Note: The births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnic origin and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: connecticut
sentence: The religious affiliations of the people of Connecticut in 2014:

name: connecticut
sentence: A Pew survey of religious self-identification of Connecticut residents showed the following distribution of affiliations: Protestants 35%, Mormonism 1%, Jews 3%, Roman Catholics 33%, Orthodox 1%, non-religious 28%, Jehovah's Witness 1%, Hinduism 1%, Buddhism 1% and Islam 1%.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2000, there were 108,280 Jewish congregations (3.2 per cent).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Jewish population is concentrated in cities near Long Island Sound between Greenwich and New Haven, in Greater New Haven and in Greater Hartford, particularly in the suburbs of West Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives, the largest Christian denominations, according to the number of adherents, in 2010 were: the Catholic Church, with 1.252.936; the United Church of Christ, with 96.506; and evangelical non-denominational Protestants, with 72,863.

name: connecticut
sentence: Recent immigration has brought other non-Christian religions to the state, but the number of adherents of other religions remains low.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is also home to the largest Protestant church in New England: the first Bloomfield Cathedral in Hartford County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford is a member of the Catholic Archdiocese of Hartford, which is sovereign over the Diocese of Bridgeport and the Diocese of Norwich.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's economic output in 2019, measured by gross domestic product, was $289 billion, compared to $277.9 billion in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's personal income per capita in 2019 was estimated at $79,087, the highest of all states.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, there is a large disparity in income across the state; after New York, Connecticut had the second largest national difference between average incomes of the highest 1 per cent and average incomes of the lowest 99 per cent.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to a study conducted in 2018 by Phoenix Marketing International, Connecticut had the third largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 7.75%.

name: connecticut
sentence: New Canaan is the richest city in Connecticut with a per capita income of 85,459.

name: connecticut
sentence: Hartford was the poorest municipality in Connecticut with a per capita income of $13,428 in 2000.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December 2019, Connecticut's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was 3.8%, with a U.S. unemployment rate of 3.5% that month.

name: connecticut
sentence: Data from 1982, Connecticut recorded its lowest unemployment rate in 2000 between August and October at 2.2%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest unemployment rate in this period occurred in November and December 2010 at 9.3%, but economists expect record levels of layoffs following the closure of businesses in the spring of 2020 following the coronavirus pandemic.

name: connecticut
sentence: Tax is collected by the Ministry of Revenue Services of Connecticut and by local municipalities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2012, after New York City, Connecticut residents had the second highest government and local government tax rate, or 12.6 per cent of income compared to the national average of 9.9 per cent, as reported by the Tax Foundation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prior to 1991, Connecticut had only an income tax system.

name: connecticut
sentence: Employment income was not taxed, but investment income was taxed at 13%, the highest rate in the United States, without any deduction for costs of producing investment income, such as interest on loans.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under the authority of Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the system was changed into a system in which taxes on employment income and investment income were equal to the maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy attracted investment firms to Connecticut; in 2019, Fairfield County was home to 16 of the world's 200 largest hedge funds.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's personal income tax rates were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000 to $50,000); 5.5% ($50,000 to $100,000); 6% ($100,000 to $200,000); 6.5% ($200,000 to $250,000); 6.9% ($250,000 to $500,000) and 6.9% above $500,000, the additional amounts being due by instalment.

name: connecticut
sentence: All salaries of Connecticut residents are subject to State income tax, even if they are earned outside the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, in these cases, Connecticut's income tax should be withheld only to the extent that Connecticut's tax exceeds the amount withheld by the other court.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this means that Connecticut residents who work in New York do not have any Connecticut income tax withheld.

sentence: The state government of Hawaii is shaped by the federal government with adaptations from the era of the kingdom of Hawaiian history.

sentence: As codified in the Hawaiian Constitution, there are three branches of government: executive, legislative and judicial.
