sentence: Hawaii is the only State in the United States that does not have a separate state-wide police force.

sentence: Although Hawaii is internationally recognized as a State of the United States while being widely accepted as such in general understanding, the legality of this status has been challenged by the United States District Court, the United Nations and other international forums.

name: hawaii
sentence: Political organizations seeking some form of sovereignty in Hawaii have been active since the late 19th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: In general, they focus on self-determination and autonomy, either for Hawaii as an independent nation (in many proposals, for "Hawai nationals" descended from or declaring themselves to be such by choice from subjects of the Hawaiian Kingdom), or for persons of full or partial Hawaiian ancestry in an indigenous "nation-to-nation" relationship similar to tribal sovereignty with the American federal recognition of Hawaiian indigenous people.

name: hawaii
sentence: The pro-federal recognition of Akaka Bill aroused strong opposition among Hawaiian residents in the 2000s.

name: hawaii
sentence: Opponents of the tribal approach claim that this is not a legitimate path to the Hawaiian nation

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian sovereignty movement considered the overthrow of the Hawaiian Kingdom in 1893 to be illegal, and considered the subsequent annexation of Hawaii by the United States as illegal; the movement sought a greater form of autonomy for Hawaii, such as the free association or independence of the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some groups also argue for some form of reparation from the United States for the overthrow of Queen Liliuokalani in 1893, and for what is described as a prolonged military occupation beginning with the annexation of 1898.

name: hawaii
sentence: The resolution of excuses adopted by the United States Congress in 1993 was cited as a major impetus for the movement for Hawaiian sovereignty.

name: hawaii
sentence: The sovereignty movement regards Hawaii as an illegally occupied nation.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a state in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: It borders the state of Montana in the east and northeast, Wyoming in the east, Nevada and Utah in the south, and Washington and Oregon in the west.

name: idaho
sentence: To the north, it shares a small portion of the Canadian border with the province of British Columbia.

name: idaho
sentence: With a population of approximately 1.7 million and an area of 33,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populated and the 7th least dense of the 50 American states.

name: idaho
sentence: The capital and largest city of the state is Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years, Idaho has been inhabited by Amerindian peoples.

name: idaho
sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, Idaho was considered to be part of Oregon, a disputed region between the United States and the British Empire.

name: idaho
sentence: It officially became American territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate Idaho territory was only organized in 1863, instead of being included for periods in the Oregon and Washington territories.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was finally admitted to the Union on July 3, 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: As part of the Pacific Northwest (and the associated Cascadia bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographical and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: The north of the state, the relatively isolated Idaho Panhandle, is closely linked to the east of Washington State with which it shares the Pacific Time Zone – the rest of the state uses the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: The southern part of the state includes the Snake River Plain (which owns most of the population and agricultural land).

name: idaho
sentence: The southeastern part of the state is part of the Great Basin.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho is quite mountainous, and contains several stretches of the Rocky Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The U.S. Forest Service owns approximately 38 per cent of Idaho land, the largest proportion of all states.

name: idaho
sentence: Industries important for the state economy include manufacturing, agriculture, mining, forestry and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of scientific and technological enterprises have their headquarters in Idaho or factories there, and the State also contains the national laboratory of Idaho, which is the largest energy department in the country.

name: idaho
sentence: The agricultural sector in Idaho provides many products, but the state is best known for its potato cultivation, which accounts for about one third of the national yield.

name: idaho
sentence: The official nickname of the state is "Gem State", which refers to the natural beauty of Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The origin of the name is a mystery.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 1860s, when the U.S. Congress planned to organize a new territory in the Rocky Mountains, the name "Idaho" was suggested by George M. Willing, a politician who presented himself as an unrecognized delegate of the unofficial territory of Jefferson.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a Shoshone term meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "the name of the mountains," but it was later revealed that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he was inspired to give the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: As the name seemed to be made, the U.S. Congress finally decided to appoint Colorado territory instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time that decision was made, the city of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been named according to Willing's proposal.

name: idaho
sentence: In the same year, Congress established Colorado Territory, a county called Idaho County, in eastern Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The county was named after a steamship named Idaho, which was launched on the Columbia River in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: It is not known whether the steamship was named before or after Willing's claim was disclosed.

name: idaho
sentence: In any event, part of Washington's territory, including Idaho County, was used to create Idaho's territory in 1863.

name: idaho
sentence: Finally, the name was given to the Idaho territory, which later became the American state.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite this lack of evidence for the origin of the name, many textbooks well in the 20th century repeated as Willing's narrative the name "Idaho" derived from the term Shoshone "ee-da-how".

name: idaho
sentence: A history manual of Idaho 1956 says:

name: idaho
sentence: An alternative to etymology attributes the name to the Plains Apache word "ídaahęγ" IPA: [í.ta=.h="] (enemy) which was used with reference to the Comanche.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is bordered by six U.S. states and one Canadian province.

name: idaho
sentence: Washington and Oregon are to the west, Nevada and Utah to the south, and Montana and Wyoming to the east.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho also shares a short border with the Canadian province of British Columbia in the north.

name: idaho
sentence: The landscape is rugged with some of the largest unspoilt natural areas in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: For example, at 2.3 million acres (930,000 hectares), the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness area is the largest contiguous wilderness protected area in the continental United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a state of the Rockies with abundant natural resources and picturesque areas.

name: idaho
sentence: The state has snowy mountain ranges, rapids, vast lakes and steep canyons.

name: idaho
sentence: The waters of the Snake River cross the Canyon Hells, the deepest gorge in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Shoshone Falls descends from cliffs above Niagara Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: By far the largest river in Idaho is the Snake River, a major tributary of the Columbia River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Snake River flows from Yellowstone in northwestern Wyoming across the Snake River plain in southern Idaho before turning north, leaving the state at Lewiston before joining the Columbia at Kennewick.

name: idaho
sentence: Other important rivers are the Clark Fork/Pend Oreille River, the Spokane River and the major tributaries of the Snake River, including the Clearwater River, the Salmon River, the Boise River and the Payette River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Salmon River flows into the canyon snake Hells and forms the southern boundary of Nez Perce County on its north bank, of which Lewiston is the county seat.

name: idaho
sentence: Lewiston Harbour, at the confluence of Clearwater and Snake Rivers, is the furthest port from the west coast, 465 miles from the Pacific to Astoria, Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: The vast majority of the Idaho population lives in the Snake River Plain, a valley that crosses the entire south of Idaho from east to west.

name: idaho
sentence: The valley includes the main towns of Boise, Meridian, Nampa, Caldwell, Twin Falls, Idaho Falls and Pocatello.

name: idaho
sentence: The plain served as an easy passage through the Rocky Mountains for settlers westbound on the Oregon Trail, and many settlers chose to settle in the area rather than risk the perfidious road through the Blue Mountains and the Cascade Range to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: The western part of the plain is known as the Trésor Valley, linked between the Owyhee Mountains in the southwest and the Boise Mountains in the northeast.

name: idaho
sentence: The central region of the Snake River Plain is known as the Magic Valley.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest point in the Idaho is Borah Peak, 3,859 metres in the Lost River chain north of Mackay.

name: idaho
sentence: The 216-metre low point of the Idaho is located in Lewiston, where the Clearwater River joins the Snake River and continues to Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The Sawtooth Range is often considered the most famous mountain range in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: Other Idaho mountain ranges include the Bitterroot Range, the White Cloud Mountains, the Lost River Range, the Clearwater Mountains, and the Salmon River Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho has two time zones, with the demarcation line halfway between Canada and Nevada.

name: idaho
sentence: The climate of Idaho varies widely.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the western border of the state is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in winter when cloud cover, humidity, and precipitation are at their peak.

name: idaho
sentence: This influence has a moderate effect in winter, where temperatures are not as low as might be expected in a northern state where altitudes are mostly high.

name: idaho
sentence: Maritime influence is less important in the eastern part of the state where rainfall is often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho can be warm, although prolonged periods over 98°F (37°C) are rare, with the exception of the lowest point of altitude, Lewiston, who sees little snow as a result.

name: idaho
sentence: The warm summer days are tempered by low relative humidity and cooler evenings during the summer months since, for most states, the greatest diurnal temperature difference is often in summer.

name: idaho
sentence: Winters may be cold, although long periods of bitter cold weather below zero are unusual.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest temperature of Idaho at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Orofino on 28 July 1934; the lowest temperature of all times at -60°F (−51°C) was recorded at Island Park Dam on 18 January 1943.

name: idaho
sentence: Human beings may have been present in the Idaho area 14,500 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: Excavations at the Wilson Butte Cave near Twin Falls in 1959 revealed signs of human activity, including arrowheads, that rank among the oldest artifacts dated in North America.

name: idaho
sentence: American Indians who predominated in the area included the Perce Nose in the north and the Shoshone in the north and west in the south.

name: idaho
sentence: A late upper paleolithic site was identified at Cooper's Ferry in western Idaho near the town of Cottonwood by archaeologists in 2019.

name: idaho
sentence: According to the evidence found at the site, the first people lived in the area 15,300 to 16,600 years ago, before the Beringia Land Bridge of about 1,000 years old.

name: idaho
sentence: The discoverers, anthropology professor Loren Davis and his colleagues, pointed out that they have similarities with the tools and artifacts discovered in Japan 16,000 to 13,000 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: The discovery also showed that the first peoples might not have come to North America by land, as has already been said.

name: idaho
sentence: On the contrary, they probably went through the water on a Pacific coastal road.

name: idaho
sentence: An early presence of French Canadian trappers is visible in the names and toponyms: Nose Percé, Coeur d'Alène, Boisé, Payette, some pre-existing expeditions of Lewis and Clark and Astorian who themselves included a large number of French and Métis guides recruited for their knowledge of the terrain.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho, part of Oregon, was claimed by the United States and Britain until the United States acquired its undisputed jurisdiction in 1846.

name: idaho
sentence: From 1843 to 1849, the Idaho was de facto under the jurisdiction of the Provisional Government of Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: When Oregon became a state, what is now Idaho was in what remained of the original Oregon territory not part of the new state, and designated as Washington territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Between that date and the creation of the territory of Idaho on 4 March 1863, at Lewiston, parts of the present state were included in the territories of Oregon, Washington and Dakota.

name: idaho
sentence: The new territory included today's Idaho, Montana and most of Wyoming.

name: idaho

name: illinois
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau currently lists seven other cities with a population of more than 100,000 in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the 2010 official population of the Census Bureau: Aurora, a Chicago satellite city that eclipsed Rockford for the second most populous city in Illinois; its 2010 population was 197,899.

name: illinois
sentence: Rockford, 152,871, is the third largest city in the state, and is the largest city in the state that is not located in the suburbs of Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: Joliet, located in the metropolis of Chicago, is the fourth largest city in the state with a population of 147,433.

name: illinois
sentence: Naperville, a suburb of Chicago, is fifth with 141,853.

name: illinois
sentence: Naperville and Aurora share a border along Illinois Highway 59.

name: illinois
sentence: Springfield, the state capital, is sixth with 117,352 inhabitants.

name: illinois
sentence: Peoria, which decades ago was the second most populous city in the state, is seventh with 115 007.

name: illinois
sentence: The eighth and final city of the 100,000 club is Elgin, a suburb of northwest Chicago, with a population of 108,188 in 2010.

name: illinois
sentence: The most populous town in the state south of Springfield is Belleville, with 44,478 inhabitants in the 2010 census.

name: illinois
sentence: It is located in the part of Illinois's Greater St. Louis (often known as the Metro East Region), which has a rapidly growing population of more than 700,000.

name: illinois
sentence: Other major urban areas include the Champaign-Urbana metropolitan area, which has a combined population of nearly 230,000, the Illinois part of the Quad Cities area with approximately 215,000 inhabitants, and the Bloomington-Normal area with a combined population of more than 165,000.

name: illinois
sentence: The official language of Illinois is English, although between 1923 and 1969 the law of the state gave official status to "the American language".

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly 80% of Illinois's people speak native English, and most others speak it fluently as a second language.

name: illinois
sentence: A number of dialects of American English are spoken, ranging from English from the interior of North America and African-American English around Chicago, to English from Midland American in Central Illinois, to English from South America in the extreme south.

name: illinois
sentence: More than 20% of Illinois speak a language other than English at home, of which Spanish is by far the most common, or more than 12% of the total population.

name: illinois
sentence: A considerable number of Polish speakers are present in the metropolitan area of Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: French Illinois Country has mostly disappeared in Illinois, although it is still celebrated in the historic French colonial district.

name: illinois
sentence: Roman Catholics are the largest religious denomination in Illinois and are heavily concentrated in and around Chicago, accounting for nearly 30 per cent of the population of the state.

name: illinois
sentence: However, taken together as a group, the different Protestant denominations represent a higher percentage of the population of the State than Catholics do.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, the number of Catholics in Illinois was 3,648,907.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest Protestant denominations were the United Methodist Church, with 314,461 members, and the Southern Baptist Convention, with 283,519 members.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has one of the highest concentrations of Lutherans of the Missouri Synod in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois played an important role in the Latter Day Saint movement, Nauvoo, Illinois, becoming a gathering place for the Mormons in the early 1840s.

name: illinois
sentence: Nauvoo was the location of the crisis of succession, which led to the separation of the Mormon movement into several holy sects of the Day of the Lauriers.

name: illinois
sentence: The Church of Jesus Christ of the Last Days Saints, the largest sect to emerge from the Mormon schism, now has more than 55,000 members in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: There are a large number of adherents of other abrahamic denominations in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Widely concentrated in the Chicago metropolitan area, adherents of the Muslim, Baha'i and Jewish religions all call the State House.

name: illinois
sentence: Muslims were the largest non-Christian group, with 359,264 members.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the highest concentration of Muslims per state in the country, with 2,800 Muslims per 100,000 citizens.

name: illinois
sentence: The largest and oldest Bahá'í worship house in the world is located in Wilmette, Illinois, The Chicago area has a very large Jewish community, especially in the suburbs of Skokie, Buffalo Grove, Highland Park and surrounding suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: The former Mayor of Chicago Rahm Emanuel is the first Jewish mayor of Windy City.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also home to a very large population of Hindus, Sikhs, Jains and Buddhists.

name: illinois
sentence: Wilmette's Baha'i Adoration House is the centre of the worship of this religion in North America.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's gross government revenue in dollars was estimated at US$909 billion in 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: The government's per capita gross domestic product in 2019 was estimated at approximately $72,000.

name: illinois
sentence: In February 2019, the unemployment rate in Illinois was 4.2%.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's minimum wage will rise to $15 per hour by 2025, making it one of the highest in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's main agricultural production is maize, soybeans, pork, cattle, dairy products and wheat.

name: illinois
sentence: In most years, Illinois is either the first or second state for the highest soybean production, with a harvest of 427.7 million bushels (11.64 million tonnes) in 2008, after Iowa's production of 444.82 million bushels (12.11 million tonnes).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is the second largest producer of corn in the United States, with over 1.5 billion bushels produced annually.

name: illinois
sentence: With a production capacity of 1.5 billion gallons per year, Illinois is the leading ethanol producer, ranking third in the United States in 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in food production and meat processing.

name: illinois
sentence: Although Chicago may no longer be "Hog Butcher for the World", the Chicago region remains a global centre for food manufacturing and meat processing, with numerous factories, processing houses and distribution facilities concentrated in the former Union Stock Yards region.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also produces wine and the state is home to two American wineries.

name: illinois
sentence: In the area of The Meeting of the Great Rivers Scenic Byway, peaches and apples are cultivated.

name: illinois
sentence: The German agricultural immigrants who settled in Illinois in the middle and late 19th century were partly responsible for the profusion of fruit orchards in this area of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's universities are actively studying alternative agricultural products as alternative crops.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the country's leaders in manufacturing, with an annual value added of more than $107 billion in 2006.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2011, Illinois ranked fourth in the country's most productive manufacturing states, behind California, Texas and Ohio.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately three-quarters of the state's manufacturers are located in the Northeastern Opportunity Return area, with 38 percent of the approximately 18,900 manufacturing plants in Illinois located in Cook County.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, Illinois's major value-added manufacturing industries were chemical manufacturing ($18.3 billion), machine manufacturing ($13.4 billion), food manufacturing ($12.9 billion), manufactured metal products ($11.5 billion), transportation equipment ($7.4 billion), plastics and rubber products ($7.0 billion), and computer and electronic products ($6.1 billion).

name: illinois
sentence: By the early 2000s, Illinois's economy had become dependent on high value-added services, such as financial commerce, higher education, law, logistics and medicine.

name: illinois
sentence: In some cases, these services have been clustered around institutions that have listened to Illinois's previous economies.

name: illinois
sentence: For example, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, a trading stock for global derivatives, had begun its life as an agricultural futures market.

name: illinois
sentence: Other important non-manufacturing industries include publishing, tourism, energy production and distribution.

name: illinois
sentence: Venture capital investors funded a total of approximately $62 billion in the U.S. economy in 2016.

name: illinois
sentence: Of this amount, Illinois companies received approximately $1.1 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Similarly, in fiscal year 2016, the federal government spent $461 billion on contracts in the United States Of this amount, Illinois companies received approximately $8.7 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a net importer of fuel for energy, despite significant coal resources and minor oil production.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois exports electricity, ranking fifth among states in terms of electricity generation and seventh in terms of electricity consumption.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois coal industry originated in the mid-19th century, when entrepreneurs like Jacob Loose discovered coal in places like Sangamon County.

name: illinois
sentence: Jacob Bunn contributed to the development of Illinois's coal industry and was the founder and owner of the Illinois Western Coal & Mining Company.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately 68% of Illinois has coal layers of the Pennsylvania geological period.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the State of Illinois Geological Survey, 211 billion tonnes of bituminous coal are below the surface, having a total heating value greater than the estimated oil deposits on the Arabian Peninsula.

name: illinois
sentence: However, this coal has a high sulphur content, which causes acid rain unless special equipment is used to reduce sulphur dioxide emissions.

name: illinois
sentence: Many Illinois power plants are not equipped to burn coal with high sulphur content.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1999, Illinois produced 40.4 million tonnes of coal, but only 17 million tonnes (42%) of coal were consumed in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Most coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Illinois exported three million tons of coal and is expected to export nine million tons of coal in 2011, with increasing energy demand in countries such as China, India and other Asian and European countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, Illinois was ranked third in coal reserves recoverable in the production of mines in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states, while most of the coal burned for electricity in Illinois (21 million tonnes in 1998) is extracted from the Wyoming Powder River basin.

name: illinois
sentence: Mattoon was recently selected as a site for the Ministry of Energy's FutureGen project, a 275-megawatt zero-emission experimental power plant that burns coal that the DOE has just funded.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, after several setbacks, Mattoon withdrew from the project.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is the first oil refiner in the U.S. Midwest, with a combined crude oil distillation capacity of nearly 900,000 barrels per day (140 000 m3/d).

name: illinois
sentence: However, Illinois has very limited crude oil reserves that account for less than 1% of the total U.S. reserves.

name: illinois
sentence: Residential heating is 81% natural gas, compared to less than 1% fuel oil.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks 14th in state oil production, with a daily production of about 28,000 barrels (4,500 m3) in 2005.

name: illinois
sentence: Nuclear energy probably started in Illinois with the Chicago Pile-1, the first self-sufficient nuclear-chain artificial reaction in the world's first nuclear reactor, built on the University of Chicago campus.

name: illinois
sentence: There are six nuclear power stations operating in Illinois: Braidwood, Byron, Clinton, Dresden, LaSalle and Quad Cities.

name: illinois
sentence: With the exception of the one-unit Clinton plant, each of these facilities has two reactors.

name: illinois
sentence: Three reactors have been permanently closed and are in various decommissioning stages: Dresden-1 and Zion-1 and 2.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked first in 2010 in both nuclear capacity and nuclear production.

name: illinois
sentence: The production of its nuclear power plants accounted for 12 per cent of the country's total.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, 48% of Illinois's electricity was generated using nuclear energy.

name: illinois
sentence: Operation Morris is the only de facto radioactive waste storage facility in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has been increasingly interested in the use of wind energy for electricity generation.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2009, most of Illinois was described as "marginal or fair" for wind energy production by the U.S. Department of Energy, and some western sections were considered "good" and parts of the south were considered "poor".

name: illinois
sentence: These ratings apply to wind turbines with a hub height of 50 metres (160 feet); the more recent wind turbines are larger, allowing them to reach stronger winds farther from the ground.

name: illinois
sentence: As a result, other areas of Illinois have become potential wind farm sites.

name: illinois
sentence: In September 2009, Illinois had 1116.06 MW of installed wind power and an additional 741.9 MW were under construction.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks ninth in the United States in terms of installed wind capacity and sixteenth in terms of potential capacity.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's large wind farms include Twin Groves, Rail Splitter, EcoGrove and Mendota Hills.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, wind energy accounted for only 1.7% of Illinois's energy production, and it was estimated that wind energy could provide between 5% and 10% of the state's energy needs.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the Illinois General Assembly mandated in 2007 that by 2025, 25% of the electricity generated in Illinois would come from renewable resources.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is the second largest producer of corn in the United States, and Illinois corn is used to produce 40% of ethanol consumed in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Archer Daniels Midland in Decatur, Illinois is the world's leading producer of ethanol from corn.

name: illinois
sentence: The National Corn-to-Ethanol Research Center (NCERC), the world's only facility dedicated to finding ways to convert corn to ethanol, is located on the campus of Southern Illinois University Edwardsville.

name: illinois
sentence: University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is a partner in the Energy Biosciences Institute (EBI), a $500 million biofuel research project funded by the oil giant BP.

name: illinois
sentence: The tax is collected by the Illinois Ministry of Revenue.

name: illinois
sentence: State income tax is calculated by multiplying net income by a flat rate.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1990, the rate was set at 3 per cent, but in 2010, the General Assembly voted for a temporary 5 per cent increase in the rate; the new rate came into effect on 1 January 2011; the personal income rate came to a partial end on 1 January 2015 at 3.75 per cent, while corporate income tax fell to 5.25 per cent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois did not succeed in adopting a budget from 2015 to 2017, after the 736-day budget impasse, a budget was adopted in Illinois after legislators overturned Governor Bruce Rauner's veto, raising the personal income rate to 4.95% and the corporate rate to 7%.

name: illinois
sentence: There are two rates for government sales tax: 6.25% for general goods and 1% for food, drugs and eligible medical devices.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax is an important source of tax revenue for the taxing districts of local government.

name: illinois
sentence: Property tax is a local, non-State tax imposed by local government tax districts, which include counties, cantons, municipalities, school districts and special tax districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Property taxes in Illinois are only imposed on real property.

name: illinois
sentence: On May 1, 2019, the Illinois senator voted in favour of a constitutional amendment that would have been struck by the wording of the Illinois Constitution requiring a fixed tax on state income, in a vote of 73 to 44.

name: illinois
sentence: Had it been approved, the amendment would have allowed the state legislator to impose a progressive income tax based on annual income.

name: illinois
sentence: Governor J.B. Pritzker approved the Bill on May 27, 2019.

name: illinois
sentence: It was planned for a general election in 2020 and required the approval of 60 per cent of voters to effectively amend the state constitution.

name: illinois
sentence: The amendment was not approved by Illinoisers, with 55.1% voting "no" at approval and 44.9% voting "yes".

name: illinois
sentence: In 2017, Chicago had the highest rate of state tax and local sales tax for an American city with a population of more than 200,000, at 10.250%.

name: illinois
sentence: The State of Illinois has the second highest real estate tax rate: 2.31%, the second highest in New Jersey at 2.44%.

name: illinois
sentence: Toll roads are a user tax for citizens and visitors to the state of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks seventh out of the 11 states with the most kilometers of toll roads, 282.1 miles.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago ranks fourth among America's most expensive toll roads per kilometre, with the Chicago Skyway paying 51.2 cents per mile.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has the 11th gas tax per state, at 37.5 cents per gallon.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has many museums.

name: illinois
sentence: Several Chicago museums are ranked among the best in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: These include the John G. Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum of Natural History, the Chicago Art Institute, the Adler Planetarium, and the Museum of Science and Industry.

name: illinois
sentence: The modern Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum in Springfield is the largest and most frequented presidential library in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Museum has a collection of 13.5 million objects that tell the story of Illinois's life, land, people and art.

name: illinois
sentence: The ISM is one of only 5% of the nation's museums that are accredited by the American Museum Alliance.

name: illinois
sentence: Other historical museums in the state include the Polish Museum of America in Chicago, the Manoir de Magnolia in Cairo, the Easley Pioneer Museum in Ipava, the Elihu Benjamin Washburne, Ulysses S. Grant Homes, both in Galena, and the Chanute Air Museum, located on the former Chanute Air Base in Rantoul.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago metropolitan area is also home to two zoos: Brookfield Zoo, located about 10 miles west of downtown Brookfield, contains over 2300 animals and covers 216 acres (87 ha).

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln Park Zoo is located at Lincoln Park on the north side of Chicago, approximately 3 miles (4.8 km) north of the loop.

name: illinois
sentence: The zoo represents over 35 acres (14 ha) of the park.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has been a leader in music education, hosting the Midwest Clinical International Band and Orchestra Conference since 1946, as well as the head office of the Illinois Music Educators Association (IMEA), one of the country's largest professional music education organizations.

name: illinois
sentence: Every summer since 2004, Southern Illinois University Carbondale has hosted the Southern Illinois Music Festival, which features dozens of shows throughout the region.

name: illinois
sentence: Avant-garde artists included Trio Eroica and violinist David Kim.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago, in the northeast corner of the state, is an important centre for music in the western central United States where distinctive blues forms (very responsible for the future creation of rock and roll), and home music, a genre of electronic dance music, have been developed.

name: illinois
sentence: The large migration of poor black workers from the South to industrial cities brought traditional jazz and blues music to the city, resulting in blues Chicago and "Chicago-style" Dixieland jazz.

name: illinois
sentence: Famous blues artists include Muddy Waters, Junior Wells, Howlin' Wolf and both Sonny Boy Williamsons; great jazz includes Nat King Cole, Gene Ammons, Benny Goodman and Bud Freeman.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is also well-known for its soul music.

name: illinois
sentence: In the early 1930s, evangelical music began to gain popularity in Chicago due to contributions by Thomas A. Dorsey to Pilgrim Baptist Church.

name: illinois
sentence: In the 1980s and 1990s heavy rock, punk and hip hop also became popular in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago orchestras include the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, the Chicago Lyric Opera and the Chicago Sinfonietta.

name: illinois
sentence: John Hughes, who moved from Grosse Pointe to Northbrook, has based many of his films in Chicago, and its suburbs.

name: illinois
sentence: Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Home Alone, The Breakfast Club, and all of his films take place in the fiction Shermer, Illinois (the original name of Northbrook was Shermerville, and Hughes's High School, Glenbrook North High School, is on Shermer Road).

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the locations in his films include Glenbrook North, the former Maine North High School, the Ben Rose House in Highland Park, and the famous Home Alone House in Winnetka, Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Like one of the major cities in the United States, all major sports leagues have teams headquartered in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: Many minor league teams also call Illinois their house.

name: illinois
sentence: These include the following:

name: illinois
sentence: The state has 13 athletic programs that compete in NCAA Division I, the highest level of university sport in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: The two most important are Illinois Fighting Illini and Northwestern Wildcats, both members of the Big Ten Conference and the only participants in one of the so-called "Power Five Conferences".

name: illinois
sentence: The Fighting Illini football team won five national championships and three Rose Bowl games, while the men's basketball team won 17 conference seasons and played five four finals.

name: illinois
sentence: Meanwhile, the Wildcats won eight football championships and one Rose Bowl game.

name: illinois
sentence: The Northern Illinois Huskies of DeKalb, Illinois, competed in the Mid-American Conference winning four conference championships and winning an offer in the Orange Bowl with candidate Heisman Jordan Lynch at the quarterback.

name: illinois
sentence: The Huskies are the only other government team competing in the Football Bowl Subdivision, the highest level of the NCAA football.

name: illinois
sentence: Four schools have football programmes that participate in the second level of Division I football, the Football Championship Subdivision.

name: illinois
sentence: The State of Illinois Redbirds (Normal, adjacent to Bloomington) and the Salukis of southern Illinois (the latter representing the principal campus of the University of Southern Illinois in Carbondale) are members of the Missouri Valley Conference (MVC) for non-football sports and the Missouri Valley Football Conference (MVFC).

name: illinois
sentence: Western Illinois Leathernecks (Macomb) are full members of the Summit League, which does not sponsor football, and also participate in the MVFC.

name: illinois
sentence: The Panthers of Eastern Illinois (Charleston) are members of the Ohio Valley Conference (OVC).

name: illinois
sentence: The City of Chicago is home to four Division I programs that do not sponsor football.

name: illinois
sentence: The DePaul Blue Demons, with their major campuses at Lincoln Park and Loop, are members of the Big East Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: The Loyola Ramblers, whose main campus overlaps the community areas of Edgewater and Rogers Park on the north side of the city, are fighting the MVC.

name: illinois
sentence: The Flames of the UIC, near the west side next to the loop, are in the Horizon League.

name: illinois
sentence: The Chicago State Cougars, on the southern side of the city, participate in the Western Athletic Conference.

name: illinois
sentence: Finally, two non-football division I programs are located in the lower state.

name: illinois
sentence: The Bradley Braves (Peoria) are members of the MVC, and the SIU Edwardsville Cougars (in the Metro East region through the Mississippi River of St. Louis) participate in the OVC.

name: illinois
sentence: The city once housed several other teams that had not survived or belonged to leagues that had retreated.

name: illinois
sentence: The NFL cardinals, currently playing in the Phoenix suburb of Glendale, Arizona, played in Chicago as cardinals of Chicago until they moved to St. Louis, Missouri after the 1959 season.

name: illinois
sentence: An NBA expansion team known as Chicago Packers in 1961-1962, and as Chicago Zephyrs the following year, settled in Baltimore after the 1962-1963 season.

name: illinois
sentence: The franchise is now known as Washington Wizards.

name: illinois
sentence: Peoria chiefs and Kane County Cougars are minor league baseball teams affiliated with the MLB.

name: illinois
sentence: The Schaumburg Boomers and Lake County Fielders are members of the North American League, and the Southern Illinois Miners, Gateway Grizzlies, Joliet Slamers, Windy City ThunderBolts and Normal CornBetters belong to the Frontier League.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to the Chicago wolves, the AHL also owns the Rockford IceHogs as a subsidiary of the Chicago Blackhawks' AHL.

name: illinois
sentence: The second incarnation of the Peoria Rivermen plays in the SPHL.

name: illinois
sentence: Oval race tracks at Chicagoland Speedway in Joliet, Chicago Motor Speedway in Cicero and Gateway International Raceway in Madison, near St. Louis, hosted NASCAR, CART and IRL races, while the Sports Car Club of America, among other national and regional road racing clubs, visited the Autobahn Country Club in Joliet, the Blackhawk Farms Raceway in Beloit South and the former Meadowdale International Raceway in Carpentersville.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has a number of short tracks and dragstrips.

name: illinois
sentence: The drag track at Gateway International Raceway and Route 66 Raceway, which is located on the same property as the Chicagoland Speedway, both hosts of the NHRA drag races.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has several golf courses, such as Olympia Fields, Medinah, Midlothian, Cog Hill and Conway Farms, which often hosted the BMW, Western Open and Women's Western Open Championships.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the State hosted 13 editions of the U.S. Open (last in Olympia Fields in 2003), six editions of the PGA Championship (last in Medina in 2006), three editions of the U.S. Women's Open (last in the Merit Club), the 2009 Solheim Cup (in Rich Harvest Farms) and the 2012 Ryder Cup (in Medinah).

name: illinois
sentence: The John Deere Classic is a regular PGA Tour event played in Quad Cities since 1971, while the Encompass Championship has been a Champions Tour event since 2013.

name: illinois
sentence: Previously, the LPGA State Farm Classic was an LGGA circuit event from 1976 to 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's system of state parks began in 1908 with what is now Fort Massac State Park, becoming the first park in a system encompassing more than 60 parks and roughly the same number of recreational and wildlife areas.

name: illinois
sentence: Areas protected by the National Parks Service include the Illinois and Michigan Canal National Heritage Corridor near Lockport, the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, Lincoln Home National Historic Site in Springfield, the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail, the Tears National Historic Trail, the American Discovery Trail, and the Pullman National Monument.

name: illinois
sentence: The federal government also manages the Shawnee and Midewin National Tallgrass Prairie national forests.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government, under the Illinois Constitution, has three branches of government: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is divided into several State-wide elected offices, with the governor as head of the executive branch.

name: illinois
sentence: The legislative functions are assigned to the Illinois General Assembly.

name: illinois
sentence: The judiciary consists of the Supreme Court and the lower courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois General Assembly is the State Legislative Assembly, composed of 118 members of the Illinois House of Representatives and 59 members of the Illinois Senator.

name: illinois
sentence: The members of the General Assembly shall be elected at the beginning of each equal year.

name: illinois
sentence: The Compiled Statutes of Illinois (ILCS) are general and permanent codified statutes.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch consists of six elected members and their offices, as well as many other departments.

name: illinois
sentence: The six elected members are the Governor, the Lieutenant Governor, the Attorney General, the Secretary of State, the Controller and the Treasurer.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government has many departments, agencies, boards and commissions, but the so-called code departments provide most government services.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's judiciary is Illinois's unified judicial system.

name: illinois
sentence: It is composed of the Supreme Court, the Court of Appeal and circuit courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Supreme Court oversees the administration of the judiciary.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's administrative divisions are counties, townships, police stations, cities, cities, villages and special purpose districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois base subdivision is the 102 counties.

name: illinois
sentence: Eighty-five of the 102 counties are in turn divided into cantons and neighbourhoods.

name: illinois
sentence: Municipalities are towns, villages and incorporated cities.

name: illinois
sentence: Some localities have the rule of the house, which allows them to govern themselves to some extent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a democratic fort.

name: illinois
sentence: Historically, Illinois was a political swing state, whose quasi-parity existed between republican and democratic parties.

name: illinois
sentence: However, in recent elections, the Democratic Party gained ground, and Illinois became a strong "blue" state in presidential campaigns.

name: illinois
sentence: The votes in Chicago and most Cook counties have long been highly democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: However, "collar counties" (the suburbs surrounding Cook County, Illinois) may be considered moderate electoral districts.

name: illinois
sentence: College towns like Carbondale, Champaign, and Normal as meagre Democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: Republicans continue to rule in rural areas in northern and central Illinois, as well as in southern Illinois outside eastern Saint-Louis.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1920 to 1972, Illinois was carried by the winner of each of these 14 presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: In fact, the state has long been regarded as a national viewpoint, supporting the winner in every election of the 20th century, with the exception of 1916 and 1976.

name: illinois
sentence: On the other hand, Illinois moved more towards the Democratic Party and voted for its presidential candidates in the last six elections; in 2000, George W. Bush became the first Republican to win the presidency without wearing either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: A local politician and a Chicago resident Barack Obama easily won the state's 21 electoral votes in 2008, with 61.9% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, outgoing Governor Pat Quinn was re-elected with 47 per cent of the vote, while Republican Mark Kirk was elected to the Senate with 48 per cent of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2012, President Obama easily carried Illinois again, with 58% to the Republican candidate Mitt Romney by 41%.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2014, Republican Bruce Rauner defeated Governor Quinn from 50% to 46% to become Illinois's first Republican governor in 12 years after being sworn in on January 12, 2015, while Democratic Senator Dick Durbin was re-elected with 53% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, Hillary Clinton won Illinois with 55% of the vote, and Tammy Duckworth beat incumbent Mark Kirk 54% at 40%.

name: illinois
sentence: George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republican presidential candidates to win without wearing Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2018, Democratic JB Pritzker beat Bruce Rauner for governorship with 54% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: State politics has been infamous for cases of highly visible corruption, as well as for cross-formers, such as governors Adlai Stevenson and James R. Thompson.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, former Governor George Ryan was sentenced for racketeering and corruption, resulting in a six-and-a-half year prison sentence.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Governor Rod Blagojevich received a criminal complaint of corruption, following allegations that he had conspired to sell the seat of Senator left vacant by President Barack Obama to the highest bidder.

name: illinois
sentence: Subsequently, on 7 December 2011, Rod Blagojevich was sentenced to 14 years in prison for these charges, as well as to a perjury during the testimony of the case, i.e. 18 convictions.

name: illinois
sentence: Blagojevich was indicted and sentenced by the legislature, which led to his dismissal.

name: illinois
sentence: At the end of the 20th century, MP Dan Rostenkowski was imprisoned for mail fraud; former governor and federal judge Otto Kerner, Jr. was imprisoned for corruption; Secretary of State Paul Powell was investigated and found to have gained great wealth through bribes; and the State Auditor of Public Accounts (Controller) Orville Hodge was imprisoned for embezzlement.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1912 William Lorimer, the boss of the Chicago GOP, was expelled from the U.S. Senate for corruption, and in 1921 Governor Len Small was found for swindling the $1 million state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has shown a strong presence in the presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: Three presidents claimed Illinois as a political base when they introduced themselves to the presidency: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant and, more recently, Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln was born in Kentucky, but he moved to Illinois at the age of 21.

name: illinois
sentence: He served in the General Assembly and represented the 7th District of Congress in the United States House of Representatives prior to his election to the presidency in 1860.

name: illinois
sentence: Ulysse S. Grant was born in Ohio and had a military career that prevented him from settling, but on the eve of the civil war and as the middle age approached, he moved to Illinois and thus used the state as his home and political base to run for the presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Barack Obama was born in Hawaii and made Illinois his home after graduating from law school, and then represented Illinois in the US Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: He was then appointed president in 2008, as a candidate for his Illinois base.

name: illinois
sentence: Ronald Reagan was born in Illinois, in the city of Tampico, grew up in Dixon, Illinois, and studied at Eureka College outside Peoria.

name: illinois
sentence: Reagan then moved to California during his young adulthood.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became an actor, then governor of California before being elected president.

name: illinois
sentence: Hillary Clinton was born and raised in the suburbs of Chicago and became the first woman to represent a major political party in the general election of the U.S. presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Clinton ran away from a platform based in New York State.

name: illinois
sentence: Nine African-Americans were part of the United States Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: Three of them represented Illinois, the more than one state: Carol Moseley-Braun, Barack Obama and Roland Burris, who was appointed to replace Obama after his election to the presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Moseley-Braun was the first African American woman to become American

name: illinois

name: illinois
sentence: Three Illinois families played a particularly important role in the Democratic Party, winning both nationally and across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: The Stevenson family, originally rooted in central Illinois and later based in the Chicago metropolitan area, provided four generations of Illinois civil servants.

name: illinois
sentence: The Daley family's electrical base was in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The Pritzker family is based in Chicago and has played important roles in both the private and public sectors.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Education Council (ISBE) is autonomous from the Governor and the legislature of the state and manages public education in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Local municipalities and their respective school districts run individual public schools, but the ISBE checks the performance of public schools with the Illinois School Report Card.

name: illinois
sentence: ISBE also makes recommendations to State leaders on education spending and policies.

name: illinois
sentence: Education is compulsory for 7-17-year-olds in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools are generally, but not exclusively, divided into three levels of primary and secondary education: primary, secondary or secondary school, and secondary school.

name: illinois
sentence: District areas are often complex.

name: illinois
sentence: Many parts of the State are located in two school districts, one for secondary schools and the other for primary and secondary schools.

name: illinois
sentence: And these districts don't necessarily share borders.

name: illinois
sentence: A given secondary school may have several elementary districts that feed on it, but some of these foster districts may themselves feed on it in several secondary school districts.

name: illinois
sentence: Using the criteria established by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Education, there are eleven "national universities" in the State.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Chicago is consistently ranked as one of the top ten universities in the world on various independent university rankings, and its Booth School of Business, as well as the Kellogg School of Management in Northwestern, are consistently ranked among the top five business schools in the country and top ten in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is often ranked among the best engineering schools in the world and in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: As of August 19, 2010, six of them were at the "first level" of the nation's top 500 national universities, according to the rankings of the US News & World Report: the University of Chicago, the University of Northwestern, the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, the University of Loyola Chicago, the Illinois Institute of Technology, the University of DePaul, the University of Illinois at Chicago, the University of Illinois, the University of Southern Illinois Carbondale, and the University of Northern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has over twenty other four-year public and private accredited universities and dozens of small liberal arts colleges across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, Illinois supports 49 public community colleges in Illinois's community college system.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois schools are funded primarily by property taxes, based on the assessment of land value by the state, rather than by direct government contributions.

name: illinois
sentence: Tracy Steffes described Illinois's public education as historically "inequitable", a system where one of the "richest states" is "the smartest in its support for education."There have been several attempts to reform school funding in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The most notable attempt took place in 1973 with the adoption of the Illinois Resource Equalizer Formula, a measure by which it was hoped that funding could be collected and distributed more equitably to schools in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: However, opposition from the well-off Illinois communities who opposed the obligation to pay for the less well-off school districts (including many black-majority communities, produced by redness, white flight and other "soft" segregation methods) led to the abolition of the formulae in the late 1980s.

name: illinois
sentence: Due to its central location and proximity to the Rust Belt and Grain Belt, Illinois is a national hub for air, motor, rail and road traffic.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1962 to 1998, the O'Hare International Airport in Chicago (ORD) is the busiest airport in the world, measured both in terms of total flights and passengers.

name: illinois
sentence: While it was surpassed by Hartsfield of Atlanta in 1998 (as Chicago divides its air traffic between O'Hare and Midway airports, while Atlanta uses only one airport), with 59.3 million national passengers per year, as well as 11.4 million international passengers in 2008, O'Hare remains one of the two or three most frequented airports in the world, and in a few years still ranks first in total flights.

name: illinois
sentence: This is an important hub for United Airlines and American Airlines, and a major airport expansion project is currently underway.

name: illinois
sentence: The Midway Airport (MDW), which had been the busiest airport in the world at some point until it was supplanted by O'Hare as the busiest airport in 1962, is now the secondary airport in the Chicago metropolitan area and still ranks as one of the busiest airports in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway is a major hub for Southwest Airlines, serving many other carriers.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway served 17.3 million national and international passengers in 2008.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has an extensive rail passenger and freight transportation network.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is a national Amtrak centre and passengers in the state are served by Amtrak's Illinois Service, with Chicago at Carbondale Illini and Saluki, Chicago at Quincy Carl Sandburg and Illinois Zephyr, and Chicago at St. Louis Lincoln Service.
