sentence: Currently, there are trailers on the Chicago–St.

name: illinois
sentence: Louis Line to increase the maximum speed to 110 mph (180 km/h), which would reduce travel time by one and a half hours.

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly all North American railways meet in Chicago, making it the largest and most active railway centre in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: A large suburban train is provided in the city itself and in some immediate suburbs by the "L" system of the Chicago Transit Authority.

name: illinois
sentence: One of the largest suburban rail networks in the United States, operated by Metra, uses existing rail lines to provide direct access for hundreds of suburbs to the city and beyond.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to the state rail lines, Mississippi and Illinois offer important transportation routes for the state's agricultural interests.

name: illinois
sentence: Lake Michigan provides Illinois with access to the Atlantic Ocean through the St. Lawrence Seaway.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's interstate highways are all segments of the interstate highway system that are owned and maintained by the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the distinction of having the most primary (double-digit) interstates pass through it among the 50 states with 13.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also ranks third among the 50 states with the most interstate mileage, coming after California and Texas, which are much larger states in the region.

name: illinois
sentence: The main inter-state highways across the state include Interstate 24 (I-24), I-39, I-41, I-55, I-57, I-64, I-70, I-72, I-74, I-80, I-88, I-90 and I-94.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Transportation Department (IDOT) is responsible for the maintenance of the USHighways in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois system is made up of 21 primary highways.

name: illinois
sentence: The major highways across the state include the United States 6, the United States 12, the United States 14, the United States 20, the United States 24, the United States 30, the United States 34, the United States 36, the United States 40, the United States 41, the United States 45, the United States 50, the United States 51, the United States 52, the United States 54, the United States 60, the United States 62, and the United States 67.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana () is an American state located in the Midwestern and Great Lakes regions of North America.

name: indiana
sentence: It is the 38th largest by region and the 17th most populous in the 50 United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Its capital and the largest city is Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was admitted to the United States as the 19th state on 11 December 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: It borders Lake Michigan to the northwest, Michigan to the north, Ohio to the east, Ohio River and Kentucky to the south and southeast, and Wabash River and Illinois to the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Before becoming a territory, various indigenous peoples have lived in Indiana for thousands of years.

name: indiana
sentence: Since its creation as a territory, settlement models in Indiana have reflected regional cultural segmentation in the eastern United States; the northernmost level of the state has been established primarily by residents of New England and New York, Central Indiana by migrants from the states of Mid-Atlantic and adjacent Ohio, and Southern Indiana by settlers from the southern states, particularly Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a diversified economy with a gross domestic product of $359.12 billion in 2017.

name: indiana
sentence: It has several metropolitan areas with more than 100,000 inhabitants and a number of small industrial cities.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana hosts professional sports teams, including the NFL Indianapolis Colts and the NBA Indiana Pacers, and hosts several important competitions, including the Indianapolis 500.

name: indiana
sentence: The name Indiana means "Indian land," or simply "Indian land."

name: indiana
sentence: It is also a result of Indiana's territorial history.

name: indiana
sentence: On May 7, 1800, the United States Congress passed legislation to divide the Northwest Territory into two regions and named the western section of the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1816, when Congress passed enabling legislation to begin the process of establishing the state for Indiana, part of that territorial land became the geographical area of the new state.

name: indiana
sentence: An Indiana resident is officially known as Hoosier.

name: indiana
sentence: The etymology of this word is contested, but the main theory, put forward by the Indiana Historical Bureau and the Indiana Historical Society, has its origin in Virginia, the Carolinas, and Tennessee (the South of Upland) as a term for a backwoodsman, a rough peasant, or a scapegoat of country.

name: indiana
sentence: The first inhabitants of what is now Indiana were the Paleo-Indians, who arrived about 8,000 B.C. after the melting of glaciers at the end of the ice age.

name: indiana
sentence: Divided into small groups, the Paleo-Indians are nomads hunting large game species such as mastodones.

name: indiana
sentence: They created chert-made stone tools by crisping, knapping and flocking.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period, which began between 5000 and 4000 BC, covered the next phase of Aboriginal culture.

name: indiana
sentence: People have developed new tools and techniques to cook food, an important step in civilization.

name: indiana
sentence: These new tools included different types of spear tips and knives, with different types of notches.

name: indiana
sentence: They have made ground stone tools such as stone axes, woodworking tools and grinding stones.

name: indiana
sentence: During the latter part of the period, they built mounds of land and middens, showing that settlements were becoming more and more permanent.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period ended about 1500 BC, although some archaic people lived up to 700 BC.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period began around 1500 B.C., when new cultural attributes emerged.

name: indiana
sentence: The people created ceramics and pottery, and extended their cultivation of plants.

name: indiana
sentence: A group at the beginning of the wood era called the Adena people had elegant burial rituals, with log tombs under the mounds of the earth.

name: indiana
sentence: In the middle of the Woodland period, the Hopewell people began to develop long-distance merchandise trade.

name: indiana
sentence: Towards the end of the stage, people developed a highly productive crop and the adaptation of agriculture, cultivating crops such as corn and squash.

name: indiana
sentence: Woodland's period ended around 1000 AD.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi culture appeared from 1000 AD until the 15th century, shortly before the arrival of Europeans.

name: indiana
sentence: During this phase, people created large urban settlements designed according to their cosmology, with large mounds and squares defining ceremonial and public spaces.

name: indiana
sentence: The concentrated colonies are dependent on agricultural surpluses.

name: indiana
sentence: One of these complexes was Angel Mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: They had vast public spaces such as squares and platform mounds, where the chiefs lived or conducted rituals.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi civilization collapsed in Indiana in the middle of the 15th century for reasons that remain obscure.

name: indiana
sentence: The historical Amerindian tribes of the region at the time of the European meeting spoke different languages of the Algonquian family.

name: indiana
sentence: They included Shawnee, Miami and Illini.

name: indiana
sentence: The refugee tribes of the eastern regions, including the Delaware who settled in the White and Whitewater River valleys, later joined them.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1679, the French explorer René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle, was the first European to cross Indiana after reaching the current Bend Sud at the Saint Joseph River.

name: indiana
sentence: He returned the following year to learn more about the area.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian fur traders soon arrived, bringing blankets, jewelry, tools, whiskey and weapons to trade hides with the Amerindians.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1702 Sieur Juchereau established the first trading post near Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1715 Sieur de Vincennes built Fort Miami in Kekionga, now Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1717, another Canadian, Picote de Beletre, built Fort Ouitatinon on the Wabash River, attempting to control the Amerindian trade routes from Lake Erie to the Mississippi River.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1732 Sieur de Vincennes built a second fur trading post in Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian settlers, who had left the previous post as a result of the hostilities, returned in greater numbers.

name: indiana
sentence: In a few years, British settlers arrived from the east and fought against Canadians for control of the lucrative fur trade.

name: indiana
sentence: The fighting between the French and British settlers took place throughout the 1750s.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's Amerindian tribes partnered with French Canadians during the French and Indian War (also known as the Seven Years' War).

name: indiana
sentence: With the British victory in 1763, the French were forced to yield to the British crown all their lands in North America east of the Mississippi River and north and west of the colonies.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana tribes did not give up: they took Fort Ouiatinon and Fort Miami during the Pontiac rebellion.

name: indiana
sentence: The British Royal Proclamation of 1763 designated the lands west of the Appalachians for Amerindian purposes and excluded British settlers from the area known by the Crown as the "Indian Territory."

name: indiana
sentence: In 1775 the American Revolutionary War began as the settlers sought British autonomy and independence.

name: indiana
sentence: The majority of the fighting took place near the East Coast, but patriotic military officer George Rogers Clark called for an army to help fight the British in the West.

name: indiana
sentence: Clark's army won major battles and took Vincennes and Fort Sackville on 25 Feb. 1779.

name: indiana
sentence: During the war Clark managed to cut off British troops, who attacked the settlers in the east of the West.

name: indiana
sentence: His success is often recognized for changing the course of the American revolutionary war.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the war, through the Treaty of Paris, the British crown ceded its lands south of the Great Lakes to the new United States, including the Amerindian lands.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1787, the United States defined the Northwest Territory, which included the present Indiana region.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1800 Congress separated Ohio from the Northwest Territory, designating the rest of the land as Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: President Thomas Jefferson chose William Henry Harrison as governor of the territory, and Vincennes became the capital.

name: indiana
sentence: After the separation of Michigan Territory and the formation of Illinois Territory, Indiana was reduced to its present size and geography.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning with the battle of the woods fallen in 1794 and the Treaty of Greenville in 1795, Native American titles on Indiana lands were extinguished by usurpation, purchase or war and processed.

name: indiana
sentence: About half the state was acquired in the Treaty of St. Mary's of Miami in 1818.

name: indiana
sentence: Purchases were only completed when the Treaty of Mississippiwas, in 1826, acquired the last of the American native lands reserved in the northeast.

name: indiana
sentence: A portrait of the Indiana border around 1810: The boundary was defined by the Fort Wayne Treaty in 1809, adding much of the southwestern lands around Vincennes and the southeastern lands adjacent to Cincinnati, to areas along the Ohio River as part of American territory.

name: indiana
sentence: The colonies were military outposts such as Fort Ouiatnon in the northwest and Fort Miami (later Fort Wayne) in the northeast, Fort Knox, and the Vincennes settlement in the lower Wabash.

name: indiana
sentence: Other facilities include Clarksville (passing through Louisville), Vevay and Corydon along the Ohio River, Quaker Colony at Richmond, on the eastern border, and Conner's Post (later Connersville) on the eastern central border.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis would not be populated for another 15 years, and the territory of Central and Northern Indiana remained a wilderness inhabited mainly by Aboriginal communities.

name: indiana
sentence: Only two counties in the far southeast, Clark and Dearborn, were organized by European settlers.

name: indiana
sentence: Land titles issued by Cincinnati were scarce.

name: indiana
sentence: Settler migration takes place mainly by flat boat on the Ohio River to the west, and by wagon paths to the Wabash/White River valleys (west) and Whitewater River (east).

name: indiana
sentence: In 1810, the tribe leader of Shawnee Tecumseh and his brother Tenskwatawa encouraged other indigenous tribes in the territory to resist European colonization.

name: indiana
sentence: Tensions rose and the United States authorized Harrison to launch a preventive expedition against the Tecumseh Confederation; the United States obtained victory at the Battle of Tippecanoe on November 7, 1811.

name: indiana
sentence: Tecumseh was killed in 1813 in the Battle of Thames.

name: indiana
sentence: After his death, the armed resistance to the control of the United States ended in the region.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the Amerindian tribes of the state were then abducted west of the Mississippi River in the 1820s and 1830s after the American negotiations and the purchase of their land.

name: indiana
sentence: Corydon, a town in the extreme south of Indiana, was named the second capital of Indiana territory in May 1813 to reduce the threat of Indian raids following the Battle of Tippecanoe.

name: indiana
sentence: Two years later, a petition for state status was approved by the Territory's General Assembly and sent to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: Enabling legislation was passed to allow for the election of delegates to draft a constitution for Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: On June 10, 1816, delegates gathered in Corydon to draft the constitution, which was completed in 19 days.

name: indiana
sentence: Jonathan Jennings was elected the first governor of the state in August 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 11, 1816, President James Madison approved Indiana's admission to union as the nineteenth state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1825 the state capital was transferred from Corydon to Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Many European immigrants moved west to Indiana in the early 19th century.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest group of immigrants to settle in Indiana were Germans, as well as many immigrants from Ireland and England.

name: indiana
sentence: The Americans, who were predominantly English, migrated from northern New York and New England, as well as from the middle of the Atlantic state of Pennsylvania.

name: indiana
sentence: The arrival of steamboats on the Ohio River in 1811 and the national road at Richmond in 1829 greatly facilitated the colonization of northern and western Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: After the creation of a state, the new government worked to transform Indiana from a border into a developed, well-populated and prosperous state, starting with significant demographic and economic changes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1836, the founders of the state launched a program, the Indiana Mammouth Internal Improvement Act, which led to the construction of government-funded roads, canals, railways and public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The plans went bankrupt in the state and were a financial disaster but increased the value of the land and produced more than four times the value.

name: indiana
sentence: In response to the crisis and to avoid another, in 1851, a second constitution was adopted.

name: indiana
sentence: Its provisions included the prohibition of public debt, as well as the extension of voting rights to African-Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: During the American civil war, Indiana exercised political influence and played an important role in the affairs of the nation.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was the first Western state to mobilize for the United States in the war, and Indiana soldiers participated in all major commitments of the war.

name: indiana
sentence: The state provided 126 infantry regiments, 26 artillery batteries and 13 cavalry regiments to the Union.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1861, Indiana received a quota of 7,500 men to join the Union Army.

name: indiana
sentence: So many volunteers in the first call had to be hijacked and thousands had to be hijacked.

name: indiana
sentence: Before the war ended, Indiana had contributed 208,367 men.

name: indiana
sentence: Of these men, more than 35% lost their lives: 24,416 lost their lives and more than 50,000 were injured.

name: indiana
sentence: The only civil war conflicts fought in Indiana were the Newburgh Raid, a bloodless capture of the city; and the Battle of Corydon, which took place during the Morgan Raid, leaving 15 dead, 40 wounded, and 355 captured.

name: indiana
sentence: After the war Indiana remained a largely agricultural state.

name: indiana
sentence: Post-war industries included mining, including limestone extraction, meat packaging, food processing, such as grain grinding, alcohol distillation and the construction of cars, bugs, agricultural machinery and equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the discovery of natural gas in the 1880s in northern Indiana led to an economic boom: the abundant and cheap fuel attracted heavy industry; the availability of jobs in turn attracted new settlers from other parts of the country as well as Europe.

name: indiana
sentence: This led to the rapid expansion of cities such as South Bend, Gary, Indianapolis and Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: With the start of the industrial revolution, Indian industry began to grow at an accelerated pace across the northern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: With industrialization, workers have developed trade unions and suffrage movements in relation to women's advancement.

name: indiana
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, Indiana became a strong manufacturing state linked to the new automotive industry.

name: indiana
sentence: Haynes-Apperson, the country's first commercially successful automotive company, operated in Kokomo until 1925.

name: indiana
sentence: The construction of the Indianapolis highway and the start-up of auto-related industries were also linked to the automotive boom.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1930s, Indiana, like the rest of the nation, was hit by the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: The economic recession had a significant negative impact on Indiana, such as the decline in urbanization.

name: indiana
sentence: The Dust Bowl further west has led many migrants to flee to the more industrialized Midwest.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Paul V. McNutt's administration has endeavoured to establish a publicly funded social assistance system to assist overcrowded private charities.

name: indiana
sentence: During its administration, spending and taxes were significantly reduced in response to the depression, and the state government was completely reorganized.

name: indiana
sentence: McNutt ended the state ban and promulgated the first state income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: On several occasions he declared martial law to put an end to workers' strikes.

name: indiana
sentence: The Second World War helped revive the Indiana economy, as the war required steel, food and other goods that had been produced in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: About ten per cent of the population of Indiana joined the armed forces, while hundreds of industries won war production contracts and began to manufacture war equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana manufactured 4.5 per cent of all U.S. military armaments produced during the Second World War, ranking eighth among the 48 states.

name: indiana
sentence: The expansion of the industry to meet the demands of war has helped to end the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: With the end of World War II, Indiana rebounded to pre-depression production levels.

name: indiana
sentence: Industry became the main employer, a trend that continued in the 1960s.

name: indiana
sentence: During the 1950s and 1960s, urbanization led to strong growth in the cities of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The automotive, steel and pharmaceutical industries dominated large Indiana companies.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's population continued to grow after the war, exceeding five million by the 1970 census.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1960s, Matthew E. Welsh's administration passed its first 2% sales tax.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana schools were disintegrated in 1949.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1950, the Census Bureau reported that the Indiana population was 95.5% white and 4.4% black.

name: indiana
sentence: The Welsh Governor has also worked with the General Assembly to pass the Indiana Civil Rights Bill, which provides equal protection for minorities seeking employment.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 8, 1964, a Convair B-58 carrying nuclear weapons slipped onto an ice track on the basis of the Bunker Hill Air Force in Bunker Hill, Indiana, and caught fire during a training exercise.

name: indiana
sentence: The five nuclear weapons on board were set on fire, including a thermonuclear weapon of 9 megatonnes, causing radioactive contamination of the crash area.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning in 1970, a series of amendments to the Constitution of the State were proposed.

name: indiana
sentence: With the adoption, the Indiana Court of Appeal was established and the procedure for appointing judges changed.

name: indiana
sentence: The 1973 oil crisis created a recession that affected the automobile industry in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Companies like Delco Electronics and Delphi have begun a long series of cuts that have contributed to high unemployment rates in manufacturing in Anderson, Muncie and Kokomo.

name: indiana
sentence: The trend towards restructuring and deindustrialisation continued until the 1980s, when the national and state economy began to diversify and recover.

name: indiana
sentence: With a total land and water area of 36,418 square miles (94,320 km2), Indiana ranks 38th among the largest states.

name: indiana
sentence: The State has a maximum northern dimension to the south of 250 miles (400 km) and a maximum east-west dimension of 145 miles (233 km).

name: indiana
sentence: The geographic centre of the state (39° 53.7'N, 86° 16.0W) is in Marion County.

name: indiana
sentence: Located in the United States Midwestern, Indiana is one of eight states in the Great Lakes region.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is bordered to the north by Michigan, to the east by Ohio, and to the west by Illinois, partially separated by the Wabash River.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake Michigan borders Indiana in the northwest, and Ohio separates Indiana from Kentucky in the south.

name: indiana
sentence: The average altitude of Indiana is about 230 metres above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The highest point in the state is Hoosier Hill in Wayne County, 1257 feet (383 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The lowest point at 320 feet (98 m) above sea level is in Posey County, where the Wabash River meets the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The resulting elevation range of 937 feet (286 m) is the narrowest of any U.S. non-coastal state.

name: indiana
sentence: Only 2,850 square miles (7,400 km2) are above 1000 feet (300 m) and this area is closed in 14 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately 4,700 square miles (12,000 km2) have an altitude of less than 500 feet (150 m), mainly concentrated along Ohio and the lower Wabash, Tell City and Terre Haute valleys at Evansville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: The state consists of two natural areas in the United States: central lowlands and inner lowlands.

name: indiana

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral general assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and the circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana is the head of state administration and has the authority to administer the government as set out in the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor and the Lieutenant Governor are jointly elected for a four-year term, with government elections held in parallel with the United States presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor shall not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the power to adapt the other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may convene special sessions of the General Assembly and select and revoke the leaders of almost all departments, councils and commissions of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include the appeal to the Indiana Guard Reserve or the Indiana National Guard in case of emergency or disaster, the granting of pardons or commutation of the sentence of any criminal offender, except in the case of treason or indictment, and the possession of abundant legal authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor acts as Speaker of the Senate and ensures that the rules of the Senate are respected by his or her constituents.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor only votes when he needs to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the Governor dies in office, becomes permanently unfit, resigns or is charged, the Lieutenant Governor becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If the positions of governor and lieutenant governor are unoccupied, the President pro tempore becomes governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly is composed of a 50-member Senator and a 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senate is the upper house of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the lower house.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative authority within the government of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Both the senator and the house can introduce a bill, except for the fact that the senator is not authorized to pass a bill that will have an impact on revenues.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each House, but both Houses must pass them before they can be presented to the Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislature may cancel the Governor's veto by voting by a majority of the full members in the Senate and in the House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law adopted by the General Assembly must be applied without exception to the whole State.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly does not have the power to create legislation for a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the State's judicial system by adjusting the size of courts and the boundaries of their districts.

name: indiana
sentence: It can also oversee the activities of the executive branch of the state government, has limited the power to regulate county governments within the state, and has exclusive authority to initiate the method of amending the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court consists of five judges and a 15-judge Court of Appeal.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor selects the judges of the Supreme Courts and Appeals Courts from a group of candidates selected by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After a period of two years, judges must obtain the support of the electorate to serve for a ten-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In almost all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can only deal with cases that have been submitted to it after having been heard by lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local district courts are where most cases begin with a trial and the result is decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has initial and exclusive jurisdiction in certain areas, including the practice of law, the discipline or exclusion of judges appointed to the lower courts of the State, and the control of the exercise of jurisdiction by other lower courts of the State.

sentence: The tax is collected by the Indiana Ministry of Revenue.

sentence: Indiana has a flat-rate government income tax rate of 3.23%.

name: indiana
sentence: Many of the counties in the state also collect income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: The government's sales tax rate is 7% with exemptions for food, prescription drugs, and over-the-counter drugs.

name: indiana
sentence: In some jurisdictions, an additional food and beverage tax is imposed at a rate of 1% (the Marion County rate is 2%), on sales of prepared meals and beverages.

name: indiana
sentence: Property taxes are levied on Indiana's real and personal property and are administered by the Department of Finance of Local Government.

name: indiana
sentence: The property is subject to taxation by various taxing units (schools, counties, townships, municipalities and libraries), making the total tax rate the sum of the tax rates imposed by all taxing units in which a property is located.

name: indiana
sentence: However, a "break-through" law passed on March 19, 2008, limits property tax to 1% of the assessed value for owners, 2% for rental properties and agricultural land, and 3% for businesses.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana does not have a legal obligation to balance the state's budget in law or in constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: Instead, it is forbidden by the Constitution to assume the debt.

name: indiana
sentence: The State has a Rain Day Fund and healthy reserves proportional to expenditure.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is one of the six U.S. states that do not allow a veto on a line.

name: indiana
sentence: Since 2010, Indiana has been one of the few States to hold AAA bond credit ratings with the largest three credit rating agencies, the highest possible rating.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's energy production consists mainly of fossil fuel consumption, mainly coal.

name: indiana
sentence: It has 24 coal-fired power stations, including the largest power plant in the country, Gibson, which crosses the Wabash River from Mount Carmel, Illinois.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana also houses the coal-fired power plant with the highest sulphur dioxide emissions in the United States, the Gallagher power plant, just west of New Albany.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2010, Indiana had estimated coal reserves at 57 billion tonnes, and the State's mining activities produced 35 million tonnes of coal per year.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana also owns at least 900 million barrels of oil reserves in the Trenton field, although they are not easy to recover.

name: indiana
sentence: While Indiana has committed to increasing the use of renewable resources such as wind, hydro, biomass or solar energy, progress has been very slow, mainly due to the continued abundance of coal in southern Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the new state plants were coal gasification plants.

name: indiana
sentence: Another source of energy is hydroelectric power.

name: indiana
sentence: Wind power has been developed.

name: indiana
sentence: The 2006 estimates increased Indiana's wind capacity from 30 MW to 50 m high to 40,000 MW to 70 m, and the height of new turbines to 130,000 MW to 100 m in 2010.

name: indiana
sentence: By the end of 2011, Indiana had installed 1,340 MW of wind turbines.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis International Airport serves the larger Indianapolis area.

name: indiana
sentence: It opened in November 2008 and offers a mid-field passenger terminal, halls, an air traffic control tower, a parking garage, and airfield and apron upgrades.

name: indiana
sentence: Other major airports include the Evansville Regional Airport, Fort Wayne International Airport (which is home to 122 National Air Guard Fighter Wing) and South Bend International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: A long-standing proposal to transform Gary Chicago International Airport into the third major Chicago airport received a boost in early 2006 with $48 million in federal funding approved over the next 10 years.

name: indiana
sentence: No airlines operate from the Terre Haute regional airport, but it is used for private aircraft.

name: indiana
sentence: Since 1954, 181 Wing of the Indian National Air Guard has been stationed there, but the 2005 Realignment and Closure Base (BRAC) proposal indicated that the 181st would lose its fighter mission and the F-16 aircraft, leaving the Terre Haute facility with a combat aircraft facility.

name: indiana
sentence: Louisville International Airport, opposite the Ohio River in Louisville, Kentucky, serves southern Indiana, as well as Cincinnati/North Kentucky International Airport in Hebron, Kentucky.

name: indiana
sentence: Many residents of Northwest Indiana, located primarily in the Chicago metropolitan area, use Chicago airports, O'Hare International Airport, and Chicago Midway International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: The major American interstate highways in Indiana are I-64, I-65, I-265, I-465, I-865, I-69, I-469, I-70, I-74, I-80, I-90, I-94 and I-275.

name: indiana
sentence: The various roads that intersect in and around Indianapolis, as well as its historic status as a railway hub, and the canals that crossed Indiana, are the source of the state's motto, the crossroad of America.

name: indiana
sentence: There are also many U.S. highways and highways maintained by the Indiana Department of Transportation.

name: indiana
sentence: They are numbered under the same convention as the United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Motorways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana allows highways with different classifications to have the same number.

name: indiana
sentence: For example, I-64 and Indiana State Road 64 both exist (rather close to each other) in Indiana, but are two separate roads unrelated to each other.

name: indiana
sentence: A $3 billion I-69 project is under way.

name: indiana
sentence: The project has been divided into six sections, with the first five sections (relating Evansville to Martinsville) now completed.

name: indiana
sentence: The sixth and final phase in Indianapolis is under planning.

name: indiana
sentence: Once completed, the I-69 will cross 142 additional miles (229 km) across the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana counties use a network-based system to identify county roads; this system has replaced the old arbitrary system of road numbers and names, and (among other things) it is much easier to identify call sources placed in the 9-1-1 system.

name: indiana
sentence: Such systems are easier to implement in the glacially flat northern and central parts of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Rural counties in the southern third of the state are less likely to have grids and more likely to rely on non-systematic road names (e.g., Crawford, Harrison, Perry, Scott and Washington counties).

name: indiana
sentence: There are also counties in the northern parts of the State that have never set up a network or implemented only part of it.

name: indiana
sentence: Some counties are also distributed in a network that is almost similar to that of diamonds (e.g. Clark, Floyd, Gibson and Knox counties).

name: indiana
sentence: Such a system is also almost useless in these situations as well.

name: indiana
sentence: One day, Knox County used two different network systems for county roads because the county was developed using two different surveying systems, but it has since decided to use route names and to combine roads instead.

name: indiana
sentence: In particular, the St. Joseph County road network, the main city of which is South Bend, uses perennial names (trees) (i.e., trees).

name: indiana
sentence: Ash, Hickory, Ironwood, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: alphabetically for north-south roads and presidential names and other prominent names (i.e. Adams, Edison, Lincoln Way, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: In alphabetical order for east-west roads.

name: indiana
sentence: There are exceptions to this rule in the city centre of South Bend and Mishawaka.

name: indiana
sentence: The east-west roads of Hamilton County continue the numbered Indianapolis street network, from 96th Street to Marion County Line to 296th Street to Tipton County Line.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has over 4,255 miles of track, 91 percent of which are operated by Class I railways, primarily CSX Transportation and Norfolk Southern Railway.

name: indiana
sentence: Other Class I railways in Indiana include Canada's National Railway and Soo Line, a subsidiary of the Canadian Pacific Railway, as well as Amtrak.

name: indiana
sentence: The remaining miles are operated by 37 regional, local, switch and terminal railways.

name: indiana
sentence: The South Shore Line is one of the largest suburban rail networks in the country, stretching from Chicago to South Bend.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is implementing an extensive railway plan developed in 2002 by Parsons Corporation.

name: indiana
sentence: Many recreational trails, such as the Monon Trail and Cardinal Greenway, were created from abandoned railways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana ships more than 70 million tonnes of goods annually by water, which ranks 14th among all U.S. states.

name: indiana
sentence: More than half of the Indiana border is water, which includes 400 miles (640 km) of direct access to two major freight routes: the Great Lakes and the St. Lawrence.

name: indiana
sentence: Lawrence Seaway (via Lake Michigan) and the inland waterway system (through the Ohio River).

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana harbours manage three major harbours including Burns Harbor, Jeffersonville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: In Evansville, three public port facilities and several private port facilities are served throughout the year by five main barge lines on the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: Evansville has been the port of entry for the U.S. Customs for more than 125 years.

name: indiana
sentence: For this reason, it is possible to have international shipments sent to Evansville on bail.

name: indiana
sentence: International freight can then clear customs at Evansville rather than a coastal port.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's constitution of 1816 was the first in the country to establish a publicly funded school system.

name: indiana
sentence: It also awarded a canton to a public university.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the plan proved far too idealistic for a pioneering society, as the tax money was not available to its organization.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1840s Caleb Mills insisted on the need for tax-funded schools, and in 1851 his councils were included in the new state constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1843, the Legislature ruled that African Americans could not attend public schools, leading to the founding of the Union Literary Institute and other schools for them, financed by donations or students themselves.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the growth of the public school system had been hampered by legal entanglements, many public primary schools had been used in 1870.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana children attend public schools, but almost ten per cent attend private and parish schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately half of all Indiana students are enrolled in state-funded four-year schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana public schools have undergone several changes throughout Indiana's history.

name: indiana
sentence: The modern standards of public schools have been implemented throughout the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The new standards were introduced in April 2014.

name: indiana
sentence: The overall objective of these new government standards is to ensure that Indiana students have the skills and requirements to enter the college or labour force at the time of graduation from high school.

name: indiana
sentence: State standards are found for almost all major subjects taught in Indiana's public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Among the priority standards are mathematics, the arts of English and language, science and social studies.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, the Indiana Ministry of Education indicated that the overall graduation rate was 87.19 per cent for exempt graduations and 80.10 per cent for non-graduation graduations.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest educational institution is the University of Indiana, whose flagship campus was approved as an Indiana seminar in 1820.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana State University was established as the State Normal School in 1865.

name: indiana
sentence: The other three independent state universities are the Vincennes University (Founded in 1801 by the Indiana Territory), Ball State University (1918) and the University of Southern Indiana (1965 under the name of ISU – Evansville).

name: indiana
sentence: Many of Indiana's private colleges and universities are affiliated with religious groups.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre Dame University, Mariane University and Saint Francis University are popular Catholic schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Universities affiliated to Protestant denominations include Anderson University, Butler University, Huntington University, Manchester University, Indiana Wesleyan University, Taylor University, Franklin College, Hanover College, DePauw University, Earlham College, Valparaiso University, University of Indianapolis and University of Evansville.

name: indiana
sentence: The government's community college system, Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana, serves nearly 200,000 students per year, making it the largest public post-secondary institution in the state and the largest state-accredited community college system.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2008, the University of Indiana system agreed to transfer most of its associate degrees (2 years) to the Ivy Tech Community College system.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has several universities ranked among the best in the 2013 US News & World Report ranking.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre-Dame University is ranked among the top 20, with Indiana Bloomington University and Purdue University ranked among the top 100.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) has recently been one of the top 200 rankings of the US News & World Report.

name: indiana
sentence: Butler, Valparaiso and the University of Evansville are ranked among the top ten regional rankings of Midwest University.

name: indiana
sentence: Purdue's engineering programs are ranked eighth in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: In addition, Taylor University is ranked first at Midwest Rankings Regional College and the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is considered the best undergraduate engineering school (where a doctorate is not offered) for 15 consecutive years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is a state in the Midwest of the United States, bordered by Mississippi in the east and Missouri and Big Sioux in the west.

name: iowa
sentence: It is bordered by six states: Wisconsin in the northeast, Illinois in the east and southeast, Missouri in the south, Nebraska in the west, South Dakota in the northwest and Minnesota in the north.

name: iowa
sentence: In colonial times, the Iowa was part of French Louisiana and Spanish Louisiana; its state flag was inspired by the flag of France.

name: iowa
sentence: After Louisiana's purchase, people laid the foundation for an agriculture-based economy at the heart of the Corn Belt.

name: iowa
sentence: In the second half of the twentieth century, the agricultural economy of Iowa made the transition to a diversified economy of manufacturing, processing, financial services, information technology, biotechnology and green energy production.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the 26th largest of the total area and the 30th most populated of the 50 American states.

name: iowa
sentence: The capital of the state, the most populated city and the largest metropolitan area entirely within the state is Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Part of the large metropolitan area of Omaha in Nebraska covers three counties in southwestern Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is one of the safest states in the United States to live in.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa derives its name from the Ioway people, one of the many Amerindian nations whose territory included the future state at the time of European colonization.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is bordered by Mississippi to the east and Missouri and Big Sioux to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern limit is a line along 43 degrees, 30 minutes north latitude.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern boundary is the Des Moines River and a line not quite straight along about 40 degrees 35 minutes north, as decided by the U.S. Supreme Court in Missouri v. Iowa (1849) after a judgment between Missouri and Iowa known as the honey war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the only state whose eastern and western borders are formed almost entirely by the rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Carter Lake, Iowa, is the only town in the state west of the Missouri River.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has 99 counties but 100 seats because Lee County has two.

name: iowa
sentence: The State capital, Des Moines, is located in Polk County.

name: iowa
sentence: Geology of Iowa bedrock generally increases from west to east.

name: iowa
sentence: In northwestern Iowa, the Cretaceous bedrock may be 74 million years old; in eastern Iowa, Cambrian bedrock dates back to about 500 million years ago.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is generally not flat

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa can be divided into eight forms of land based on glaciation, soils, topography and drainage of rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: The Loess Hills are located along the western border of the state, some of which are several hundred feet thick.

name: iowa
sentence: The northeastern Iowa along the upper Mississippi River is part of the Drift-free area, composed of steep hills and valleys that seem almost mountainous.

name: iowa
sentence: Several natural lakes exist, including Spirit Lake, Okoboji Lake West and Okoboji Lake East in Northwest Iowa (see Great Lakes of Iowa).

name: iowa
sentence: To the east is Clear Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Artificial lakes include Odessa Lake, Saylorville Lake, Red Rock Lake, Coralville Lake, MacBride Lake and Rathbun Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Prior to the European settlement, 4 to 6 million acres of state land were covered by wetlands, and approximately 95% of these wetlands were drained.

name: iowa
sentence: The natural vegetation of Iowa consists of tall grass and savannah grasslands in the highlands, dense forests and wetlands in floodplains and protected river valleys, and pothole wetlands in the northern prairies.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of Iowa is used for agriculture; crops cover 60 per cent of the state, grasslands (mainly pastures and hay with some grasslands and wetlands) cover 30 per cent and forests account for 7 per cent, urban areas and water account for 1 per cent more each.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern part of Iowa is classified as the ecoregion of transition between forests and central grasslands.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern, drier part of Iowa is part of the high prairies of the centre.

name: iowa
sentence: There is a shortage of natural areas in Iowa; less than 1% of the tall grass prairies that once covered most of Iowa remain intact; only 5% of the wetlands in the state pothole remain, and most of the native forest has been lost.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2005, Iowa ranked 49th among the U.S. states in public land.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered animals in Iowa include the lower inner tern, plover, Indiana bat, pallid sturgeon, Iowa Pleistocene snail, Higgins eye mussel and Topeka sturgeon.

name: iowa
sentence: Endangered or threatened plants include western prairie fringe orchids, eastern prairie fringe orchids, Mead's milkweed, prairie clover and northern wild monks.

name: iowa
sentence: The explosion in the number of high-density farms in Iowa has led to an increase in water contamination in rural areas and a decrease in air quality.

name: iowa
sentence: Other factors that have a negative impact on the Iowa environment include the intensive use of old coal-fired power plants, the application of fertilizers and pesticides from crop production and the reduction of the Jordanian aquifer.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa has a humid continental climate throughout the state (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with extremes of both heat and cold.

name: iowa
sentence: The average annual temperature at Des Moines is 50°F (10°C); for some locations in the north, such as Mason City, the figure is about 45°F (7°C), while for Keokuk, on the Mississippi River, the average is 52°F (11°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Snowfall is common, with Des Moines having about 26 days of snowfall a year, and other places, such as Shenandoah having about 11 days of snowfall a year.

name: iowa
sentence: Spring marks the start of the weather season.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has an average of about 50 days of storm activity per year.

name: iowa
sentence: The annual 30-year average of Tornado in Iowa is 47.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, 12 people were killed by tornadoes in Iowa, making it the most deadly year since 1968 and the second largest tornado in a year with 105, which corresponds to the total of 2001.

name: iowa
sentence: Summers of Iowa are known for heat and humidity, with diurnal temperatures sometimes close to 90°F (32°C) and sometimes above 100°F (38°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Average winters in the state are known to decrease well below freezing, even below -18°F (−28°C).

name: iowa
sentence: The warmest temperature of Iowa at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Keokuk on 20 July 1934 in a nationwide heat wave; the lowest temperature of any time of -47°F (−44°C) was recorded at Washta on 12 January 1912.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a relatively smooth gradient of variable precipitation across the state, with areas in the southeast receiving an average of more than 38 inches (97 cm) of rain per year, and the northwest receiving less than 28 inches (71 cm).

name: iowa
sentence: The precipitation trend across the Iowa is seasonal, with more rain in the summer months.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost at the state level, the driest month is January or February, and the wettest month is June, due to frequent showers and thunderstorms, some of which produce hail, damaging winds and/or tornadoes.

name: iowa
sentence: In Des Moines, about in the center of the state, more than two-thirds of the 34.72-inch (88.2-cm) rain falls from April to September, and about half of the average annual rainfall falls from May to August, reaching a peak in June.

name: iowa
sentence: When the American Indians arrived in what is now the Iowa more than 13,000 years ago, they were hunters and gatherers living in a glacial landscape of the Pleistocene.

name: iowa
sentence: By the time European explorers and traders visited Iowa, American Indians were largely farmers established with complex economic, social and political systems.

name: iowa
sentence: This transformation has gradually occurred.

name: iowa
sentence: During the archaic period (10,500-2,800 years ago), American Indians adapt to local environments and ecosystems, slowly becoming more sedentary as populations increase.

name: iowa
sentence: More than 3,000 years ago, at the end of the archaic period, the American Indians of Iowa began to use domesticated plants.

name: iowa
sentence: In the following period, there was increased dependence on agriculture and social complexity, with increased use of mounds, ceramics and specialized livelihoods.

name: iowa
sentence: During the late prehistoric period (from about 900 AD), increased use of corn and social changes led to flourishing and nucleated social institutions.

name: iowa
sentence: The arrival of European goods and diseases in the protohistoric period led to dramatic demographic changes and economic and social upheavals, with the arrival of new tribes and the first European explorers and traders.

name: iowa
sentence: There were many Indian tribes who lived in Iowa at the beginning of European exploration.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that were probably descendants of prehistoric Oneota include Dakota, Ho-Chunk, Ioway and Otoe.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that arrived in Iowa at the end of prehistoric or protohistoric periods include the Illiniwek, Meskwaki, Omaha and Sauk.

name: iowa
sentence: The first European explorers known to document Iowa were Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet who traveled the Mississippi River in 1673 and documented several indigenous villages on the Iowa side.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa region is claimed for France and remains a French territory until 1763.

name: iowa
sentence: The French, before their imminent defeat in the French and Indian war, transferred ownership to their ally, Spain.

name: iowa
sentence: Spain exercised a very loose control over the Iowa region, granting trade licences to French and British traders, who established trading posts along the Mississippi and the Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was part of a territory known as Louisiana or Louisiana, and European traders were interested in lead and fur obtained by Aboriginal peoples.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki effectively controlled the Mississippi trade in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

name: iowa
sentence: Among the first dealers in Mississippi were Julien Dubuque, Robert de la Salle and Paul Marin.

name: iowa
sentence: Along the Missouri River, at least five French and English trading houses were built prior to 1808.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1800 Napoleon Bonaparte took control of Louisiana in a treaty.

name: iowa
sentence: After the purchase of Louisiana in 1803, Congress divided the purchase of Louisiana into two parts: the territory of Orleans and the district of Louisiana, the present Iowa falling into the latter.

name: iowa
sentence: Indiana was established in 1800 to exercise jurisdiction over that part of the district.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of the Iowa was mapped by Zebulon Pike in 1805, but it was only after Fort Madison was built in 1808 that the United States established tenuous military control over the area.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was built to control the trade and establish American domination over the Upper Mississippi, but it was misconceived and hostile by the Sauk and Fox, many of whom were allies with the British, who had not abandoned the claims on the territory.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was defeated by the British-backed Natives in 1813 during the War of 1812, and Fort Shelby in the Prairie of the Dog in Wisconsin also fell into British hands.

name: iowa
sentence: Black Hawk participated in the siege of Fort Madison.

name: iowa
sentence: Another small military outpost was established along the Mississippi River in the present Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: This poorly located stockade was also attacked by hundreds of Aboriginal people in 1813, but was successfully defended and later abandoned until the settlers returned to the area in the mid-1830s.

name: iowa
sentence: After the war, the United States restored control of the area by building Fort Armstrong, Fort Snelling in Minnesota, and Fort Atkinson in Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: The United States encouraged the colonization of the eastern part of Mississippi and the abduction of Indians to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: A disputed treaty of 1804 between Quashquame and William Henry Harrison, which ceded much of Illinois to the United States, enraged many Sauk and led to the Black Hawk War of 1832.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki sold their land in the Mississippi Valley in 1832 in the purchase of Black Hawk and sold their remaining land in Iowa in 1842, most of which settled in a reserve in Kansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Meskwaki later returned to Iowa and settled near Tama, Iowa; the Meskwaki settlement remains to this day.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1856, the Iowa Legislature passed an unprecedented law allowing Meskawki to buy land.

name: iowa
sentence: However, contrary to the unprecedented act of the Iowa Legislature, the United States federal government, through the use of treaties, forced the Ho-Chunk of Iowa in 1848 and the Dakota of Iowa in 1858.

name: iowa
sentence: The Western Iowa around Bluffs of the Modern Council was used as an Indian reserve for the members of the Council of Three Fires.

name: iowa
sentence: The first American settlers officially moved to Iowa in June 1833.

name: iowa
sentence: Mainly, they were families from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Indiana, Kentucky, and Virginia who settled along the western shores of Mississippi and founded the modern cities of Dubuque and Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: On July 4, 1838, the U.S. Congress established the territory of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: President Martin Van Buren appointed Robert Lucas as Governor of the Territory, which at the time had 22 counties and a population of 23,242.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost immediately after obtaining territorial status, there was a cry for state status.

name: iowa
sentence: On 28 December 1846, Iowa became the 29th State of the Union when President James K. Polk signed the Iowa Admission Bill.

name: iowa
sentence: Once admitted to the Union, the State's border problems solved, and most of its land purchased from indigenous people, Iowa gave its direction to development and organized campaigns for settlers and investors, boasting the rich agricultural land of the young border state, good citizens, free and open society, and good government.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a long tradition of state and county fairs.

name: iowa
sentence: The first and second fairs in the State of Iowa took place in the more developed eastern part of the State in Fairfield.

name: iowa
sentence: The first fair took place on October 25 and 27, 1854, at a cost of approximately $323.

name: iowa
sentence: Subsequently, the fair moved to places closer to the centre of the state and, in 1886, found a permanent home in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Since then, the State Fair has been held every year, except for a few exceptions: 1898 due to the war between Spain and America and the World Fair held in Omaha, Nebraska, nearby; 1942 to 1945 due to the Second World War, because the fairs were used as a supply depot for the army; and 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa supported the Union during the civil war, voting strongly for Abraham Lincoln, although there was an anti-war movement "Copperhead" in the state, caused in part by a fall in crop prices caused by the war.

name: iowa
sentence: There were no battles in the state, although the Battle of Athens, the Missouri, 1861, was fought just opposite the River Des Moines of Croton, the Iowa, and the fire of the battle landed in the Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa sent large reserves of food to the armies and eastern cities.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa's support for the Union can be attributed to Samuel J. Kirkwood, his first governor in time of war.

name: iowa
sentence: Out of a total population of 675,000, approximately 116,000 men have been subjected to military functions.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa contributed proportionally more men to the military service of the civil war than any other state, north or south, sending more than 75,000 volunteers to the armed forces, more than a sixth of whom were killed before the Confederates went to Appomattox.

name: iowa
sentence: Most fought in the large countryside in the Mississippi Valley and in the south.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa troops fought at Wilson's Creek in Missouri, Pea Ridge in Arkansas, Forts Henry and Donelson, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Chickamauga, Missionary Ridge and Rossville Gap, and Vicksburg, Iuka and Corinth.

name: iowa
sentence: They served with the Potomac Army in Virginia and fought under Union General Philip Sheridan in the Shenandoah Valley.

name: iowa
sentence: Many died and were buried at Andersonville.

name: iowa
sentence: They walked on General Nathaniel Banks' reckless expedition to Red River.

name: iowa
sentence: Twenty-seven Iowans received the Medal of Honour, the highest military decoration awarded by the U.S. government, which was first awarded in the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has several Brigadier Generals and four main generals: Grenville Mellen Dodge, Samuel R. Curtis, Francis J. Herron and Frederick Steele.

name: iowa
sentence: After the civil war, the population of Iowa continued to grow considerably, from 674,913 in 1860 to 1,624,615 in 1880.

name: iowa
sentence: The American Civil War briefly brought higher benefits.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1917, the United States entered World War I and farmers, as well as all the Iowans, had an economy in time of war.

name: iowa
sentence: For farmers, the change was significant.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the beginning of the war in 1914, the farmers in Iowa have enjoyed economic prosperity, which lasted until the end of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: In the economic sector, Iowa has also undergone significant changes.

name: iowa
sentence: Starting from the first industries developed in the 1830s, mainly for the processing of cultivated materials in the region, Iowa experienced a gradual increase in the number of enterprises and manufacturing activities.

name: iowa
sentence: The transition from an agricultural economy to a mixed economy has been slow.

name: iowa
sentence: The Great Depression and the Second World War accelerated the shift from small-scale agriculture to larger farms, and began a trend towards urbanization.

sentence: The Iowa population is more urban than rural, with 61 per cent living in urban areas in 2000, a trend that began in the early twentieth century.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa is often considered an agricultural state, agriculture is a relatively small part of the diversified economy of the state, with manufacturing, biotechnology, financial and insurance services and government services contributing substantially to the Iowa economy.

name: iowa
sentence: This economic diversity has helped Iowa to better overcome the recession of the late 2000s than most states, with unemployment well below that of the rest of the nation.

name: iowa
sentence: Manufacturing is the largest sector in the Iowa economy, accounting for $20.8 billion (21 per cent) of Iowa's gross national product in 2003.

name: iowa
sentence: Although on an industrial scale, commodity farming predominates in much of the state, Iowa has grown in the organic sector.

sentence: In Iowa, the term "political party" refers to political organizations that obtained at least two per cent of the votes cast for the President or Governor in the "last previous general election."

sentence: The Iowa recognizes three political parties: the Republican Party, the Democratic Party and the libertarian Party.

sentence: The state receives considerable attention every four years because the Iowa caucus, a gathering of voters to select delegates to state conventions, is the country's first presidential caucus.

sentence: In the nineteenth century, Iowa was one of the first States to enact prohibitions against racial discrimination, particularly in the field of education, but it was slow to achieve full integration in the twentieth century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court — in Re the Matter of Ralph, in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state removed racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the U.S. Supreme Court banned deception laws throughout the country.

name: iowa
sentence: The Supreme Court of Iowa ruled on Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Education Council.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of other judicial decisions effectively ended segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against blacks in state universities until the 1950s.

name: kansas
sentence: It is often said that the name of the tribe (naturally kko:ze) means "people of the wind (south)" although this was probably not the original meaning of the term.

name: kansas
sentence: For thousands of years what is now Kansas was home to many and various Amerindian tribes.

name: kansas
sentence: The pace of colonization accelerated in the 1850s, in the middle of political wars over the debate on slavery.

name: kansas
sentence: When it was officially opened to colonization by the American government in 1854 with the Kansas-Nebraska Act, free-state abolitionists from New England and pro-slavery settlers from nearby Missouri rushed to the territory to determine whether Kansas would become a free state or a slave state.

name: kansas
sentence: Thus, the area was a home of violence and chaos in its early days as these forces clashed, and was known as Bleeding Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: The abolitionists prevailed, and on 29 January 1861 Kansas entered the Union as a free State, hence the unofficial nickname "The Free State".

name: kansas
sentence: In 2015, Kansas was one of the most productive agricultural states, producing high yields of wheat, maize, sorghum and soybeans.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas, which has an area of 82,278 square miles (213,100 square kilometers) is the 15th state per zone and is the 34th most populated of the 50 states with a population of 2,913,314 inhabitants.

name: kansas
sentence: Kansas residents are called Kansans.

name: kansas
sentence: Mount Sunflower is the highest point in Kansas at 4,039 feet (1,231 metres).

sentence: Before European colonization, Kansas was occupied by the Caddoan Wichita, then by the Siuan Kaw people.

name: kansas
sentence: The first European to set foot in the current Kansas was the Spanish conquistador Francisco Vázquez de Coronado, who explored the area in 1541.

name: kansas
sentence: Governor Luis de Unzaga 'the conciliator', during this period, promoted expeditions and good relations with the Amerindian peoples, among the explorers were Antoine de Marigny and others who continued to trade through the Kansas River, particularly at its confluence with the Missouri River, tributaries of the Mississippi River.

name: kansas
sentence: In 1803 most modern Kansas were acquired by the United States as part of Louisiana's purchase.

sentence: The Santa Fe Trail crossed Kansas from 1821 to 1880, carrying manufactured goods from Missouri and silver and fur from Santa Fe, New Mexico.

sentence: In 1827 Fort Leavenworth became the first permanent settlement of white Americans in the future state.

sentence: The Kansas–Nebraska Act entered into force on May 30, 1854, creating the territory of Nebraska and Kansas, and opening the area to a wider settlement by whites.

name: kansas
sentence: The territory of Kansas extended to continental division and included the current sites of Denver, Colorado Springs and Pueblo.

sentence: Missouri and Arkansas sent settlers to Kansas throughout its eastern border.

sentence: The secondary colony of Americans in Kansas territory were abolitionists of Massachusetts and other free-staters, who tried to prevent the spread of slavery in neighbouring Missouri.

sentence: The land rises gradually from east to west, with elevations ranging from 684 feet (208 m) along the Verdigris River at Coffeyville, Montgomery County, to 4,039 feet (1,231 m) at Sunflower Mountain, 0.5 miles (0.80 km) from Colorado Border, Wallace County.

sentence: According to the climate classification of Köppen, the climate of Kansas can be characterized in three types: it has a wet, semi-arid and subtropical continental steppe.

name: kansas
sentence: Two thirds of the state (especially the northeastern part) has a damp continental climate, with cold winters and warm, often humid summers.

name: kansas
sentence: Most precipitation falls both in summer and spring.

name: kansas
sentence: The western third of the state – from the U.S. Highway 83 corridor westward – has a semi-arid steppe climate.

name: kansas
sentence: Summers are hot, often very hot, and generally less humid.

name: kansas
sentence: Winters are very variable between hot and cold.

name: kansas
sentence: The western region receives an average of 16 inches (410 millimetres) of precipitation per year.

name: kansas
sentence: Chinook winds in winter can heat western Kansas up to 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27 degrees Celsius).

name: kansas
sentence: The south-central and south-eastern parts of the state, including the Wichita region, have a humid subtropical climate with warm and humid summers, milder winters and more precipitation than elsewhere in Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: Some of the characteristics of the three climates are found in most of the state, with droughts and a changing time between dry and wet not uncommon, and both hot and cold spells in winter.

sentence: Nearly 90% of Kansas' land is devoted to agriculture.

sentence: The state's agricultural production is cattle, sheep, wheat, sorghum, soybeans, cotton, pigs, maize and salt.

sentence: In 2018, there were 59,600 farms in Kansas, 86 (0.14%) of which were certified organic farms.

sentence: Recent price increases have made sequestration of carbon dioxide and other oil recovery techniques more cost-effective.

sentence: In 2003, Kansas had three income bands for income tax purposes, ranging from 3.5 per cent to 6.45%.

sentence: The sales tax in Kansas is 6.15%.

sentence: With the exception of the 2001 recession (March-November 2001), where monthly sales tax revenues were stable, revenues increased as the economy grew and two rate increases were adopted.

sentence: Had there been no change in sales tax rates or in the economy, total sales tax collection for 2003 would have been $1,797 million, compared to $805.3 million in 1990.

name: kansas
sentence: However, they amounted to $1,630 million, a 10 per cent adjusted reduction in inflation.

name: kansas
sentence: The State sales tax is a combined tax based on destination, which means that a single tax is applied which includes taxes from the State, counties and municipalities, and the rate is based on the place where the consumer takes possession of the goods or services.

name: kansas
sentence: Thanks to the destination structure and numerous local tax districts, Kansas has 920 separate sales tax rates ranging from 6.5% to 11.5%.

name: kansas
sentence: This tax regime, known as "restricted sales tax", was adopted on October 1, 2005, under the direction of Kathleen Sebelius.

name: kansas
sentence: Groceries are subject to sales tax in the State.

sentence: All sales taxes collected are handed over to the State Revenue Department, and local taxes are then distributed to the various taxing bodies.

name: kansas
sentence: In June 2004, Moody's Investors Service ranked 14th for per capita net tax debt.

sentence: As a percentage of personal income, it stood at 3.8 per cent, above the median value of 2.5 per cent for all rated States and increased from less than 1 per cent in 1992.

name: kansas
sentence: In his campaign for the 2010 election, Governor Sam Brownback called for a "full phase of withdrawal of Kansas' income tax."

name: kansas
sentence: In May 2012, Governor Brownback signed the Kansas Senatorte Substitute HB 2117 bill.

name: kansas
sentence: Beginning in 2013, the "ambitious tax review" reduced income tax, eliminated certain corporate taxes and created income tax exemptions, and increased sales tax by 1%.

name: kansas
sentence: It has made cuts in education and some government services to offset income losses.

name: kansas
sentence: This tax reduction resulted in years of budget deficits, resulting in a budget deficit of $350 million in February 2017.

name: kansas
sentence: Between 2013 and 2017, 300,000 businesses were considered income-transmitted entities and benefited from the tax exemption.

name: kansas
sentence: Tax reform "encouraged tens of thousands of Kansans to claim their wages and salaries as income from a business rather than a job."

name: kansas
sentence: Brownback's projected economic growth has never materialized.

name: kansas
sentence: He argued that this was due to "low wheat and oil prices and a slowdown in aircraft sales."

name: kansas
sentence: The public debt burden was $83 million in fiscal year 2010 and the debt burden in 2017 was $179 million.

sentence: In 2016, Governor Brownback received the title of "most unpopular governor in America."

sentence: Only 26 percent of Kansas voters approved his job performance, compared to 65 percent who said they did not.

sentence: In summer 2016, S & P Global Ratings downgraded Kansas' credit rating.

sentence: In February 2017, a bipartite coalition introduced a bill that would repeal the transmitted income exemption, the "most important provisions of Brownback's overhaul," and increase taxes to fill the budget deficit.

name: kansas
sentence: Brownback vetoed the bill, but "45 GOP legislators voted in favour of the increase, while 40 voted in favour of maintaining the governor's veto."

name: kansas
sentence: On June 6, 2017, a coalition of newly elected Democrats and Republicans overcame the veto of [Brownback] and implemented tax increases at a level close to what it was before 2013.

sentence: Brownback's tax review was described in a June 2017 article in The Atlantic as the most aggressive U.S. experience with conservative economic policy.

sentence: Draconian tax cuts had "damaged the viability of schools and infrastructure" in Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: The Kansas is served by two Interstate highways with a belt, two spur lanes and three bypasses, with more than 874 miles (1,407 km) in total.

sentence: The first section of the Interstate in the Nation was opened on Interstate 70 (I-70) just west of Topeka on November 14, 1956.

sentence: I-70 is a major east-west road connecting Denver, Colorado and Kansas City, Missouri.

name: kansas
sentence: Cities along this route (from west to east) include Colby, Hays, Salina, Junction City, Topeka, Lawrence, Bonner Springs and Kansas City.

name: kansas
sentence: I-35 is an important north-south road linking Oklahoma City, Oklahoma and Des Moines, Iowa.

sentence: Cities along this road (south to north) include Wichita, El Dorado, Emporia, Ottawa and Kansas City (and suburbs).

name: kansas
sentence: The roads in the spur serve as links between the two main roads.

sentence: I-335, a south-west-northeast route, connects I-35 to Emporia to I-70 to Topeka.

name: kansas

name: kansas
sentence: The bypasses include the I-470 around Topeka, the I-235 around Wichita, and the I-670 in downtown Kansas City.

name: kansas

sentence: This is due to the large number of counties and county seats (105) and their interrelation.

sentence: Executive branch: The executive branch consists of one leader and five elected officials.

name: kansas
sentence: Legislative power: The bicameral legislature of Kansas consists of the House of Representatives of Kansas, which has 125 members for a two-year term, and the Senate of Kansas, which has 40 members for a four-year term.

name: kansas
sentence: Judiciary: The judiciary of the state government is run by the Supreme Court of Kansas.

name: kansas

name: kansas
sentence: The Board of Directors consists of five Kansas lawyers elected by other Kansas lawyers and four members chosen by the Governor.

name: kansas
sentence: Since the mid-20th century, Kansas has remained one of the nation's most conservative states.

sentence: The 1990s led to the defeat of prominent democrats, including Dan Glickman, and the decision of the Kansas State Board of Education in 1999 to eliminate the evolution of state education standards, which was then reversed.

sentence: In 2005, voters accepted a constitutional amendment prohibiting same-sex marriage.

sentence: The following year, the State adopted a law setting the minimum age for marriage at 15.
