name: texas
sentence: The internationally known slogan "Don't Mess with Texas" began as an anti-landing ad.

name: texas
sentence: Since the campaign began in 1986, the term has become "a declaration of identity, a declaration of Texas Swagger".

name: texas
sentence: "Texas-size" is an expression that can be used in two ways: to describe something that is about the size of the American state of Texas, or to describe something (usually but not always from Texas) that is large compared to other objects of its type.

name: texas
sentence: Texas was the largest U.S. state until Alaska became a state in 1959.

name: texas
sentence: "Everything is bigger in Texas" has been used regularly since at least 1950; it was used in 1913.

name: texas
sentence: Houston is one of five American cities with permanent professional resident companies in all major performing arts disciplines: the Houston Grand Opera, the Houston Symphony Orchestra, the Houston Ballet and the Alley Theatre.

name: texas
sentence: Known for the liveliness of its visual and performing arts, the Houston Theater District, a 17-block neighbourhood in the heart of downtown Houston, is second in the country in the number of theatre seats in a concentrated city centre, with 12,948 seats for live shows and 1,480 cinema seats.

name: texas
sentence: Founded in 1892, the Fort Worth Museum of Modern Art is Texas's oldest art museum.

name: texas
sentence: Fort Worth also has the Kimbell Art Museum, the Amon Carter Museum, the National Cowgirl Museum and the Hall of Fame, the Will Rogers Memorial Center and the Downtown Bass Performance Hall.

name: texas
sentence: The art district of downtown Dallas is home to artistic venues such as the Dallas Art Museum, the Morton H. Meyerson Symphony Centre, Margot Opera and Bill Winspear, the Trammell & Margaret Crow Asian Art Collection, and the Nasher Sculpture Centre.

name: texas
sentence: Deep Ellum neighbourhood within Dallas became popular in the 1920s and 1930s as the first jazz and hotspot blues in the southern United States.

name: texas
sentence: The name Deep Ellum comes from the local people who pronounce "Deep Elm" as "Deep Ellum".

name: texas
sentence: Artists such as Blind Lemon Jefferson, Robert Johnson, Huddie "Lead Belly" Ledbetter and Bessie Smith play in Deep Ellum clubs.

name: texas
sentence: Austin, The Live Music Capital of the World, has "more live music venues per capita than music centers such as Nashville, Memphis, Los Angeles, Las Vegas or New York City."

name: texas
sentence: The city's music revolves around nightclubs on 6th Street; events such as film, music and South by Southwest multimedia festival; the longest concert music program on American television, Austin City Limits; and the Austin City Limits Music Festival held at Zilker Park.

name: texas
sentence: Since 1980, San Antonio has become "the capital of the world's Tejano music."

name: texas
sentence: The Tejano Music Awards provided a forum to increase awareness and appreciation of Tejano's music and culture.

name: texas
sentence: The second president of the Republic of Texas, Mirabeau B. Lamar, is the father of Texas education.

name: texas
sentence: During its term of office, the State set aside three land leagues in each county to equip public schools.

name: texas
sentence: Later, 50 additional leagues of land reserved to support two universities will become the basis of the Permanent University Fund of the State.

name: texas
sentence: Lamar's actions laid the foundations for a Texas-wide public school system.

name: texas
sentence: Between 2006 and 2007, Texas spent $7,275 per student, which puts it below the national average of $9,389.

name: texas
sentence: The pupil-teacher ratio was 14.9 below the national average of 15.3.

name: texas
sentence: Texas instructors paid $41,744 less than the national average of $46,593.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) administers the state's public education systems.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has more than 1,000 school districts; all districts, with the exception of the Stafford Municipal School District, are independent of the municipal administration and many cross the city boundaries.

name: texas
sentence: School districts have the power to impose taxes on their residents and to assert a prominent domain over private property.

name: texas
sentence: Due to the fair financing of schools by the courts for school districts, the State has a controversial tax redistribution system called the Robin Hood Plan.

name: texas
sentence: This plan transfers property tax revenues from the rich school districts to the poor.

name: texas
sentence: The AME has no authority over private or home-based activities.

name: texas
sentence: Texas students take the state of Texas Academic Readiness Assessments (ESTAR) in primary and secondary school.

name: texas
sentence: STAAR assesses students' achievements in reading, writing, mathematics, science and social studies required by the Texas Education Standards and the No Child Left Behind Act.

name: texas
sentence: The test replaced the Texas Assessment of Knowledge and Skills (TAKS) test during the 2011-2012 school year.

name: texas
sentence: Generally prohibited in the West in general, corporal punishment in schools is not unusual in the more conservative rural areas of the state, with 28,569 students in public schools paddling at least once, according to government data for the 2011-2012 school year.

name: texas
sentence: The school corporal punishment rate in Texas is exceeded only by Mississippi, Alabama and Arkansas.

name: texas
sentence: The two most recognized leading universities in the state are the University of Texas in Austin and the University of A&M in Texas, ranked 21st and 41st best universities in the country according to the latest 2020 report of the Centre for World University Rankings, respectively.

name: texas
sentence: Some observers also include the University of Houston and the Technical University of Texas as first-level florets alongside UT Austin and the A&M.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Higher Education Coordination Council classifies state public universities into three distinct levels:

name: texas
sentence: Texas's Bill 588, another controversial positive plan of action in Texas, guarantees Texas students who have graduated in the 10 per cent of their high school class the automatic admission to state-funded universities.

name: texas
sentence: The bill encourages demographic diversity while trying to avoid problems arising from the Hopwood v. Texas case (1996).

name: texas
sentence: Thirty-six (36) separate public universities exist in Texas, 32 of which belong to one of the six academic systems of the state.

name: texas
sentence: The discovery of minerals on the lands of the Permanent University Fund, particularly oil, has contributed to the rapid growth of the two largest university systems in the state: the University of Texas system and the Texas A&M system.

name: texas
sentence: The other four academic systems: the University of Houston system, the University of Northern Texas system, the State of Texas system, and the Texas technical system are not funded by the Permanent University Fund.

name: texas
sentence: The Carnegie Foundation ranks four universities in Texas as first-level research institutions: the University of Texas in Austin, the University of A&M in Texas, the University of Houston and the Technical University of Texas.

name: texas
sentence: The University of Texas at Austin and the University of A&M in Texas are the leading universities of the University of Texas System and Texas A&M University System, respectively.

name: texas
sentence: Both were established by the Texas Constitution and hold interests in the Permanent University Fund.

name: texas
sentence: The state has sought to increase the number of flagship universities by raising some of its seven institutions designated as "emerging research universities".

name: texas
sentence: The two that should emerge first are the University of Houston and the Technical University of Texas, probably in this order from the discussions on the floor of the 82nd Texas Legislature.

name: texas
sentence: The state is home to a variety of private institutions of higher education, ranging from liberal arts colleges to a nationally recognized research university.

name: texas
sentence: Rice University in Houston is one of the largest universities of teaching and research in the United States and ranked 17th best university in the country by US News & World Report.

name: texas
sentence: Trinity University, a private university, mainly undergraduate in liberal arts in San Antonio, ranked first among universities with Bachelor's and Master's degrees in the Western United States for 20 consecutive years by US News.

name: texas
sentence: Private universities include Abilene Christian University, Austin College, Baylor University, Mary Hardin–Baylor University and Southwest University.

name: texas
sentence: Texas universities host three presidential libraries: the George Bush Presidential Library at A&M University of Texas, the Lyndon Baines Johnson Library and Museum at the University of Texas at Austin, and the George W. Bush Presidential Library at the South Methodist University.

name: texas
sentence: Despite the concentration of elite medical centres in the state, the Commonwealth Fund ranks Texas's health care system third among the worst in the country.

name: texas
sentence: Texas ranks close to the last in terms of access to health care, quality of care, avoidable hospital expenses and equity among different groups.

name: texas
sentence: The causes of the state's poor rankings include politics, high poverty and the highest rate of illegal immigration to the nation.

name: texas
sentence: In May 2006, Texas launched the "red code" program in response to the report, with the state having 25.1 per cent of the population without health insurance, the largest proportion in the country.

name: texas
sentence: The Trust for America's Health ranked Texas 15th in terms of adult obesity, with 27.2 per cent of the state population being obese.

name: texas
sentence: The 2008 survey on obesity among men ranked four cities in Texas among the 25 fattest cities in America; Houston ranked 6th, Dallas 7th, El Paso 8th and Arlington 14th.

name: texas
sentence: Texas had only one city (Austin, 21st) in the top 25 among America's "most interesting cities".

name: texas
sentence: The same survey positively assessed the state's obesity initiatives with a "B+".

name: texas
sentence: The State ranks forty-second in the percentage of residents engaged in regular exercise according to a 2007 study.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has the highest maternal mortality rate in the developed world, and the death rate of Texas women due to pregnancy-related complications doubled between 2010 and 2014, reaching 23.8 per 100,000.

name: texas
sentence: An unmatched rate in any other U.S. state or economically developed country.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has many elite medical research centres.

name: texas
sentence: There are nine medical schools, three dental schools and two optometry schools in the State.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has two Biosecurity Level 4 (BSL-4) laboratories: one at the University of Texas Medical Branch (UTMB) in Galveston, and the other at the Southwest Foundation for Biomedical Research in San Antonio, BSL-4's first private laboratory in the United States.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Medical Center in Houston holds the world's largest concentration of research and health care facilities, with 47 member institutions.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Medical Center performs the largest number of heart transplants in the world.

name: texas
sentence: The University of Texas Cancer Centre M.D. Anderson in Houston is a well-known academic institution focused on cancer patient care, research, education and prevention.

name: texas
sentence: The institutions at the South Texas Medical Center in San Antonio rank sixth in the impact of clinical medicine research in the United States.

name: texas
sentence: The University of Texas Health Sciences Centre is another highly ranked research and education institution in San Antonio.

name: texas
sentence: The American Heart Association and the University of Texas's Southwest Medical Centre call Dallas home.

name: texas
sentence: The institution's medical school employs the largest Nobel-winning medical school in the world.

name: texas
sentence: Texans have historically had difficulties crossing Texas due to the large size and rugged terrain of the state.

name: texas
sentence: Texas compensated for the construction of America's largest road and rail networks.

name: texas
sentence: The regulatory authority, the Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT), maintains the state's vast road network, regulates aviation and public transportation systems.

name: texas
sentence: The state is an important transport hub.

name: texas
sentence: From the Dallas/Fort Worth region, trucks can reach 93 percent of the country's population in 48 hours and 37 percent in 24 hours.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has 33 foreign trade zones (FTZs), the nation's most important.

name: texas
sentence: In 2004, a combined total of $298 billion in goods transited through Texas ZFTs.

name: texas
sentence: The first highway in Texas was the Gulf Motorway opened in 1948 in Houston.

name: texas
sentence: In 2005, 79,535 miles (127,999 km) of public road crossed Texas (up from 71,000 miles (114,263 km) in 1984).

name: texas
sentence: To finance the recent growth of state highways, Texas has 17 toll roads (see list) with several additional toll routes proposed.

name: texas
sentence: In central Texas, the southern portion of the State Highway 130 toll road has a speed limit of 85 miles per hour (137 km/h), the highest in the country.

name: texas
sentence: All of Texas's federal and state roads are paved.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has 730 airports, the second largest of all the country's states.

name: texas
sentence: Larger in Texas by size and passengers served, the Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) is the second largest per region in the United States, and the fourth largest in the world with 18,076 acres (73.15 km2).

name: texas
sentence: In traffic, the DFW airport is the busiest in the state, the fourth busiest in the United States, and the sixth busiest in the world.

name: texas
sentence: American Airlines Group, the American / American Eagle, the world's largest airline with total passenger miles transported and the size of the passenger fleet, uses DFW as its largest and largest hub.

name: texas
sentence: It ranks as the largest airline in the United States by the number of passengers transported to the country a year and the largest airline in the world by the number of passengers transported.Southwest Airlines, headquartered in Dallas, operates in Dallas Love Field.

name: texas
sentence: Texas's second air installation is Houston Intercontinental George Bush Airport (IAH).

name: texas
sentence: It served as the largest hub for the former Continental Airlines, which was based in Houston; it serves as the largest hub for United Airlines, the world's third largest airline, per passenger mile.

name: texas
sentence: The IAH offers service to the most Mexican destinations of any American airport.

name: texas
sentence: The other five largest airports in the state serve more than three million passengers a year: Austin-Bergstrom International Airport, William P. Hobby Airport, San Antonio International Airport, Dallas Love Field and El Paso International Airport.

name: texas
sentence: The smallest airport in the state to be designated as an international airport is the Del Rio International Airport.

name: texas
sentence: Approximately 1,150 seaports point the coast of Texas with over 1,600 kilometres of canals.

name: texas
sentence: Ports employ nearly one million people and process an average of 317 million metric tonnes.

name: texas
sentence: Texas ports connect to the rest of the American Atlantic coast with the Gulf section of the Intracoastal Waterway.

name: texas
sentence: The port of Houston is now the busiest port in the United States in foreign tonnage, the second in global tonnage and the tenth in the world in tonnage.

name: texas
sentence: The Houston Canal extends 160 metres wide by 14 metres deep over 80 kilometres long.

name: texas
sentence: Part of the state's cowboy tradition is derived from the large livestock campaigns its herders organized in the 19th century to drive cattle to the railways and markets of Kansas, for the expedition to the East.

name: texas
sentence: Cities along the way, such as Baxter Springs, Kansas' first cow town, have developed to take care of seasonal workers and tens of thousands of cattle.

name: texas
sentence: The first railway to operate in Texas was the Buffalo Bayou, Brazos and Colorado Railway, which opened in August 1853.

name: texas
sentence: The first railway to enter Texas from the north, completed in 1872, is the Missouri–Kansas–Texas railway.

name: texas
sentence: With increased access to the railway, the ranchers did not have to take their cattle to the Midwest and shipped beef from Texas.

name: texas
sentence: This has led to a decline in the economy of cows' towns.

name: texas
sentence: Since 1911, Texas has led the nation for miles of railway within the state.

name: texas
sentence: The length of the Texas Railway peaked in 1932 at 17,078 miles (27,484 km), but declined to 14,006 miles (35,540 km) in 2000.

name: texas
sentence: While the Texas Railway Commission initially regulated the state railways, in 2005 the state reallocated these functions to TxDOT.

name: texas
sentence: In the Dallas–Fort Worth area, three public transit agencies provide rail services: Dallas Area Rapid Transit (DART), Denton County Transportation Authority (DCTA) and Trinity Metro.

name: texas
sentence: DART started operating the first light rail system in the southwestern United States in 1996.

name: texas
sentence: Trinity Railway Express (TRE), which connects Fort Worth and Dallas, is provided by Trinity Metro and DART.

name: texas
sentence: Trinity Metro also operates the TEXRail suburban railway line, linking downtown Fort Worth and Northeast Tarrant County to DFW Airport.

name: texas
sentence: The commuter A train line, operated by DCTA, serves as an extension of the DART Green line in Denton County.

name: texas
sentence: In the Austin area, the Capital Metropolitan Transportation Authority operates a suburban railway service called Capital MetroRail to the northwest suburbs.

name: texas
sentence: The Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County, Texas (METRO) operates light railway lines in the Houston area.

name: texas
sentence: Amtrak provides Texas with a limited long distance rail service.

name: texas
sentence: Three regular routes serve the state: the Texas Eagle daily (Chicago–San Antonio); the Triweekly Sunset Limited (New Orleans–Los Angeles), with stops in Texas; and the Heartland Flyer (Fort Worth–Oklahoma City).

name: texas
sentence: Texas could have one of the first high-speed railway lines in the country.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Central Railway Company is planning to build a privately financed high-speed line between Dallas and Houston.

name: texas
sentence: The present Texas Constitution was adopted in 1876.

name: texas
sentence: Like many States, it explicitly provides for the separation of powers.

name: texas
sentence: The State Bill of Rights is much larger than its federal bill of rights and contains Texas-specific provisions.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has a plural executive power that limits the power of the governor, which is a weak executive power compared to other states.

name: texas
sentence: With the exception of the Secretary of State, voters elect leaders independently, so candidates are directly accountable to the public, not the Governor.

name: texas
sentence: This electoral system has resulted in the division of certain executive powers between the parties and has reduced the governor's ability to carry out a programme.

name: texas
sentence: When Republican President George W. Bush was Governor of Texas, the state had a democratic lieutenant governor, Bob Bullock.

name: texas
sentence: The Executive is composed of the Governor, the Lieutenant Governor, the Comptroller of Public Accounts, the Land Commissioner, the Attorney General, the Commissioner of Agriculture, the Texas Railway Commission, the Council of State for Education and the Secretary of State.

name: texas
sentence: Texas's bicameral Parliament consists of the House of Representatives, with 150 members, and a senator, with 31 members.

name: texas
sentence: The Speaker of the House presides over the House and the Lieutenant Governor, the Senator.

name: texas
sentence: The legislature meets in ordinary session every two years for just over a hundred days, but the governor can request special sessions as often as desired (notably, the legislature cannot meet itself).

name: texas
sentence: The State's fiscal year begins on 1 September.

name: texas
sentence: Texas's judiciary is one of the most complex in the United States, with many layers and overlapping jurisdictions.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has two courts of last resort: the Texas Supreme Court, for civil matters, and the Texas Criminal Court of Appeal.

name: texas
sentence: With the exception of certain municipal benches, partisan elections select judges at all levels of the judiciary; the governor fills vacancies by appointment.

name: texas
sentence: Texas is remarkable for its use of capital punishment, having led the country to executions since the death penalty was reinstated in Gregg v. Georgia (see capital punishment in Texas).

name: texas
sentence: Texas Ranger Division of the Texas Department of Public Safety is a government-wide law enforcement agency.

name: texas
sentence: Over the years, Texas Rangers have investigated crimes ranging from murder to political corruption.

name: texas
sentence: They acted as riot police and inspectors, protected the governor of Texas, hunted fugitives and acted as a paramilitary force for both the republic and the state.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Rangers were created informally by Stephen F. Austin in 1823 and formally formed in 1835.

name: texas
sentence: The Rangers were an integral part of several important events in the history of Texas and some of the most well-known criminal cases in Old West history.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Constitution defines the responsibilities of county governments, which serve as agents of the state.

name: texas
sentence: The so-called Court Commissioners and Court Judges are elected to serve as an administrative body.

name: texas
sentence: Most of the State's cities, those with more than 5,000 inhabitants, have autonomous governments.

name: texas
sentence: The vast majority of them have charters for the forms of council-managerial government, by which voters elect the members of the council, who hire a director of a professional city as an operating officer.

name: texas
sentence: In the 1870s, the White Democrats removed power from the biracial coalition at the end of the reconstruction.

name: texas
sentence: At the beginning of the twentieth century, Parliament passed bills to impose voting taxes, followed by white primaries; these measures effectively deprived most blacks, poor whites and Mexican Americans of their rights.

name: texas
sentence: In the 1890s, 100,000 blacks voted in the state; in 1906, only 5,000 could vote.

name: texas
sentence: As a result, the Democratic Party had dominated Texas's politics since the beginning of the century, imposing racial segregation and white supremacy.

name: texas
sentence: It held power until the adoption in the mid-1960s of national legislation on civil rights, which enforced the constitutional rights of all citizens.

name: texas
sentence: Although Texas was essentially a single-party state during this period and democratic primary was considered "the real election," the Democratic Party had conservative and liberal factions, which became more pronounced after the New Deal.

name: texas
sentence: In addition, several factions of the party briefly divided in the 1930s and 1940s.

name: texas
sentence: Conservative white voters in the state began supporting Republican presidential candidates in the middle of the 20th century.

name: texas
sentence: After this period, they also supported the Republicans for local and state offices, and most whites became members of the Republican Party.

name: texas
sentence: The party has also attracted some minorities, but many have continued to vote for democratic candidates.

name: texas
sentence: The passage to the Republican Party is largely attributed to the fact that the Democratic Party became increasingly liberal during the 20th century, and therefore increasingly uncontrollable with the average voter in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Since Texas was still a conservative state, voters turned to the GOP, which now more closely reflects their beliefs.

name: texas
sentence: Commentators also attributed this change to Republican political consultant Karl Rove, who led numerous political campaigns in Texas in the 1980s and 1990s.

name: texas
sentence: Other reasons cited included the court-ordered redistribution and demographic change in relation to the Sun Belt that favoured the Republican Party and conservatism.

name: texas
sentence: The redistribution of Congressional districts led by Republican Tom DeLay in 2003 in Texas was called by the New York Times "an extreme case of partisan Gerrymandering".

name: texas
sentence: A group of democratic legislators, the "Texas Eleven", fled the state in an effort to abuse quorum to prevent the Legislative Assembly from acting, but failed.

name: texas
sentence: The State had already undergone a redistribution as a result of the 2000 census.

name: texas
sentence: Despite these efforts, the legislator has adopted a map strongly in favour of Republicans, based on 2000 data and ignoring the estimates of nearly one million new residents in the state since then.

name: texas
sentence: Career lawyers and analysts in the Department of Justice objected to this plan as diluting the votes of African-American and Hispanic voters, but the political appointees stole and approved it.

name: texas
sentence: In the League of United Latin American Citizens v. Perry (2006), the National Supreme Court ruled in favour of the State (and Republicans).

name: texas
sentence: In the 2014 Texas election, the Tea Party movement made great strides, with many of the Tea Party's favourites elected to power, including Dan Patrick as Lieutenant Governor, Ken Paxton as Attorney General, as well as many other candidates including Conservative Republican Greg Abbott as Governor.

name: texas
sentence: Electors in Texas are leaning towards fiscal conservatism, while taking advantage of the enormous federal investment in the state in military and other facilities obtained by the South Solid power in the 20th century.

name: texas
sentence: They also have a tendency to have conservative social values.

name: texas
sentence: Since 1980, most voters in Texas have supported candidates for the Republican presidency.

name: texas
sentence: In 2000 and 2004, Republican George W. Bush won Texas with 59.3 and 60.1 per cent of the vote, in part because of his status as "preferential son" as former state governor.

name: texas
sentence: John McCain won the state in 2008, but with a lower margin of victory than Bush with 55 percent of the votes.

name: texas
sentence: Austin, Dallas, Houston and San Antonio are constantly focusing on democracy in local and state-wide elections.

name: texas
sentence: The demographic evolution of the state can lead to a change in its overall political alignment, as a majority population of Black and Hispanic/Latino voters supports the Democratic Party.

name: texas
sentence: Residents of counties along the Rio Grande closer to the Mexico-United States border, where there are many Latin American residents, generally vote for Democratic Party candidates, while most other rural and suburban areas of Texas voted for Republican Party candidates.

name: texas
sentence: As of the 2014 general election, a large majority of the members of the U.S. Texas House delegation are Republicans, as well as the two U.S.

name: texas
sentence: Honourable senators.

name: texas
sentence: At the 114th Congress of the United States, of the 36 districts of the Texas Congress, 24 were held by Republicans and 11 by Democrats.

name: texas
sentence: A seat is vacant.

name: texas
sentence: Texas Senators are John Cornyn and Ted Cruz.

name: texas
sentence: Since 1994, the Texans have not elected a democrat in a state-wide office.

name: texas
sentence: Democratic voters in the state are mainly Liberal and minority groups in Austin, Beaumont, Dallas, El Paso, Houston and San Antonio, as well as minority voters in eastern and southern Texas.

name: texas
sentence: Texas banned sanctuaries, but Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner promised the city won't help ICE agents.

name: texas
sentence: Texas has a reputation of very severe criminal punishment for criminal offences.

name: texas
sentence: It is one of the 32 states that use capital punishment, and since the Supreme Court of the United States authorized the resumption of capital punishment in 1976, 40 per cent of all United States executions have taken place in Texas.

name: texas
sentence: In 2008, Texas had the fourth highest rate of incarceration in the United States.It also has strong self-defence laws, allowing citizens to use lethal force to defend themselves, their families or their property.

name: texas
sentence: While American football has long been regarded as "king" in the state, Texans enjoy a wide variety of sports.

name: texas
sentence: Texans can promote a plethora of professional sports teams.

name: texas
sentence: In the Big Four professional leagues, Texas has two NFL teams (the Dallas Cowboys and the Houston Texans), two major League baseball teams (the Houston Astros and the Texas Rangers), three NBA teams (the San Antonio Spurs, the Houston Rockets and the Dallas Mavericks) and one National Hockey League team (the Dallas Stars).

name: texas
sentence: The Dallas–Fort Worth Metroplex is one of twelve metropolitan areas in the United States that host sports teams from all professional Big Four leagues.

name: texas
sentence: Apart from the Big Four, Texas also has a WNBA team (the Dallas Wings) and two Major Football League teams (the Houston Dynamo and FC Dallas).

name: texas
sentence: College athletics has a profound significance in Texas culture, especially football.

name: texas
sentence: The State has twelve schools in the I-FBS Division, the most populated in the country.

name: texas
sentence: Four of the state's universities, Baylor Bears, Texas Longhorns, TCU Horned Frogs and Texas Tech Red Raiders, participate in the Big 12 Conference.

name: texas
sentence: Texas A&M Aggies left the Big 12 and joined the South-East Conference in 2012, which led the Big 12 to invite TCU to join; TCU was previously at the Mountain West Conference.

name: texas
sentence: Houston Cougars and SMU Mustangs participate in the American Sport Conference.

name: texas
sentence: The Bobcats of the State of Texas and the Mavericks of the UT Arlington participate in the Sun Belt conference.

name: texas
sentence: Four of the state's schools claim at least one national football championship: Texas Longhorns, Texas A&M Agies, TCU Horned Frogs, and SMU Mustangs.

name: texas
sentence: According to an I-A Division investigation, there is a rivalry between the University of Oklahoma and the University of Texas at Austin, Red River Shootout, which ranks third in the nation.

name: texas
sentence: TCU horn frogs and SMU mustangs also share a rivalry and participate each year in the battle for the Iron Skullet.

name: texas
sentence: A fierce rivalry, the Lone Star Showdown, also exists between the two largest universities in the state, Texas A&M University and the University of Texas at Austin.

name: texas
sentence: The athletic side of Lone Star Showdown's rivalry was suspended after the Texas Aggies joined the Southeast Conference.

name: texas
sentence: The University Interscholastic League (UIL) organizes most competitions in primary and secondary schools.

name: texas
sentence: The events organised by UIL include athletics competitions (the most popular being football in high school) as well as artistic and academic disciplines.

name: texas
sentence: Texans also like rodeo.

name: texas
sentence: The world's first rodeo was hosted in Pecos, Texas.

name: texas
sentence: The annual Houston Animal Show and Rodeo is the world's largest rodeo.

name: texas
sentence: It begins with hikes from several points across the state that meet in Reliant Park.

name: texas
sentence: The Southwest Exhibition and Livestock Fair in Fort Worth is the oldest rodeo in the history of the state that integrates many of the most historic traditions into its annual events.

name: texas
sentence: Dallas hosts the Texas State Fair each year at Fair Park.

name: texas
sentence: The Texas Motor Speedway has hosted annual NASCAR Cup Series and IndyCar Series racing since 1997.

name: texas
sentence: Since 2012, Austin's Circuit of the Americas has hosted a World Formula 1 Championship tour – the first of a permanent road circuit in the United States since the 1980 Grand Prix at Watkins Glen International – as well as Grand Prix motorcycle races, FIA World Endurance Championship and United SportsCar Championship.

name: utah
sentence: Utah (YOO-tah, (listening) YOO-taw) is a state in the western United States of America.

name: utah
sentence: It is bordered by Colorado to the east, Wyoming to the northeast, Idaho to the north, Arizona to the south and Nevada to the west.

name: utah
sentence: It also touches a corner of New Mexico in the south-east.

name: utah
sentence: Of the fifty American states, Utah is the 13th by region; with a population of more than three million, it is the 30th most populous and the 11th least dense.

name: utah
sentence: Urban development is concentrated mainly in two areas: the Wasatch Front in the north-central part of the state, which is home to about two thirds of the population and includes the capital, Salt Lake City; and Washington County in the south, with over 170,000 inhabitants.

name: utah
sentence: The Utah has a dry, semi-arid climate in the desert, although its many mountains have a wide variety of climates, the highest points in the mountains of Uinta being above the wood line.

sentence: The main source of precipitation for the state is the Pacific Ocean, with the state usually on the way to the major Pacific storms from October to May.

sentence: Cotton canyons adjacent to Salt Lake City are in the right position to receive more precipitation from the lake.

name: utah
sentence: Weather systems likely to produce precipitation in Utah have decreased in number, while those that produce snowfall are decreasing at a much higher rate.

name: utah
sentence: Utah's temperatures are extreme, with cold temperatures in winter due to its rise, and very hot summers on a state-wide basis (with the exception of mountain areas and high mountain valleys).

sentence: Utah is usually protected from large explosions of cold air by mountains to the north and east of the state, although large arctic explosions may sometimes reach the state.

sentence: Mean high January temperatures range from about 30°F (−1°C) in some northern valleys to almost 55°F (13°C) in St. George.

sentence: In July, mean levels ranged from about 85 to 100 °F (29 to 38 °C).

sentence: The record temperature in Utah was 118°F (48°C), recorded south of St. George on July 4, 2007, and the low record was -69°F (−56°C), recorded at Peter Sinks in the Bear River Mountains in northern Utah on February 1, 1985.

name: utah
sentence: Utah, like most of the Western United States, has a few days of thunderstorms.

name: utah
sentence: They are most likely to occur during the monsoon season, from mid-July to mid-September, especially in southern and eastern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: Dry lightning strikes and the general dry weather often triggers forest fires in summer, while intense thunderstorms can cause flash floods, especially in the rugged southern Utah terrain.

name: utah
sentence: Although spring is the wettest season in northern Utah, late summer is the wettest period for much of southern and eastern Utah.

name: utah
sentence: The tornadoes are uncommon in Utah, with an average of two striking the state each year, rarely more intensity EF1.

sentence: Virginia is divided into 95 counties and 38 independent cities, the latter acting in many respects as county equivalents.

name: virginia
sentence: This general method of treatment of cities and counties is unique in Virginia; only three other independent cities exist elsewhere in the United States, each in a different state.

name: virginia
sentence: Virginia limits the authority of cities and counties to contrary laws expressly authorized by the Virginia General Assembly under what is known as the Dillon Rule.

name: virginia
sentence: In addition to independent cities, there are also incorporated cities that operate under their own government, but are part of a county.

sentence: Virginia has no other political subdivisions, such as villages or townships.

sentence: Virginia is predominantly Christian and Protestant; Baptist denominations combined to form the largest group with about 26 percent of the population in 2014, and a total of about 763,655 members in 2010.

sentence: Although the west of Washington has a marine climate similar to many coastal cities in Europe, there are exceptions such as the "Big Snow" events of 1880, 1881, 1893 and 1916, and the "Deep Freezing" winters of 1883–84, 1915–1916, 1949–1950 and 1955–1956, among others.

sentence: During these events, western Washington experienced up to 1.8 metres of snow, subzero temperatures (−18 °C), three months of snow on the ground, and frozen lakes and rivers for weeks.

sentence: The oscillation of the South greatly influences the weather during the cold season.

sentence: During the El Niño phase, the jet enters the United States further south through California, so late autumn and winter are drier than normal with less snow.

sentence: The La Niña phase reinforces the jet across the northwest Pacific, which means that Washington has more rain and snow than average.

sentence: In 2006, the University of Washington's Climate Impacts Group published The Impacts of Climate Change in Washington's Economy, a preliminary assessment of the risks and opportunities presented in view of the possibility of rising global temperatures and their effects on the state of Washington.

sentence: The rains in Washington vary considerably from east to west.

name: washington
sentence: The western part of the Olympic Peninsula receives up to 160 inches (4,100 mm) of precipitation each year, making it the wettest area of the 48 conjunctural states and a temperate rainforest.

name: washington
sentence: Weeks can go by without a clear day.

name: washington
sentence: The west slopes of the Cascade Range receive some of the largest annual snowfalls (in some locations, more than 200 inches or 5,100 millimetres of water equivalent) in the country.

name: washington
sentence: In the rain shadow area east of the Cascades, the annual precipitation is only 6 inches (150 mm).

name: washington
sentence: Precipitation then increases eastward toward the Rocky Mountains (approximately 120 miles east of the Idaho border).

name: washington
sentence: The Olympic mountains and waterfalls aggravate this climate pattern by causing an orographical uplift of blowing air masses inside the Pacific Ocean, resulting in high precipitation levels on the wind side of the mountains and low levels on the left side.

name: washington
sentence: This occurs most dramatically around the Olympic mountains and the Cascade chain.

name: washington
sentence: In both cases, the wind slopes facing the southwest receive high precipitation and mild and cool temperatures.

name: washington
sentence: While the Puget Sound lowlands are known for cloud and rain in winter, the western slopes of the Cascades receive larger amounts of precipitation, often falling as snow at higher altitudes.

name: washington
sentence: Mount Baker, near the northern border of the state, is one of the most snowy areas in the world.

name: washington
sentence: In 1999, he set the world record for snowfall in a single season: 1,140 inches (95 ft.; 29 m.).

name: washington
sentence: To the east of the Cascades, a large area suffers from heavy rain effects.

name: washington
sentence: Semi-arid conditions occur in much of eastern Washington State, with the strongest effects of rain shadow at relatively low elevations on the central Columbia Plateau, particularly in the area just east of the Columbia River, from the Snake River to the Okanagan Highland.

name: washington
sentence: Thus, instead of rainforests, much of eastern Washington is covered with dry grassland, shrub steppe and sand dunes.

name: washington
sentence: The mean annual temperature ranges from 51°F (11°C) on the Pacific coast to 40°F (4°C) in the northeast.

sentence: Both recordings were made east of the Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Western Washington is known for its mild climate, considerable fog, frequent cloud cover, long winter drizzles and warm temperate summers.

name: washington
sentence: The eastern region, which does not enjoy the general moderating effect of the Pacific Ocean, sometimes has an extreme climate.

name: washington
sentence: Cold Arctic fronts in winter and heat waves in summer are not rare.

name: washington
sentence: In the western region, temperatures were only 107°F (42°C) in Centralia and up to -6°F (−21°C) in Longview.

name: washington
sentence: The forests cover about half of the area of the state, mainly west of the Northern Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Approximately two-thirds of Washington's forest area is owned by the state, 64 per cent of which is federal.

name: washington
sentence: Common trees and plants in the area are camassia, Douglas-fir, hemlock, penstemon, ponderosa pine, western red cedar, and many ferns.

name: washington
sentence: The various wild areas of the state offer a sanctuary, with large populations of shorebirds and marine mammals.

name: washington
sentence: The shores of the Pacific surrounding the San Juan Islands are heavily populated by white-headed, grey and humpback whales.

name: washington
sentence: In East Washington, the flora is very different.

name: washington
sentence: Tumbleweeds and sage dominate the landscape in large parts of the country.

name: washington
sentence: Russian olive trees and other trees are common on the banks of rivers; however, apart from the banks of rivers, huge stretches of eastern Washington have no natural trees at all (although many trees have been planted and are irrigated by people, of course).

name: washington
sentence: There is a greater variety of flora in both the blue mountains and the eastern Cascades.

name: washington
sentence: Native mammals of the state include bat, black bear, bobcat, cougar, coyote, deer, elk, grey wolf, hare, moose, mountain beaver, muskrat, opossum, pocket gopher, rabbit, raccoon, river otter, snout and squirrel.

name: washington
sentence: Because of the breadth of geography, the state of Washington is home to several different ecoregions, which allow for a variety of bird species.

name: washington

sentence: Coastal bays and islands are often inhabited by many quantities of molluscs and whales.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a variety of units in the National Parks Service.

name: washington
sentence: These include Alta Lake National Park, the Roosevelt Lake National Recreation Area, the San Juan Islands National Wildlife Refuge, and three national parks - Olympic National Park, North Cascades National Park and Mount Rainier National Park.

name: washington

name: washington
sentence: Nearly 95 per cent (876,517 acres, 354,714 hectares, 3,547.14 square kilometres) of the Olympic National Park area has been designated "Wild Nature" under the National Nature Conservation System.

name: washington

name: washington

sentence: It is managed together as the national forest Okanogan–Wenatchee, covering a considerably larger area of approximately 3,239,404 acres (1,310,940 ha).

sentence: The skeletal remains of Kennewick Man, one of North America's oldest and most complete human remains, were discovered in Washington.

sentence: The region has been known to host mega-thrust earthquakes in the past, the last being the Cascadia earthquake of 1700.

name: washington
sentence: Prior to the arrival of the Europeans, the region had many Aboriginal tribes, remarkable for their totem poles and their adorned canoes and masks.

sentence: The smallpox epidemic of the 1770s devastated the American Aboriginal population.

name: washington
sentence: The first European landing recorded on the Washington coast was by Spanish captain Don Bruno de Heceta in 1775, aboard the Santiago, part of a fleet of two ships with the Sonora.

name: washington
sentence: He claimed the coastal lands to Prince William Sound for Spain as part of their rights under the Treaty of Tordesillas, which they maintained made the Pacific a "Spanish lake" and all its shores were part of the Spanish Empire.

name: washington
sentence: In 1778 the British explorer, Captain James Cook, saw Cape Flattery at the entrance to Juan de Fuca Strait, but Cook did not realize that the Strait existed.

name: washington
sentence: It was discovered only in 1787, Charles William Barkley, captain of the imperial eagle.

name: washington
sentence: The straits were explored further by Spanish explorers Manuel Quimper in 1790 and Francisco de Eliza in 1791, and British explorer George Vancouver in 1792.

name: washington
sentence: The British-Spanish Nootka Convention of 1790 ended Spanish exclusivity claims and opened the Northwest Coast to explorers and traders from other nations, including Great Britain and Russia, as well as the new United States.

name: washington
sentence: American captain Robert Gray (for which Grays Harbor County is named) discovered the mouth of the Columbia River.

name: washington
sentence: Britain and the United States accepted what has since been described as a "joint occupation" of land west of the continental ditch to the Pacific Ocean under the Anglo-American Convention of 1818, which established the 49th parallel as the international boundary west of Lake of the Woods to the Rocky Mountains.

name: washington
sentence: The resolution of territorial and treaty issues in the western Pacific has been postponed to a later date.

name: washington

name: washington
sentence: While American settlers were pouring into Oregon Country, the Hudson's Bay Company, which had previously discouraged the settlement because it was in conflict with the fur trade, reversed its position in an attempt to maintain British control of the Columbia district.

name: washington

name: washington

name: washington
sentence: In 1843, the Whitman settlement would help the Oregon Trail, the land-emigration route to the west, to settle for thousands of emigrants in the following decades.

name: washington
sentence: Marcus provided medical care to the Amerindians, but when Indian patients, who were not immune to new "European" diseases, died strikingly, while at the same time many white patients recovered, they held "the medical man" Marcus Whitman personally responsible, and murdered Whitman and twelve other white settlers in the Whitman massacre in 1847.

name: washington
sentence: This event triggered Cayuse's war between settlers and Indians.

name: washington
