name: washington
sentence: The State of Washington is one of the seven states that do not levy personal income tax.

name: washington
sentence: Nor does the Crown collect corporate income tax or tax on the deductible.

name: washington
sentence: Washington businesses are responsible for various other government levies, including business tax and labour tax (B & O), a gross revenue tax that imposes variable rates for different types of businesses.

name: washington
sentence: The sales tax on the Washington State base is 6.5%, which is combined with a local sales tax that varies by location.

name: washington
sentence: The combined rates of government sales tax and local retail sales tax increase the taxes paid by consumers, depending on the variable rates of local sales tax, usually between 7.5% and 10%.

name: washington
sentence: As of March 2017, the combined sales tax rate in Seattle and Tacoma was 10.1%.

name: washington
sentence: The cities of Lynnwood and Mill Creek have the highest sales tax rate in the state at 10.5 per cent.

name: washington
sentence: These taxes apply to services and goods.

name: washington
sentence: Most food is exempt from sales tax.

name: washington
sentence: However, prepared foods, food supplements, and soft drinks remain taxable.

name: washington
sentence: An excise tax applies to certain products such as petrol, cigarettes and alcoholic beverages.

name: washington
sentence: Property tax is the first tax levied in the state of Washington, and its collection accounts for about 30 per cent of the total revenue of the state and local government in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: It continues to be the largest source of income for public schools, fire protection, libraries, parks and recreation, and other special-purpose districts.

name: washington
sentence: All real and personal property is subject to tax, unless specifically exempted by law.

name: washington
sentence: Most personal property owned by individuals is exempt from taxation.

name: washington
sentence: The personal property tax applies to personal property used for the conduct of a business or to other personal property that is not exempt by law.

name: washington
sentence: All property taxes are paid in the office of the treasurer of the county where the property is located.

name: washington
sentence: Washington does not impose taxes on intangible assets such as bank accounts, shares or bonds.

name: washington
sentence: Nor does the State assess the tax on retirement income earned and received from another State.

name: washington
sentence: Washington does not collect inheritance tax.

name: washington
sentence: However, estate tax is decoupled from federal estate tax laws and, therefore, the Crown imposes its own estate tax.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has the 18th highest effective per capita tax rate in the United States in 2017.

name: washington
sentence: Their tax policy differs from that of neighbouring Oregon, which collects no sales tax, but imposes a personal income tax.

name: washington
sentence: The result is border economic anomalies in the Portland-Vancouver metropolitan area.

name: washington
sentence: Other border economies exist with neighbouring countries of British Columbia and Idaho.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is a major agricultural state.

name: washington
sentence: The following figures are provided by the State Department of Agriculture in Washington and the USDA, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Washington Field Office.

name: washington
sentence: For 2013, the total value of Washington's agricultural products was $10.2 billion.In 2013, Washington ranked first among the countries in the production of red raspberries (92.7 per cent of total U.S. production), hops (79.2 per cent), mint oil (72.9 per cent), wrinkled seed peas (60 per cent), apples (57%), sweet cherries (50.9 per cent), pears (49.5 per cent), Concord grapes (36.5 per cent).

name: washington
sentence: Washington is also the second largest producer of fall potatoes (one quarter of domestic production), nectarines, apricots, grapes (all varieties), sweet corn for processing (one quarter of domestic production) and summer onions (one fifth of domestic production).

name: washington
sentence: The apple industry is of particular importance for Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Due to the favourable climate of dry and warm summers and cold winters in central Washington, the state has led the United States in apple production since the 1920s.

name: washington
sentence: Two regions account for the vast majority of state apple cultivation: the Wenatchee-Okanogan region (including the counties of Chelan, Okanogan, Douglas, and Grant) and the Yakima region (including the counties of Yakima, Benton, and Kittitas).

name: washington
sentence: Washington produces seven main varieties of apples that are exported to more than sixty countries.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is second in the U.S. in wine production, behind only California.

name: washington
sentence: In 2006, the State had more than 31,000 acres (130 km2) of vineyards, a harvest of 120,000 short tons of grapes (109,000 t) and exports to more than forty countries around the world from the state's 600 cellars.

name: washington
sentence: Although there are some wine-growing activities in the cooler, the wetter western half of the state, almost all (99%) of the wine grape production takes place in the eastern half of the desert.

name: washington
sentence: The rain shadow of the Cascade chain leaves the Columbia River basin with approximately 8 inches (200 mm) of annual rain, making irrigation and water rights of paramount interest to the Washington wine industry.

name: washington
sentence: Viticulture in the state is also influenced by long hours of sunshine (on average, two more hours per day than in California during the growing season) and constant temperatures.

name: washington
sentence: As of December 2014, 124 broadband service providers provide services to the state of Washington; 93% of consumers have access to broadband speeds of 25/3Mbit/s or more.

name: washington
sentence: Between 2009 and 2014, the Washington State broadband project received $7.3 million in federal grants, but the program was discontinued in 2014.

name: washington
sentence: In terms of infrastructure, an additional $166 million has been provided since 2011 for broadband infrastructure projects in Washington State.

name: washington
sentence: US News & World Report ranked Washington 2nd at the national level for household Internet access and 6th for online download speed, based on 2014 and 2015 data.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has a state highway system, called State Roads, as well as a vast ferry network that is the largest in the nation and the third largest in the world.

name: washington
sentence: There are 140 public airfields in Washington, including 16 airports belonging to the Washington State Department of Transportation.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle-Tacoma International Airport (Sea-Tac) is the major commercial airport in the major city of Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: Boeing Field in Seattle is one of the busiest primary airports in the U.S.

name: washington
sentence: There are vast streams around Washington's largest cities, including Seattle, Bellevue, Tacoma and Olympia.

name: washington
sentence: The state highways include an extensive network of bridges and the largest ferry network in the United States to meet transportation needs in the Puget Sound area.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington Seaway is a fleet of twenty-eight ferries operating on Puget Sound and its inland waterways up to 20 different ports of call, making nearly 147,000 sails each year.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is home to four of the world's five longest floating bridges: the Evergreen Point Floating Bridge, the Lacey V. Murrow Memorial Bridge and the Homer M. Hadley Memorial Bridge over Lake Washington, and the Hood Canal Bridge between the Olympic Peninsula and Kitsap Peninsula.

name: washington
sentence: Among its most famous bridges are the Tacoma Narrows Bridge, which collapsed in 1940 and was rebuilt.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has several seaports on the Pacific Ocean, including Seattle, Tacoma, Kalama, Anacortes, Vancouver, Longview, Grays Harbor, Olympia and Port Angeles.

name: washington
sentence: The Cascade mountain range also prevents transportation.

name: washington
sentence: Washington operates and maintains roads over seven mountain passes and eight minor passes.

name: washington
sentence: During the winter months, some of these passes are plowed, sanded and kept safe with avalanche control.

name: washington
sentence: Not all remain open in the winter.

name: washington
sentence: The North Cascades Highway, State Route 20, closes each year due to snowfall and avalanches in the Washington Pass area.

name: washington
sentence: Le Cayuse and the Chinook also pass east of Mount Rainier.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is crossed by a number of freight railways, and the Amtrak Cascade Passenger Route between Eugene, Oregon and Vancouver, B.C. is the eighth busiest Amtrak service of the US Seattle King Street Station, the busiest station in Washington, and the 15th busiest in the United States, serves as a terminus for the two long-distance Amtrak routes in Washington, the Empire Builder in Chicago and the Coast Starlight in Los Angeles.

name: washington
sentence: Sounder suburban rail service operates in Seattle and surrounding cities between Everett and Lakewood.

name: washington
sentence: The long distance network includes the Cascade Tunnel, the longest railway tunnel in the United States, which is part of the Stevens Pass on the BNSF Northern Transcom.

name: washington
sentence: The Sound Transit Link light train is currently operating in the Seattle area at 32 km and Tacoma at 2.6 km.

name: washington
sentence: The whole system has a funded expansion plan that will extend the light rail to a total of 116 miles by 2041.

name: washington
sentence: Seattle also has a 6.1 km tramway network with two lines and plans to continue to expand by 2025.

name: washington
sentence: Bus systems exist throughout the state, the most frequented being King County Metro, located in Seattle and King County, with just over 122 million runners in 2017.

name: washington
sentence: Vancouver residents resisted proposals to expand the transit system from Portland to Washington.

name: washington
sentence: Hanford Nuclear Reservation is currently the most contaminated nuclear site in the United States and is the object of the largest environmental clean-up in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Radioactive material is leaking from Hanford into the environment.

name: washington
sentence: In 2007, Washington became the first state in the country to target all forms of highly toxic brominated flame retardants called PBDEs with a view to eliminating the many household products in which they are used.

name: washington
sentence: A 2004 study of 40 mothers in Oregon, Washington, British Columbia, and Montana found PBDEs in the breast milk of each woman tested.

name: washington
sentence: Three recent studies from the Washington State Department of Ecology have shown that toxic chemicals banned decades ago persist in the environment and are concentrated in the food chain.

name: washington
sentence: In one of these studies, government scientists found unacceptable levels of toxic substances in 93 samples of freshwater fish from 45 sites.

name: washington
sentence: Toxic substances included PCBs, dioxins, two chlorinated pesticides, DDE, dieldrin, and PBDEs.

name: washington
sentence: As a result of this study, the Department will investigate sources of PCBs in the Wenatchee River, where unsafe concentrations of PCBs have been found in mountain whitefish.

name: washington
sentence: Based on 2007 information and an ecological study conducted in 2004, the Washington State Department of Health advises the public not to eat mountain whitefish from the Wenatchee River, from Lavenworth downstream to the point where the river reaches Colombia, due to unsanitary levels of PCBs.

name: washington
sentence: The results of the study also showed high levels of contaminants in fish tissues collected by scientists from Lake Washington and the Spokane River, where fish consumption advisories are already in effect.

name: washington
sentence: On March 27, 2006, Governor Christine Gregoire signed Bill 2322, which was recently approved by the House.

name: washington
sentence: This bill would limit the phosphorus content of detergents to dishes throughout the state to 0.5 per cent over the next six years.

name: washington
sentence: Although the ban would be effective across the state in 2010, it would take place in Whatcom County, Spokane County and Clark County in 2008.

name: washington
sentence: A recent discovery had associated high phosphorus levels in water with a boom in the algal population.

name: washington
sentence: An invasive amount of algae in water bodies would lead to a variety of excess ecological and technological problems.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington Executive is headed by a governor elected for a four-year term.

name: washington
sentence: The current state-wide elected representatives are:

name: washington
sentence: The bicameral Parliament of the State of Washington is the legislative power of the State.

name: washington
sentence: The State legislature consists of a lower House of Representatives and a higher Senate of State.

name: washington
sentence: The state is divided into 49 legislative districts of equal population, each of which elects two representatives and one senator.

name: washington
sentence: Representatives are appointed for a term of two years, while senators are appointed for a term of four years.

name: washington
sentence: There's no term limit.

name: washington
sentence: The Democratic Party has a majority in the House and in the Senate.

name: washington
sentence: The Supreme Court of Washington is the highest court in the state.

name: washington
sentence: Nine judges sit on the bench and are elected throughout the state.

name: washington
sentence: The two current American senators in Washington are Patty Murray and Maria Cantwell, two democrats.

name: washington
sentence: Murray has been the state's representative since 1993, when Cantwell was first elected in 2001.

name: washington
sentence: The State is one of four with two senators.

name: washington
sentence: The ten representatives of Washington in the United States House of Representatives (see map of districts) from the 2020 elections were Suzan DelBene (D-1), Rick Larsen (D-2), Jaime Herrera Beutler (R-3), Dan Newhouse (R-4), Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-5), Derek Kilmer (D-6), Pramila Jayapal (D-7), Kim Schrier (D-8), Adam Smith (D-9) and Marilyn Strickland (D-10).

name: washington
sentence: Due to the redistribution of Congress following the 2010 census, Washington obtained a seat in the United States House of Representatives.

name: washington
sentence: With an additional seat, Washington also obtained an election vote, bringing its total to 12.

name: washington
sentence: The state is generally considered politically divided by the Cascade Mountains, with the western Washington being liberal (especially corridor I-5) and the eastern Washington being conservative.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has voted for the democratic presidential candidate in each election since 1988.

name: washington
sentence: Because of the large population in Western Washington, democrats generally perform better throughout the state.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle combined statistical area, home to nearly two-thirds of Washington's population, generally offers stronger democratic margins than most other parts of western Washington.

name: washington
sentence: This is particularly true in King County, where Seattle and nearly a third of the state population live.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was considered a pivotal state in 1968, and it was the only Western state to give its electoral votes to democratic candidate Hubert Humphrey on his Republican opponent Richard Nixon.

name: washington
sentence: Washington was considered a part of the 1994 Republican Revolution and had the largest pick-up in the house for the Republicans, who took seven of the nine seats in the Washington House.

name: washington
sentence: However, this domination did not last long, since the Democrats took a seat in the 1996 elections and two in 1998, giving the Democrats a majority of 5 to 4.

name: washington
sentence: The office of Governor is held by Democratic Jay Inslee, who was elected in his first term in the 2012 elections.

name: washington
sentence: In 2013 and 2014, both chambers of the Washington State Assembly (the Washington Senate and the Washington House of Representatives) were controlled by the Democrats.

name: washington
sentence: The Senate of State was under republican control, due to the accession of two Republican Democrats to form the caucus of the majority coalition.

name: washington
sentence: After the 2014 elections, the Democrats retained control of the House, while the Republicans took a majority in the Senate without the need for a coalition.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2017, a special election gave the Democrats a majority of one seat in the Senate and full control over the state government.

name: washington
sentence: Since then, in the 2018 elections, the Democrats have only enlarged their majority.

name: washington
sentence: No state has gone any further without a Republican governor than Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The Democrats have controlled the Governor of Washington's Mansion for 36 years; the last Republican governor is John Spellman, who left office in 1985.

name: washington
sentence: Washington has not voted for a Republican senator, governor or presidential candidate since 1994, linking Delaware to the longest series in the country.

name: washington
sentence: Washington uses the general non-partisan primary system after the 872 initiative was approved in 2004.

name: washington
sentence: All candidates run in the same ballot in the primary elections and the first two candidates advance in the November general election, regardless of their party affiliation.

name: washington
sentence: This led to several general election matches of the same party.

name: washington
sentence: Washington is one of three states that legalized assisted suicide.

name: washington
sentence: In 2008, the Washington Death with Dignity Act was passed and became a law.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2009, voters in Washington approved comprehensive national partnerships through referendum 71, marking the first time that voters in any state more widely recognize same-sex relationships in the ballot box.

name: washington
sentence: Three years later, in November 2012, same-sex marriage was confirmed by referendum 74, making Washington one of the only three states to have approved same-sex marriage through popular vote.

name: washington
sentence: Also in November 2012, Washington was one of the first two states to approve the sale and legal possession of cannabis for both recreational uses under the 502 Initiative.

name: washington
sentence: Although marijuana is still illegal under U.S. federal law, people aged 21 years and over in Washington State can own up to one ounce of marijuana, 16 ounces of solid marijuana products, 72 ounces of liquid marijuana products, or any combination of the three, and legally consume marijuana and marijuana products.

name: washington
sentence: In November 2016, voters approved the 1433 initiative, which requires employers to guarantee sick leave with pay to most workers.

name: washington
sentence: On January 1, 2018, the law came into force, Washington becoming the seventh state with paid sick leave.

name: washington
sentence: With the adoption of the 1639 initiative in the 2018 election, Washington passed stricter firearms laws.

name: washington
sentence: Washington enacted in May 2019 a measure in favour of sanctuary cities, similar to the laws of California and Oregon, which are among the strongest state-wide mandates of the nation.

name: washington
sentence: In 2019, Parliament passed the Clean Energy Transformation Act, which requires that all electricity sales come from zero carbon sources by 2045 and zero net by 2030.

name: washington
sentence: Since the school year 2008-2009, 1,040,750 students were enrolled in primary and secondary schools in Washington, D.C., and 59,562 teachers were employed to educate them.

name: washington
sentence: As of August 2009, the State had 295 school districts served by nine districts of educational services.

name: washington
sentence: The Washington School Information Processing Cooperative (a not-for-profit state agency) provides information management systems for financial and human resources and student data.

name: washington
sentence: Primary and secondary schools report to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) of Washington State.

name: washington
sentence: High school students and the elderly in Washington have the opportunity to use the state's Running Start program.

name: washington
sentence: Engaged by the State legislature in 1990, it allows students to attend higher education institutions at the expense of the State, simultaneously obtaining high school and university credits.

name: washington
sentence: There are also several public arts secondary schools, including the Tacoma School of the Arts, the Vancouver School of Arts and Academics, and The Center School.

name: washington
sentence: There are also four high schools of science and mathematics: one in the three cities known as Delta, the other in Tacoma as SAMI, the other in Seattle as Raisbeck Aviation High School, and the other in Redmond as Tesla STEM High School.

name: washington
sentence: There are over 40 higher education institutions in Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The State has large research universities, technical schools, religious schools and private vocational schools.

name: washington
sentence: Colleges and universities include Washington University, Seattle University, Washington State University, East Washington University, Washington Central University, Saint Martin University, Lutheran Pacific University, Gonzaga University, Puget Sound University, Evergreen State College and Whitman College.

name: washington
sentence: The two largest health insurers in 2017 were Premera Blue Cross, with a market share of 24 percent, followed by Kaiser Permanente at 21 percent.

name: washington
sentence: For the individual market, Molina Healthcare had the highest share of 23%.

name: washington
sentence: The state adopted the Washington Healthplanfinder system in 2014 following the adoption of the Federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (also known as "ObamaCare").

name: washington
sentence: The state of Washington reformed its health care system in 1993 through the Washington Health Services Act.

name: washington
sentence: The Act requires individuals to obtain health insurance or face penalties, and requires employers to provide insurance to employees.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, health insurance companies were obliged to sell policies to all persons, regardless of pre-existing conditions, and to cover basic benefits.

name: washington
sentence: The Act was substantially repealed in 1995 before it could enter into force.

name: washington
sentence: Hospitals exist throughout the state, but many of Washington's best known medical facilities are located in and around Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle-Tacome area has five major hospitals: Harborview Medical Center, University of Washington Medical Center, Swedish Medical Center, MultiCare Tacoma General Hospital and St. Joseph Medical Center.

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle area hospitals are concentrated on First Hill, which houses Virginia Mason Medical Center (the neighborhood received the nickname "Pill Hill" because of the high concentration of health facilities).

name: washington
sentence: The Seattle Open Invitational Golf Tournament was part of the PGA Tour from the 1930s to the 1960s.

name: washington
sentence: The GTE Northwest Classic has been part of Senator PGA's 1986-1995 tour and the Boeing Classic since 2005.

name: washington
sentence: In addition, the US Open 2015 took place in Chambers Bay, and several major tournaments were held at the Sahalee Country Club.

name: washington
sentence: Pacific Raceways is a motorsport venue that has hosted the Northwest Nationals of the NHRA Mello Yello Drag Racing Series and a round of the Trans-Am Series.

name: washington
sentence: The WTA Seattle tennis tournament is part of the WTA Tour from 1977 to 1982.

name: washington
sentence: The Climate Pledge Arena organized several mixed martial arts events, such as UFC Fight Night: Nogueira vs. Davis, UFC on Fox: Henderson vs. Diaz, and UFC on Fox: Johnson vs. Moraga.

name: washington
sentence: Four U.S. Navy ships, including two combat ships, were named USWashington in honour of the State.

name: washington
sentence: The former ships had held this name in honor of George Washington.

name: washington
sentence: The state nickname, "The Evergreen State", was proposed in 1890 by Charles T. Conover of Seattle.

name: washington
sentence: The name was popular because the forests were full of evergreen trees and the abundance of rain kept the shrubs and green grasses throughout the year.

name: washington
sentence: Although the nickname is widely used by the State, for example on vehicle license plates, it has not been officially adopted.

name: washington
sentence: The State-funded Evergreen State College in Olympia also derives its name from that nickname.

name: washington
sentence: The state song is "Washington, My Home", the state bird is American red gold, the state fruit is the apple, and the state vegetable is the mild Walla Walla onion.

name: washington
sentence: State dance, adopted in 1979, is square dance.

name: washington
sentence: The state tree is the Western hemlock.

name: washington
sentence: The flower of the State is the rhododendron of the coast.

name: washington
sentence: The state fish is the steel head.

name: washington
sentence: The folk song of the state is "Roll On, Columbia, Roll On" by Woody Guthrie.

name: washington
sentence: The unofficial but popularly accepted rock song is Louie Louie.

name: washington
sentence: State grass is bluebunch wheat grass.

name: washington
sentence: The insect of the state is the danner libellule green.

name: washington
sentence: The jewel of the state is the petrified wood.

name: washington
sentence: The State fossil is the Colombian mammoth.

name: washington
sentence: The marine mammal is the Orca.

name: washington
sentence: The state's land mammal is the Olympic marmot.

name: washington
sentence: The state seal (also in the state flag) was inspired by the unfinished portrait of President George Washington by Gilbert Stuart.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is a state in the Appalachian and Middle Atlantic regions of the southern United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is bordered by Pennsylvania in the northeast, Maryland in the east and northeast, Virginia in the southeast, Kentucky in the southwest and Ohio in the northwest.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia is the 41st state by region and ranks 38th, with about 1.791 million residents.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Charleston is the capital and the largest city.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia became a state after the Wheeling Conventions of 1861, at the beginning of the American Civil War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Delegates from the unionist counties in northwestern Virginia decided to move away from Virginia, which also included secessionist counties in the new state.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia was admitted to the Union on 20 June 1863, and was a key frontier state during the war.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It was the only state to form by separating itself from a Confederate state, the first to separate itself from any state from Maine separated from Massachusetts, and was one of the two states (with Nevada) admitted to the Union during the American Civil War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: While some of its inhabitants were slaves, most were Yemeni farmers, and delegates provided for the progressive abolition of slavery in the new state constitution and the state parliament adopted the 13th amendment which abolished slavery on February 3, 1865.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Northern Panhandle extends adjacent to Pennsylvania and Ohio, forming a tri-state area, with the cities of Wheeling and Weirton in Western Virginia just across the border of the Pittsburgh Metropolitan Area, while Bluefield is less than 70 miles (110 km) from North Carolina.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Huntington in the southeast is close to Ohio and Kentucky states, while Martinsburg and Harpers Ferry in the east Panhandle region are considered to be part of the Washington metropolitan area, between Maryland and Virginia states.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The unique position of Western Virginia means that it is often included in several geographic areas in the United States, including the Mid-Atlantic, Upland South and South-East United States.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is the only State that is entirely within the area served by the Appalachian Regional Commission; the area is commonly defined as "Appalachia".

name: west_virginia
sentence: The State is known for its hilly mountains and hills, historically important logging and coal mining industries, as well as its political and professional history.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It is also known for a wide range of outdoor recreational activities, including skiing, water rafting, fishing, hiking, backpacking, mountain biking, climbing and hunting.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Vandalia, Kanawha, Appalachia and West Virginia were also named.

name: west_virginia
sentence: La Capitale was originally Wheeling, before moving to Charleston.

name: west_virginia
sentence: He was then moved to Wheeling and then to his current place in Charleston.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Whereas it is now a highly republican state, it was once a democratic state, between the Roosevelt era and 2000.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The first governor was Arthur Boreman.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Many man-made mounds of land from various prehistoric mound-building cultures survive, especially in the current areas of Moundsville, South Charleston and Romney.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The artifacts found there bear witness to village societies.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They had a tribal trading system culture that produced cold-worked copper parts.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the 1670s, during the beaver wars, the powerful Iroquois, five Allied nations now based in New York and Pennsylvania, expelled other American Indian tribes from the area to reserve the upper Ohio Valley as a hunting ground.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Siwan language tribes, such as the Moneton, had already been registered in the region.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A century later, the area now identified as Western Virginia was also contested by the Anglo-Americans, the colonies of Pennsylvania and Virginia claiming territorial rights under their colonial charters to that region before the American Revolutionary War.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some speculative land companies, such as Vandalia Company, and later Ohio Company and Indiana Company, attempted to legitimize their land claims in parts of West Virginia and today Kentucky, but failed.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This rivalry has led some settlers to ask the Continental Congress to create a new territory called Westsylvania.

name: west_virginia
sentence: With the federal settlement of the border dispute between Pennsylvania and Virginia, creating Kentucky County, Virginia, the Kentuckians "were satisfied...and the inhabitants of much of West Virginia were grateful."

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Crown considered the West Virginia region to be part of the British Virginia colony from 1607 to 1776.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The United States considered the area to be the western part of the state of Virginia (commonly known as Trans-Allegheny Virginia) from 1776 to 1863, prior to the formation of Western Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Its inhabitants were dissatisfied for years with their position in Virginia, the government being dominated by the elite planters in the Tidewater and Piedmont regions.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Legislative Assembly had electoral malfeasances, based on the counting of slaves to the regional populations, and white residents of the West were under-represented in the State Legislative Assembly.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Subsistence farmers and Yemeni farmers lived in the west and were generally less in favour of slavery, although many counties were divided on their support.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The inhabitants of this region became more strongly divided after the elite planters of eastern Virginia voted for secession of the Union during the civil war.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The residents of the western and northern counties established a separate government under Francis Pierpont in 1861, which they called the restored government.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Most voted to separate themselves from Virginia, and the new state was admitted to the Union in 1863.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In 1864, a state constitutional convention drafted a constitution, which was ratified by the legislator without putting it to the popular vote.

name: west_virginia
sentence: West Virginia abolished slavery through a gradual process and temporarily denied its rights to men who had served as confederation or fought for confederation.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The history of West Virginia has been deeply affected by its mountainous terrain, its many vast river valleys and its rich natural resources.

name: west_virginia
sentence: All these factors are at the origin of its economy and the way of life of its inhabitants, who tend to live in many small, relatively isolated communities in the mountain valleys.

name: west_virginia
sentence: An analysis of a local stalagmite in 2010 revealed that Amerindians burned forests to clear the land as early as 100 B.C.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Some regional tribes of the Eastern Woodlands, which were late prehistoric, were more engaged in hunting and fishing, using the method of gardening of the Eastern Agricultural Complex, which used fire to eliminate undergrowth in some areas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Another group progressed towards the longer and advanced method of gardening the fields of cultivation.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In addition, the Aboriginal elders of the state cultivated tobacco until the early stages of history.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It has been used in numerous social and religious rituals.

name: west_virginia
sentence: "Maize has made a significant contribution to food only after 1150 BP," Mills (OSU 2003).

name: west_virginia
sentence: Finally, tribal villages began to rely on corn to feed their turkey herds, while Kanawha Fort Ancients was engaged in bird-breeding.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The local Indians made corn bread and a flat rye bread called "bannock" as they emerged from the protohistoric era.

name: west_virginia
sentence: A horizon that extends a little before the beginning of the eighteenth century is sometimes called the acculturating culture of the Fireside Cabin.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Trade posts were established by European traders along the Potomac and James rivers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The tribes that inhabited West Virginia from 1600 were the Siouan Monongahela culture to the north, the Fort Antique culture along the Ohio River from Monongahela to Kentucky and extending an unknown distance inland, and the Siouan Tutelo and Moneton tribes to the east.

name: west_virginia
sentence: There was also the Iroquoian Susquehannock in the area approximately east of the Monongahela River and north of the Monongahela National Forest, a possible tribe called the Senatorndoa, or Shenandoah, in the Shenandoah Valley and perhaps the easternmost point of the State was the home of the Manahoac people.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Monongahelas may have been the same as a people known as Calicua, or Cali.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Perhaps the following was the same tribe: Moneton, Moheton, Senatorndoa, Tomahitan.

name: west_virginia
sentence: During the Beaver Wars, other tribes settled in the area.

name: west_virginia
sentence: There were the Iroquoians Tiontatecaga (also Little Mingo, Guyandotte), who seem to have separated from the Petun after being defeated by the Iroquois.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They eventually moved somewhere between the Kanawha and Little Kanawha rivers.

name: west_virginia
sentence: In the 1750s, when the Mingo Senatorca seceded from the Iroquois and returned to the Ohio River Valley, they argued that this tribe had merged with them.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Shawnee also arrived, but were mainly stationed in the former Monongahela territory around 1750, but they extended their influence throughout the Ohio area.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They were the last native tribe of West Virginia and were hunted by the United States during the Shawnee Wars (1811–13).

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Erie, which were driven out of Ohio around 1655, are now considered the same as the Westo, which invaded to South Carolina before being destroyed in the 1680s.

name: west_virginia
sentence: If that were the case, their path would have led them to cross West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The historical movement of the Tutelo, as well as the carbon dates for the Ancient Forts, seem to correspond to the given period of 1655–70 as the time of their removal.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Susquehannocks were the first participants in the Beaver Wars, but they were cut off from Ohio by the Iroquois around 1630 and found themselves in terrible straits.

name: west_virginia
sentence: From illness to constant war and inability to provide for their financial needs, they began to collapse and settle increasingly to the east, to the Susquehanna River in eastern Pennsylvania.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Manahoac were probably hunted in the 1680s when the Iroquois began to invade Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Siwan tribes settled in North Carolina and later returned as a tribe, known as the Blackfoot of the East, or Christannas.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Westo did not secure the territory that they conquered.

name: west_virginia
sentence: Before they even left, the displaced indigenous people from the south flooded into newly conquered areas and took care of them.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These became known as Shattaras, or West Virginia Cherokees.

name: west_virginia
sentence: They accepted and merged with the Monetons, who began to name themselves as the Mohetons.

name: west_virginia
sentence: The Calicua also began to designate themselves as Cherokees shortly after, showing an apparent new fusion.

name: west_virginia
sentence: These Shattaras were closely related to the tribes that formed in the south following the Westo – the Yuchi and Cherokee.

name: west_virginia

sentence: West Virginia's legislature is bicameral.

name: west_virginia
sentence: It consists of the House of Delegates and the Senator, both housed in the Capitol of the state of West Virginia.

name: west_virginia
sentence: This is a citizen legislature, which means that the legislative office is not a full-time job, but rather a part-time job.

name: west_virginia
sentence: As a result, legislators often have full-time employment in their community of residence.

name: west_virginia
sentence: As a rule, the legislature is in session for 60 days between January and early April.

sentence: Wisconsin is a state in the U.S. Midwest Great Lakes region bordered by Minnesota to the west; Iowa to the southwest; Illinois to the south; Lake Michigan to the east; Michigan to the northeast; and Lake Superior to the north.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The word Wisconsin comes from the name given to the Wisconsin River by one of the Algonquian Indian groups living in the region at the time of European contact.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The French explorer Jacques Marquette was the first European to reach the Wisconsin River, arriving in 1673 and calling the Meskousing River (probably meskowsin) in his newspaper.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Subsequently, the French authors changed the spelling of Meskousing to Ouisconsin, which over time became the name of the Wisconsin River and surrounding lands.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Anglophones anglicize Ouisconsin's spelling in Wisconsin when they began to arrive in large numbers in the early 19th century.

name: wisconsin
sentence: The Algonquian word for Wisconsin and its original meaning both became obscure.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Although interpretations vary, most involve the river and red sandstone bordering its banks.

name: wisconsin
sentence: A main theory holds that the name comes from the word Miami Meskonsing, meaning "it is red", a reference to the setting of the Wisconsin River as it flows through the reddish sandstone of Wisconsin Dells.

name: wisconsin
sentence: Other theories include allegations that the name comes from a variety of Ojibwa words meaning "red stone place", "where waters come together" or "great rock".

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is a landlocked state in the western United States of America.

sentence: The main drivers of Wyoming's economy are tourism and the extraction of minerals such as coal, oil, natural gas and trone.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming's climate is generally semi-arid and continental (Köppen climate classification BSk), and is drier and more windy compared to most United States with higher extreme temperatures.

name: wyoming
sentence: This is largely due to the topography of the State.

name: wyoming
sentence: Summers at Wyoming are warm with high July temperatures averaged between 85 and 95°F (29 and 35°C) in most of the state.

name: wyoming
sentence: However, with increasing elevation, this average falls rapidly with locations above 9,000 feet (2,700 m) on average around 70°F (21°C).

name: wyoming
sentence: Summer nights through the state are characterized by rapid cooling with even the warmest places on average in the range of 50 to 60°F (10 to 16°C) at night.

name: wyoming
sentence: In most of the condition, most precipitation tends to fall in late spring and early summer.

name: wyoming
sentence: Winters are cold, but are variable with sometimes extremely cold periods interspersed between generally mild periods, with Chinook winds providing exceptionally warm temperatures in some places.

name: wyoming
sentence: Wyoming is a dry condition with much of the land receiving less than 10 inches (250 mm) of rain per year.

name: wyoming
sentence: Precipitation depends on altitude with lower areas in the Big Horn Basin on average from 5 to 8 inches (130 to 200 mm) (which makes the region a real desert).

name: wyoming
sentence: The lower areas in the North and the eastern plains generally have an average of about 10 to 12 inches (250 to 300 mm), making the climate semi-arid.

name: wyoming
sentence: Some mountain areas receive a good amount of precipitation, 20 inches (510 mm) or more, mostly as snow, sometimes 200 inches (510 cm) or more per year.

name: wyoming
sentence: The highest temperature recorded by the State is 114°F (46°C) at Basin on 12 July 1900 and the lowest recorded temperature is -66°F (−54°C) at Riverside on 9 February 1933.

name: wyoming
sentence: The number of storm days varies from state to state, with the southeastern plains having the most storm days.

name: wyoming
sentence: Storm activity in the state is higher in late spring and early summer.

name: wyoming
sentence: The southeastern corner of the state is the most vulnerable part of the state to tornado.

name: wyoming
sentence: By moving away from this point and westward, the incidence of tornadoes decreases considerably with the western part of the state showing little vulnerability.

name: wyoming
sentence: The tornadoes, where they occur, tend to be small and brief, unlike some more easterly tornadoes.

name: wyoming
sentence: As indicated in Wyoming Territory Designation Legislation, the boundaries of Wyoming are 41°N and 45°N latitude lines, and 104°3'W and 111°3'W (27 and 34 west of the Washington Meridian), a geodetic quadrangle.

sentence: Wyoming is one of only three states (the others being Colorado and Utah) with boundaries defined only by "right" lines.

sentence: What is now southwestern Wyoming became part of the Spanish Empire, and later Mexican territory, Alta California, until it was ceded to the United States in 1848 at the end of the Mexican-American war.

sentence: The French-Canadian trappers of Quebec and Montreal venture into the region at the end of the 18th century, leaving French toponyms such as Téton and La Ramie.

name: wyoming
sentence: John Colter, a member of the Lewis and Clark Expedition, himself led by Toussaint Charbonneau and his young wife Shoshone, Sacagawea, described the area for the first time in 1807.

sentence: In 1850 Jim Bridger located what is now known as Bridger Pass, which the Union Pacific Railroad used in 1868, as did Interstate 80, 90 years later.

sentence: Bridger also explored Yellowstone and filed reports on the area, which, like Colter's, were widely regarded as great tales at the time.

name: wyoming
sentence: The region acquired Wyoming's name in 1865, when representative James Mitchell Ashley of Ohio introduced a bill to Congress to provide a "temporary government for Wyoming's territory."

sentence: The territory was named after the Wyoming Valley in Pennsylvania, famous for Thomas Campbell's 1809 poem Gertrude of Wyoming, based on the Battle of Wyoming in the American Revolutionary War.

sentence: The name eventually derives from the word Munsee xwé:wam=nk, meaning "to the great dish of the river".

sentence: Wyoming lacked significant deposits of gold and silver, unlike the mineral-rich Colorado, and did not experience the boom of the related Colorado population.

sentence: On December 10, 1869, the Governor of the Territory John Allen Campbell extended the right to vote to women, making Wyoming the first territory and, later, the State of the United States, granting women the right to vote.

sentence: In addition, in 1924 Wyoming became the first state to elect a woman governor, Nellie Tayloe Ross, who took office in January 1925.
